number of helpful: 10 of 11 people (91%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 13, 2015
												Alright, this is going to be a decently detailed review so bear with me here.For a TL;DR version: This game is a fun yet grindy instance-based themepark MMO. You will not enjoy this at all if you dislike any of the aforementioned. I have a love-hate relationship with this game. I have been playing since Chimera server release, and at first loved it dearly, as it was one of my first actual MMOs. Also, it was after watching Sword Art Online, which got me into this "binge" feeling for MMORPGs. Any new player to the MMORPG scene would probably enjoy this game a lot, as it provides a general experience of an MMORPG.Pros:Very friendly to newcomers. There are tutorials for just about everything - but oh sweet jeebuz, the voices.Graphics are beautiful; if you're into anime-styled characters with big boobs and badass swords - you'll probably enjoy this game.Many classes to choose from - you'll never get bored from the multitude of choices. I have levelled many characters to a certain point (50-60) and have enjoyed all but one. Sub-classes: Some MMORPGs do not provide this experience. You will use two classes as your setup, but can be hard deciding if you have never played the other classes, as there is such a wide variety.The first time through the game is crazy - it can be hard keeping up with all the skills you're offered, and all the different potential combat variation. Of course, you can set a 1-2-3 routine if that's how you like it - but I personally enjoy mixing it up a bit.Questing with friends can be fun as the points for killing X mob counts for the both of you. This can lead to faster questing, if you are both killing different mobs at a time.Gliding and mounts. Gliding is normalized unless you get enchantment cards of some sorts that provide faster gliding speed; however, the MOUNTS are the real pro here. Mounts are organized by 30%, 60%, and 90% speeds. There are no flying mounts, and they cannot be used in combat. Cosmetics! Probably my favorite part about this game is the variation in cosmetics. Most of it is only available through the cash shop or AP tiered spenders - however, you can easily obtain these costumes through gold usage on the Auction House. Do note that brand new costumes are extremely expensive and will not be available to a player making minimal amounts of money.More on the cosmetics - most of the "orange" items can be dyed different colors. This leads to lots of variation in one costume, having a multitude of colors to choose from on multiple locations of the costume.The community. For the most part, the community is actually pretty good in this game. There are a ton of guilds for players of all levels, and most veterans welcome newcomers with open arms. Possibly one of the better communities out of most MMOs I've played.Eidolons - I love how many there are, and that you can "evolve" them like Pokémon, so-to-speak. Collecting them is hard, and some are unobtainable (look at "cons" section).Cons:The cash shop. Do not let anyone fool you by saying this game is NOT pay-to-win. There ARE fortifications on the cash shop. There are many items on there that will make AP (their money/site currency) users much stronger than you.X-Legend is not known for their PvP in games. The PvP is very, very unbalanced - some classes are ridiculously overpowered and very little is changed (such as sleep timers - Sorcerer) to reduce some classes from being extremely overpowered.Bots are running about all over. It feels like they are slowly diminishing, but that could just be the fact I am used to seeing them everywhere. Then again, most MMOs in general have a lot of bots farming for in-game currencies to sell online.Very grindy. Themepark. If you dislike grinding the same dozen or so dungeons; I HIGHLY recommend you stay away. You will not like this game after levelling.Ahh; levelling. The quests are merely kill ___ mob ___ times; collect ___ from ___ mob; collect ___ plant ___ times. Very repetitive and tedious quests with the rare occurance of an actual plot.The story is... meh. This is not a game for people who want to be immersed whatsoever. The "role-playing" feel you got from Vanilla WoW - yea, that's not here.Patches are very slow. We get classes that the Taiwan version gets around 6-8 months later, and actual content comes in around the same pace.The translations aren't perfect, but if you aren't reading the story this is not a very big deal to you. Although, some of the skills have awkward wordings and can be rather confusing. Eidolons -  Many of them are unobtainable without the cash shop "RNG" boxes, or getting the key fragments from the AP tiered spenders. The drop rates on some of the eidolons are so ridiculously low that getting one without the cash shop/tiered spender is extremely rare (I'm looking at you, Tsubaki).OVERALL, I do recommend this MMORPG. I had a blast, and still come back to it every few months and go at it again. The instances are always fun to run through again and remembering old times. Just note that the game is a themepark and generally does not offer much else to do other than instances.I hope my review helped you as an individual decide on whether or not you are going to play this game or not Feel free to add me on Steam and message me any questions you may have about the game. I will give you the honest truth; not a biased opinion like some of the other reviews I have read on here.

number of helpful: 10 of 11 people (91%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 14, 2016
												It's a pretty solid MMORPG, but it could use some work.PROS:Graphics - Pretty adorable little anime graphics, everything is well modeled, especially for an MMO.Quests - If you do the quests, there's a fairly minimum outside grind needed, but of course it's faster just to grind, if you know the right places. Storyline - Unlike many other Anime-style RPGs, the story is very scarcely cringy. Character Options - There are numerous character options. First, you start out with a class (really just a weapon, but y'know), and a follower called an Eidolon. As you progress through the game, you can improve your starting Eidolon, or get ones that are way better. Each one has different skills and interacts with your character in various ways. At lvl 50, you can choose a second weapon, either one that makes your character way better at the niche that it has, or one that rounds it out better. CONS:Staffing - Pretty nil. Oftentimes, the serious reports aren't handled for a long time, while most things minor that happen when a staff is on will get handled right away, resulting in a ban. However, unlike most of the top reviews say, you won't likely get banned for the stupid stuff they say you are unless you are just doing it right in front of a mod, which is overall stupid. PvP - The game is advertised as PvE, and it really lives up to that. But if you like PvP, then you might be dissapointed by this game. TL;DR Good game, has good graphics and a decent story, but some of the people aspects could use some work.

content:
Posted: February 22, 2016
How Kujo Not Recommend "Aura Kingdom"?--(My playthrough consisted of solely the bard class)It's only fun for so long. The combat's servicable enough except there's no strategy in regards positioning in any non-ranged focused class. When executing an ability it locks you in place (and the animation) until it's finished. You can only move while auto-attacking. Many of the quests in the game consist of clicking on the objective to set a path you can auto-follow to just talk to NPCs, which is where more than half of your EXP comes from, not from combat quests. In a bizzare mechanic I noted, it's faster to glide to an objective than using mounts, even though it's not automatic. When you hit Level 35, which will take roughly 15 hours, and have access to trading there's no real incentive to truding to higher levels aside from the class progression.The soundtrack has one or two songs that stand out whilst the other's fufill their purpose, and the game fairs well enough graphically. The community's rather friendly and the customer support was relatively quickly when I needed my pass code to be reset, but I've had no experience with the paid aspect of the game. I suggest a title like Dragon's Nest instead.

												Don't take my hours here seriously, I have over 1500 hours via Aeria Ignite. I love this game. The graphic style is a lot different compared to the more cartoony style of other anime style mmorpgs. It has a decent story to go  with it as well. True, the game requires a ton of grinding, but I had my awesome guild friends to get me through that. Which brings us to community. The people I've encountered in my year and a half of playing the game are tremendously amazing. So, all in all,- it's a fun game- anime style is cool- story is good- soundtrack is good- classes are varied and fun to try out, animations are awesome- levelling up used to require a lot of grinding, but they fixed it with recent updates- materials still require grinding in order to get the top gear- no complaints on the game publisher's side, they have always responded and helped when needed- The Eidolons (pets) are awesome, getting the rare ones are a pain- community is great, made a lot of friends- mystery boxes for costumes might feel like they are stealing from you, but hey microtransactions, am I right?Give it a try, you might like it.

Go to talk to him he'll teach you some stuff and give you lvl apropriate accesory. Done& Go gather some stuff again. By that time I alredy had problems with few bosses being able to hit you for like 50% of you HP but those rabbit just stamped big red cross on FUN. Why? Simple. They hitted to hard they swarmed you and healing sucks in this game, I cursed and sweared at them loudly, but while they are were managable event their bigger miniboss version. Long story short I barely managed to fight my way to the boss, threw everything I had at him and didn't even scratch him for 10% Also if monster losses aggro at you he recovers HP instantly, at least monster didn't respawn but that was last nail in the coffin for this game.End of the review I can reccomend this game for 10 to 20 hours.

content:
Posted: August 4, 2014
												Aura Kingdom is almost a caricature or a deconstruction of the whole concept of a Massive Online JRPG. The character designs immediately call to mind Magic Knight Rayearth; fashion is pretty and elaborate with lots of frills on display, hair is long and available in a variety of fanciful colors, and all swords are huge. Combat is pretty easy to learn, each weapon type has some kind of small gimmick that helps to keep squashing the various adorable monsters roaming the world from becoming stale quickly. A similarly easy to learn fishing mini-game is also worked in, with its own equipment and interface. Cosmetic gear is entirely seperated from statistic-granting combat gear, leading to the situation whereby your character can look like pretty much whatever you want without impacting the ability to fight effectively.This is the kind of game where there's no dungeon finder, but 14 seperate dance emotes. Where new abilities are learned automatically on level up or are chosen for free, straight from the character info window, and are re-chosen with fairly minimal penalty the same way. It's a very soothing kind of game, great for mellow, casual players or people just getting acquainted with online games....In summary, if you spend most of your time foaming at the mouth and screaming into a headset mic about why your last raid wipe or lost ranked match was everyone else's fault, give this one a pass. Try chewing on some wood instead.

Posted: December 3, 2015
												So, this game is lots of fun when you first install it and run around and play for a while. I highly recommend it.But God forbid you walk away for a month or so and forget your password. Once you forget your password, you can never play again. There's no way to recover it, and you can't even log in without it. The game sends you to the website to fill out a "Tech Support ticket" to reset your password, but nobody responds when you do this. Short of starting a whole new steam account, you're just never playing this game again. Other than that, though, it was pretty fun if I recall from last year. Maybe some day, they'll actually hire some staff to help their customers.

content:
Posted: May 18, 2015
												This game is cute and you get to pick a cute anime girl fairy who aid you in combat and gets treasure for you once in a while. Very cute anime game and all, but incredibly unpolished and unbalanced.You are incredibly overpowered against any normal enemy around your level, mostly because you get so powerful equipment really fast, much of it from area bosses you can easily solo. These respawn in just minutes and there are several of them even in the starting area. The drops are not level based either. I got some boots with a level requirement of 40 in a lvl 1 -> 10 zone, and several other pieces for players around lvl 15-20. It makes no sense!MANY quests seem broken or not even implemented. Where the quest text should be you have either nothing or just a string of numbers. I don't know if they can be completed, but how you would do so without ANY info whatsoever beyond me.It's cute, and although it seemed stable it is horribly unfinished. Don't play this, watch K-On! instead for cute.

content:
Posted: March 22, 2015
												Pros:  Cutesy anime-style  Fast, neat-looking skills and lush, beautiful graphics Good soundtrack for most maps (ﾉ◕ヮ◕)ﾉ*:･ﾟ✧ Is F2P Many chances for gaining better items, or even costumes and mounts. Has opportunities for both PvP and PvE oriented people Guild customization and flexibility Moderate-high player base Nice overall community (when not agitated by below reasons)Cons: Too many repeatable/non-unique/daily quests Leveling gets painfully slow if you don't have enough boosters Bots galore (very annoying for newbies and all levelers in general) Is a grindfest after level 55 Can be too easy for some people (i.e. guided questing) Storyline degrades overtime  Slow to release new content Listening to the same soundtrack being repeated over and over again... Item mall and costume-showoffs may discourage you from playing Takes a while to get better eidolons and faster mounts are virtually unobtainable without paying (with some exceptions) A ton of lag when entering the major city Has a clunky UI that takes up too much unnecessary space Servers are typically slower for EU playersMy score: 3.5/10 Overall, my experience with this game was bad. I enjoyed it as a beginner and all, but what turned me off at the end was the lack of enthuiasm due to the slow leveling and bland repetitive questing. Heck, my main character barely reached level 60, and I'm sure that I will never get to level 80 without paying in bulk - nope, I don't want to go through all that sugar-coated hell all over again. This game has potential for improvement though, so not all hope is lost.

												Hey guys.As most of you may know,A lot of people have had problems making purchases in this game, and I happened to be one of those people.When you make a purchase, it says in the terms of agreement that the transaction may take up to 24 hours.MAKE SURE that you are registered to the website and you have confirmed your email before you make a purchase.If you are having an Error next to your Aeria Points Icon on the website,MAKE A TICKET!But when you make a ticket, give them time to respond.THE MORE YOU COMMENT ON A TICKET, THE LONGER IT WILL TAKE FOR THEM TO GET TO IT.This is due to the fact that it resets the queue position every time you comment on your own ticket.A Quick Note:It states CLEARLY on their terms of agreement,that they DO NOT give refunds, so with that said, tread carefully.Here is the message I recieved from The Billing Department."Dear SirMoustachio,Thank you for contacting us.After further investigation of the account, we have fixed the issue and you will now be able to access your account and the AP along with it to purchase items in game.We apologize for any inconvenience that this might have caused you. Please log into your game to verify that you are able to play and use your AP. If you have any other problems, please contact us again.Note that everytime you answer your ticket before we do, it refreshes its queue order, which doesn't help us giving you a quick answer.Thank you for your understanding.Regards,-Francis-Your Team Aeria / Billing Department "Happy Gaming!-Sir

content:
Posted: March 4, 2015
												Updated review content: After finally getting to level 60 I have to change my review to do not recommend.  Leveling to 60 wasn't too bad, but as I saw in my original review below, nothing special.  The problem is at level 60 quests that were giving you 10-15% of a level each now give about 0.1%.  The solo dungeons available give less than 1% to run the entire thing.  Doing dailies with level 65 mobs that are quite painful to push through give about 3% for 30-60 minutes of work.  But unfun work.  I literally beat on the same enemy for 10 minutes straight to take him down and he was only PART of that quest requirement.  The only way to level is to run party dungeons, but parties don't take people below level 65.  The game does not get better.  All reports indicate level 70+ is even worse.  If it's just grind grind grind and solo grind at that until 65... forget it.  Not the point of an MMO.It's a free to play MMO with decent graphics that doesn't seem to (I'm only mid 30s in level so far) nickle and dime you for every little think like so many other Asian free to play MMOs do.  There's nothing I've found exceedingly unique or special with this game than so many others.  It has nice convenience features like clicking a quest objective to take you there, easy party finding in most (low level at least) cases, and an active user base.  Again, shocked it doesn't nickle and dime.  There were a number of times I ran into in game things that were free I just KNEW would cost money, like item upgrading and inserting/removing stones that provide bonuses to items.  It's a good diversion for the price.  Nothing spectacular.

number of helpful: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 27
												This was my first MMORPG game on a PC. It wasn't bad, at least not in the beginning. It graducally became quite repititive as I made progress, spending hundreds of hours of non-stop grinding. It was fun if I had a good party to run dungeons with and like all other RPGs, it was all about getting a good gear either by crafting or buying items of various categories. The story of Gaia and its envoys was total crap and around 99.9% players skipped reading anything. The remainder 0.1% includes people like me who were stupid enough to go through each and every meaningless dialogue. The graphics were average and the gameplay was glitchy either due to server lag at certain times or due to some in-game bugs. The only thing that made me continue to play were my friends but they later moved on to better games like WoW or B&S even though most of them were P2W players. I still tried to play it without them beacuse I had spent a considerable amount of time (around 600 hours) in this game and I wasn't prepared to see all that go to waste but it turned out that I was doing nothing but playing house with a bunch of arrogant kids. It was tough but I had to make a judgment call and so I quit it for good. It's almost been three months since I stopped playing it and I must admit, I've never felt so good in my life before. I'm finally able to spend my time playing games that deserve to be played. My advice for all the new players is to look for other games in the same genre, there are much better options available than this. EDIT: I forgot to mention the bots! This game is literally crawling with bots.You can see them running around everywhere in almost every map. The devs (in an effort to solve this issue) have devised a system to ban accounts which wasn't much effective and have been reported to randomly ban even a legitimate player account as I've seen in several cases. You have been warned!(I used to launch the game directly from Aeria Ignite so my play time on Steam is not accurate)

number of helpful: 9 of 12 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												This is my first MMO and I’ve got to say i am impressed. Aura Kingdom is my all time favourite game and is the most played game in my library, you take on the role as a envoy of gaia –  a human with abilities far exceeding other humans. The envoy starts out as a regular human, working for a living, until a blue mysterious orb suddenly appears and follows the envoy around until transforming into its true form, an eidolon. After the public saw this they were reminded of a envoy like him who had supposedly gone crazy and hid in a cave this was because he had a desire for power and because of this his eidolon transformed into something sinister that caused the envoy to lose control and lash out at civilians. Because of this the envoy is scared that his destiny would end up like the other envoys destiny and would eventually go crazy, his solution, to use a ancient device to remove the eidolon before he loses control. There is more to the story but some prefer to find out for themselves. Pros-Beautiful world full of unique animals and creatures with an anime like visual style to it-Populated servers with friendly people-Free to play-Easy to understand  -Dungeons are interesting to complete by yourself or in a party and will keep you interested -Attention to detail is superb such as weapons, costumes, eidolons and mounts-A amazing combat system with smooth transitions between moves-Large areas full of quests and monsters to fight-Gliding through the air is awesome -Can run on crappy computers and crappy internet -Good storyline if you don't continuously press the skip button-Clever ways to involve companions (eidolon) which each have unique abilities, movesets, stats and even personalities (and there are many to choose from)-Remains fun even if you have finished the main quest-Pay to win doesn't really apply as long as you have perseverance-Game has plenty of replayability like fishing, digging, creating new characters to use new classes and movesets, participating in the sky tower and events, duelling or trading with strangers, joining or creating dungeon raiding parties, side quests, hidden quests, achievements and more -Game still receives updates so the game still has more to offer-Many classes to choose from and you gain a secondary class at level 40 creating interesting combinations of movesets and combos-Companions named eidolons are useful for fighting/buffs/healing and can be levelled up -Has events which happen every 3 to 4 hours-You can create your own guilds that can be levelled up with daily quests and achievements and will gain you additional perksCons-The game tends to use quests like pick up _ of this and kill _ of a little to often that but aside from that quests are amazing-Music is not exactly memorable but that doesn't really matter-You can't change your raceThis game is definitely worth picking up and playing and the best part is it's free I definitely recommend it to all who enjoy MMORPG

content:
Posted: July 7, 2014
												Normally I don't review games, normally I'm a pretty forgiving individual, but this one stood out as something that I kind of want to talk about.This game classifies itself as a MMORPG but the way I see it is it's just Habbo Hotel in 3D. The party system in this game isn't even that as I've read on the Aeria forums from another player that states that it's just there as an item distribution system. The gameplay mechanics are extremely simple but there is plenty of potential as it even allows you to hybridize the class system when you get to level 40. In fact it was that very idea that caught my attention (apart from the aesthetic appeal). However, my grief with this game starts when in a party. You don't share EXP for each kill you get with the rest of your party and when doing quests side by side, a party member's achievements, like killing a monster, doesn't count to the rest of the party's quest count. Someone please explain to me how games like this is still considered multiplayer? I look at this game and all I see is an online single player social game. If you like the anime style gameplay and playing solo online then for sure go check this game out as it's visually appealing and again, the game system itself isn't that bad. If you're looking for a massively multiplayer online role playing game? I wouldn't waste my time and bandwidth.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2016
												Ignore the hours. I didn't play the game on Steam, but I've spent quite a bunch of hours on the game downloading it through their launcher (60-70 hours or so). Only downloaded it to write a review.Now let's get to the review:Aura Kingdom is nothing fancy. If you search for innovation you won't find it here (and anywhere to be fair, sadly the last game that really changed the genre was WoW). It's a solid and fun, WoW inspired, MMORPG with nice graphics. It's Free-mium, which means you CAN spend money on the game for cosmetics, but you don't have to. It doesn't give you an advantage but makes the game more attractive I suppose? (Never understood paying for cosmetics but some people really like it, look at LoL)It's no MMORPG were you'll spend 2k-3k hours like some others *cough* WoW *cough* (dark times, guys) but it's a really fun way to pass the time. You have lots of different classes to try out and re-try the game with. Every class is different and, thus, the way you experience the game is different. With some you tank and spank, with others you really have to position intelligently if you want to make things right.The game isn't frustrating by making you Grind the same monster for +50h but you can't really rush through it without grinding either (it mantains a good equilibrium with that).You can solo the game in case your friends dont play MMORPG's (♥♥♥♥ you, guys) or play it with a couple friends you'll be able to finish the game without mayor problems in either way.Of course it has some flaws. A few little bugs here and there (nothing game-breaking, really) and some people don't like that the game is rather short for a MMORPG as they normally require at least a few hundred hours to complete. Let's just say it isn't a deep MMORG but a little game to have fun with when you have nothing to do and/or want to relax a bit.Overall a really nice game and I recommend it to every fan of the genre. Polished, fun and Free2Win. Seems good enough, right?Damn, now I want to play the game again... Well, why not? I don't even need friends to play with (again, ♥♥♥♥ you, guys...)

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 25, 2016
												I've only been playing this game for a small time now, but from the moment I actually got into the game I noticed a few things that I want to note about this game. Of course this is a limited view as of right now, and I'll probably right more on this game in the future, but there are just things from a new player that I'd like to discuss that are appealing and absolutely not.1. CAMERA DIRECTION. The camera is fixed, and not on the direction that your character is running, which is common in practically 99% of RPG games you and I could probably think of off the top of our heads. You have to hold down the right mouse button and manually steer around where your view is. This can be considered an infuriating experience at first. It also completely ruins the flow of the game, adventure, and just kinda sticks it more into your head that this is a program instead of your own cool anime adventure. Even when it feels like I've gotten used to it, I end up in situations where this absolute design flaw sticks out like a sore thumb.2. QUESTS OBJECTIVE TRACKING. While we're on the topic of that feeling of adventure that a lot of people would consider crucial for an RPG, myself included, the game has a function that can completely destroy the sense of adventure and exploration in quests. How? Well I'll start off by saying that any good RPG has a way to track the general destination or area that you have to go to for your quest, through just a little symbol that appears on the map or a symbol that appears generally on the top of the screen that points you where to go (note: in some games this can be executed poorly, however there are also games that can do this while still giving a lot of sense of adventure, Skyrim is a good example). This game, however, has a pop-up screen that displays the goals of the quest, and if you click on the sentences of these obective (e.g you have to kill 5 of a certain enemy), the game will not only lay out a sparkly trail on the ground that not only leads to your goal, but also automatically starts taking you there. If you needed to find people that you can tell are supposed to be hard to find, you can just click this and you'll just be taken to them. More hidden resources that needed to be found? No worry, you'll be taken to it instantly. For some, this is quite the positive, since a lot of people would find having to always look for the quest's objectives manually each time tedious and tiring; and it's a completely optional too. Honestly it's a pretty convenient function for people that just wanna blast through to get to the higher levels. Although the bad thing I'll have to say about it is that the icon on the mini-map in the top right-hand of the screen the icons were absolutely confusing. There is a lot going on, and the icon that displays the direction of the quest does not stand out as much as the other symbols. The good thing is, however, that if you go into the regional map there is a list of icons on the side that not only tell you what each is for, but also has an option to not display them! Very handy. I'd say these functions are honestly up to interpretation for whether they're good or bad. Personally, I find that it's very hard and not as clear as other RPG games in the showing of a more general direction and in frustration, can push you more to the option of just letting the game take you everywhere. I'm all about immersion and for me, even having that option takes away from the potential of the experience of adventure. 3. THE DESIGNS AND ITEMS. My god, everything is cool in this game. As an artist, aesthetics and the way colours and design catch the eye are very important to me for just about everything; especially in anything that's definitely more visual-based like games. But I've caught myself thinking quite a few times that it's overwhelming in this game, and even a bit 'too cool'. Generally when we start to play a new fantasy MMORPG we start off with these kinda mediocre and mundane gear. In some you can see how it's kinda cool, but it's definitely not awe-inspiring. Especially compared to high-level players that you see running around mounted on something crazy like a lion with a fire mane, and gear on them that is radiating with some awesome aura, with wings coming out the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ back. We look to these players and start to idolize them in a sense for looking so rad. And when you start to reach up closer to the top, and start to collect your own cooler items, you definitely start to get a sense of pride and accomplishment in the hard work you've put into developing your character so much, especially if you paid money for it. This game off the bat gives you awesome items. For exmaple I choose the Scythe class for my first character, at a very early level I can summon not one, but THREE beautifully designed demons to accompany me; and the choice is out of six demons in total. Even if you didn't choose the Scythe class, under level 10 you are given a mount, which personally I've never witnessed in a fantasy MMORPG before.And to top it all off, the game itself is actually based around the lore of it's world that there are these people chosen by destiny, that are given little creature companions (which is a very stereotypical thing to see in anime) that help you fight with their special abilities. While in character creation you get to choose out of four which one you want. This trait in the game is also really up to interpretation just like the last one, too. On one hand, it's very rad that we all can have so many magnificent items, and can just look so fine. But on the other hand, it personally gives me less of an urgent want to progress fastly to be able to look good since I already am satisfied with my gear. Also on the more negative side, town centers were lots of players congregate can look completely ridiculous; like a hub for really over the top, overpowered original characters from deviantArt. And despite actually loving all the designs in this game, I still feel more neutral about it all. 4. LAG. The bane of all gamers out there, the insufferable force which destroys the natural flow and order in your gaming session - yes, ladies, gentlemen, and honoured guests - this game has so, so much lag. I don't believe I have to go into such extensive detail for this section, but it's so much that it DOES need to be noted. It's not so bad that it crashes my game or makes me lag for more then 10 seconds, but I do have a good laptop and internet. Why so much lag though? Honestly, blame the dirty weabs. All there for the designs, I swear. 5. POP-UP CONVERSATION SCENES. In this game when you talk to anyone that isn't a background character a pop-up screen with your character's and the npc's top half of the body show up. Dialogue, actions each character makes shown in text, intervention from not only your first mount, but also your little companion that's always given to you... it's all just like a visual novel. And it's very appealing, and even refreshing and unique to see in a fantasy MMORGP. It wouldn't be too much of a stretch that they put this in to appeal to those that are loyal anime fans, seeing as a lot of very popular games in Japan have these kinds of cut scenes that are very iconic in visual novels. They even give your character very over-exaggerated reactions that intergrate into the 'weaboo sub-popculture'. I can imagine some people would find this cringe-worthy, but I doubt anyone that would see it like that would be interested in a blantantly obvious anime-inspired game in the first place. 6. CLASSES. I was going to write about this extensively, but I ran out of space, so here's the basics. There are a wide range of classes, up to 13 classes in total. I'd recommend this game since most features that I see as note-worthy are more postive or up to interpretation, and therefore, worth giving a go and seeing if it's for yourself!

content:
Posted: July 9, 2014
												Aura Kingdom is beautiful, which is generally not a surprise for a game whose basic art inspiration is clearly anime.  The color palette and many of the visual choices strongly reminded me of playing fighting games in the arcade back when I was a kid, especially during combat sequences. The initial leveling experience is fairly swift, comparable to the current starter zones in games such as Lord of the Rings Online or World of Warcraft.As for the gameplay - it's a game that's easy to get into but also easy to set down and forget in favor of more engrossing games.Like in all other MMORPGs, grinding is the theme of Aura Kingdom and the storyline can, at most of the times, be neglected.Overall, Aura Kingdom represents a welcome turn from Aeria Games to making a decent and family friendly MMORPG which manages to be a fun, polished, and addictive experience.

												Alright, So I've been a long time player of this game, though I hadn't played it a lot recently. Probably for several months. But The game itself is pretty darn fun. I'd reccomend at least giving it a try but there are some things you should probably know before jumping into it.Pros:-Dencent Gameplay-Fun animation Style-Pretty damn good guild system-Everything you can pay money for can be accquired in-game without needing to buy itCons:-The general chat is constantly spammed with bots telling you to go to X site and purchase gold. Personally it doesn't bug me too much as I mostly just ignore it, but it does need to be dealt with.-Apparently there's a good chance of getting banned for no reason if you ever use real money to buy something, so I'd reccomend not doing that.Other than that, it's pretty good, it's not Pay to win, more pay to look pretty. 												After playing and wanting to like it, I really just can't. Before starting why i should say i've played till level 26At first i saw the anime style and many classes. I liked the look of it. That really is the only reason I can think of to like this game.What can I say? It just feels like its designed for someone who doesn't really want to play. qeusting is pretty much one click to the objective, doing/killing one thing, and delivering it. Because of the auto-travel the world is not interesting and bland. To elaborate, this small area has creature type one, and this type 2. you don't even need to look at your surounding.When I went into the first real dungeon that required a team, it was only one room and had 3 enemies. They weren't that hard to beat. Compare it to other MMO's and it just feels really boring and uninspired. Outside of the dungeons there isn't any room for teamwork either.You level very fast, which just add to the idea that the game is for the lazy. Not even something like a mount is worth anything. You get handed your first mount during the first 10 levels of play, this game does not feel like making the player do something, You just go through the motions.I geuss you get what you pay for, which is in this case: Nothing!

												- The Good - *The game is Free to Play.*You don't have to walk to quests, the game will do it for you.*The Anime Style and Graphics are nice.*Combat is interesting and can keep your interest.*"Pay to Win" doesn't seem to be an issue on here.*The game allows solo play using a solo dungeon system.*Very friendly community, with very little trolls.- The Bad -*There's way too many bots! (ノ ゜Д゜)ノ ︵ ︵ ┻━┻ *Gold Spammers are always spamming my mail (ノ ゜Д゜)ノ ︵ ︵ ┻━┻*Website goes down quite a lot and stops players from joining the game (ノ ゜Д゜)ノ ︵ ︵ ┻━┻*Group Questing can become a pain if one player doesn't hit the monster, as it doesn't give credit.*Profanity filter blocks the first part of some words "♥♥♥♥♥umptions".*Pets continuously jumping ontop of quest log or screen, no way to move where they appear.*Jumping / Gliding can become an issue depending on the distance you are from server. My case (Australia)  *After around level 49-50 the game becomes a lot more grindy and starts to lack quests. Aura Kingdom is definitely a recommended game by me, as I have quite a lot of hours played so far and plan on playing some more. I'd honestly suggest picking up the limited time AP Spender pack by purchasing a $5 AP Pack and spending even just 9 AP - It gives you some great rewards to get you started!

Posted: February 10
												This is probably one of the very few RPG's I will actually constantly come back to because regardless of how much time passes by, I still really enjoy the story and the anime-like graphics the game brings to the table.Pros: - Best Anime-like graphics I have seen in a LONG time. - In depth story unlike the traditional MMORPG's or some current AAA RPG games. - Feel a genuine connection with my characters & Eidolons. - Simple and well designed "Envoy" stat tree. - A genuine sense of reward when crafting legendary equipment. - SOLO INSTANCES!!! (At least for Main Story missions.) - Extensive Class Choice - Simple Character modification (IE Hairstyle, eyes and colours.)Cons: - After level 30-40 it becomes a bit more of a grind to level up and obtain materials needed for legendary equipment.I really can't think of anything else..As you can see i'd highly recommend this to a friend or to somebody just wanting a casual MMORPG to relax and play.

content:
Posted: February 3
												Anime inspired 3D fantasy MMORPG where you, player, can form pacts with powerful spirits called Eidolons. Pet that helps you out in battle based on what he is supposed to do. World of Azuria is a bright and beautiful. Game that offers plenty of class and skill options. Playable classes with job advancements available at level 40 (Guardian, Duelist, Ravager, Wizard, Sorcerer, Bard, Grenadier, Gunslinger, Brawler, Ranger, Ronin, and Necromancer). Discover the world by completing hidden quests which can be particularly rewarding! Regular quests feature autopathing, but these special hidden quests do not, which makes them more rewarding. First couple days you go through the linear quests and doing what it tells you to do until you get to level 40, thats when most of the PVP, and Party Dungeons begin. Later on 60, you can get access to the Sky Tower. Most of the time in game you spend on grinding dungeons.I think that this game is targeted to casual MMO players, who just love the anime feeling and story.

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 5, 2014
												Yes this is gonna be a lengthy review of how awesome it is. No I will not put a TL;DR thing.I was looking for a free mmorpg to play on Steam...you know something different, and this game exceeded my expectations.Graphics:The graphics are downright gorgeous. They put care into the designing of costumes and the characters expressing emotions. Now I know graphics can't only make the game, but I have to applaud them for the details they put into characters and the buildings. They really captured the anime feel of this game.Customization of Character:There are many customization options to choose from: Gender, Hairstyle, Hair Color, Eye Color, Face Style, and Skin Color. Regret your decision in the future? No problem. They sell a kit to help you change that. There are various costumes out there that you can use to customize what your character wears. You get free ones by completing the main story quest, but the rest you will have to buy with real money or loyalty points(points you earn while playing the game). Basically, your armor does not change the appearance of your character. There are costume slots such as headgear, body, and back.Gameplay:The gameplay is more action style and not slow turned based. The stats are allocated differently. There are three attack stats and three defense stats. The three attack stats are DMG,Crit,and SPD. The three defense ones are HP,DEF,and EVA. Each level later on, you gain one attack and one defense stat. Depending on your class and weapon, you can attack while you're turned around and while running. Did I mention you can glide in the air? Well you can! Did I mention they give you a starting mount? Well you get one! Did I mention EIGHT different classes? I know...*faint*One key feature of the game is the game gives you a companion to use alongside your journey, more like a permanent two-person party. You have the option to summon or dismiss it whenever you like. At least you're not playing alone!Story:Fantasy and anime. The story is awesome so far for fantasy lovers. I could go on, but I think it's for the best to see it yourself.List of things to do:There are a ton of things. Hidden quests, achievements, and more where you can get different titles to boost your stats, or add some character to your character.Economy:Surprisingly with bots out there, the economy maintains its composure to be fair.Customer Service:They may ask you repetitive questions, but overall their service is kind and quick.Overall, this game is the next big thing. This can beat all the free-to-play mmorpgs out there.

content:
Posted: January 21, 2015
												TL;DR - Game is awesome, has some pretty neat features. Leveling is fast, skills are flashy, players are many, IT'S NOT P2W but you'll probably spend cash anyways since the costumes and mounts are awesome and yeah, read below if you want to find out more.I was a bit skeptical about this game at first since I read some stuff on the forums about it not receiving updates that often, devs being lazy and so on but I gave it a try nevertheless.So far I'm loving it. Even if it's like your usual get that / do that type of MMORPG the art-style, graphics and gameplay are what keep me going with it. At the moment, I'm Lv16 and from what I see there are lots of features unlocking at Lv20 and Lv25. Leveling is fairly easy, as of now I am leveling from like 3 quests which are easy to do, just go collect some things or kill some monsters.The story is somewhat interesting, I don't usually read quest logs and stuff like that but this game made me read them. There are some cliche things here but still, compared to how other MMOs cough up story it's awesome.This game has an interesting guild system as well. After you reach Lv10 you can join guilds by simply pressing G and searching for a guild that fits your liking. You instantly join them, no acceptance required. Now I'm not sure if this applies to every guild but still.Another cool feature that I noticed is the friends system. It has this Intimacy thing which categorizes how close you are to your in-game friends. If you spend a lot of time with them in parties and stuff the Intimacy level goes up.Skills are fancy, classes are awesome, mounts and the most important thing which I should have mentioned in the beginning, this game is not Pay-2-Win at all. At least from what info I managed to scrape so far.As of now that's all I can say about this game, I highly recommend it to anyone that loves MMORPGs and doesn't mind anime-like graphics.I'll update this once I get on a higher level and explore more of the content ! :)EDIT : I am now Lv42 and I just chose my second class since you can get another class at Lv40 and pretty much combine skills and stuff. So far I'm still loving this game, even more than before and I also found myself a nice guild.The dungeons are somewhat fun as well although I was used to dungeons like they were in WoW or CABAL Online but still, fun nevertheless. I also spent some cash on this after I learned about the Paragon Table thing (sort of like a gamble system where you can win costumes and stuff) so yeah.I'll make another edit on this review once I progress even further in the content.

content:
Posted: July 5, 2014
												I was in Aura Kingdom from 1st CBT. And I'm still there. People who will write the game is "boring" are the ones that most of the times leaves the game because the boss 1 hit them in dungeons. So let's start with PROS:- Cute to the core ( And by that...I mean it, the official screenshot shows only like 10% of game cuteness)- PANTSU! ( Yes that also goes in pros >:) ALOT of pantsu in this game!)- Huge world with loads of zones and beautiful landscape you never seen in any mmorpg before- Music... soundtracks are pretty into the feeling of the world and dungeons- ALIVE game world ( This is not a game where you will see few players running around and all NPC's are standing in place. Game world is really alive, Npc's are walking around, talking to each others and doing stuff)- Rich playerbase, there are loads of players there in this game. Wherever you are, there will be someone near you most of the times- Really much to do: Main storyline quests (to the lvl 60 atm but they will exceed it soon), loads of sidequests that gives achivements, daily quests, Dungeons you can play Solo, in party or hell mode that is kinda hardcore, after lvl 60 you can register and enter Sky Tower (100 floors? dungeon) on weekends and do Otherworld dungeons in what you can find really rare and expensive gears or items- Eidolons... Pets that will heal you, deal damage and bring you stuff if you link them. There is ALOT of them to collect. Catch them all! :D- Blacksmiting and Alchemy, one word, Crafting- Paragon Table, like lootery with rich prizes- FREE 2 PLAY! And it is! Whoever will tell you game is P2W or P2P is an noob. You can basicaly get ANYTHING for ingame currency or for Loyalty Points. Loyalty points shop is like Item Mall (Item mall is for Cash only), but you get Loyalty points in game while doing sidequests and stuff...- Players can set up Stalls ( It's like players market stuff) and sell their loot that way, or they can deposit items in Auction- Level capacity is 75 and leveling becomes intense after lvl 50 ( I was thinking should i put this on Pros or Cons.. And i decided to put it in pros since when you reach max lvl... Well you should discover yourself why)- Rich character progression, Evony path, stats lvls, masteries and more- For paying players thwere is Tiered spender with rare and most expensive rewards- Guild levels, guilds have their own cities (guild halls) where their guild members can meet up. Guild system is made way better than in other mmo's- Costumes and acessories gives you stats boosts- You can recolor your custom costumes with loads of colors- Nice character customizationSo... thoose are PROS, I might have more of them but I can't remember all of them :D And now onCONS:- Bots... Oh yes~ The game is populated with thoose guys too. But they don't affect so much of your gameplay. Just running around...minding their own- Lag... This one is not much noticable but sometimes, if you're having slow internet you will feel it. It might result in disconnections sometimes and in damage delay that might result death of your char in fights.- PvP is really gear, class and armor and weapon fortification relied. Yes, If you are level 40 or 50 and thinking about going into PvP instances...Forget it. You will die by 1 hit from lvl 60 or higher players who are fully geared and their armors and weapons are fortificated. If you wanna be PvPer here, you will at least need to spend some time getting thoose gears and fortify armor that matches your class.Also there could be more CONS, you might like and dislike something and our oppinions might be different but remember, You are a new player and this is a review of someone who is in the game for a long time :) Long enough that can see why this game is actually 100% worth to play ^^ But make sure you go little over minimum system requirements because game will really test your PC hardcore :)

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 1, 2014
												Okay i've played this game for over 100 hours (In 3 weeks :O)  time for a simple review.First of all, this game has really beautiful graphics i just love the anime style ♪You can have a companion (in this game named eidolon) with you and fight alongside your companion!In the beginning this game is verry easy especially with leveling.But when you reach level 40 this game becomes more challanging, leveling will become harder and you have to choose a secondary class. If you are going PVP and you choose the wrong secondary class you're gonna have a baaaad time ;3If you think: oh i am so weak... i think i located my stats in the wrong way... No worries! you can re-locate them for some in-game money (not money where you need to pay for, but money you earn with quests like gold and silver)Futher! There are lots of dungeons with: solo mode, party mode (up to 5 players) and hell mode.For most dungeons, can you only enter a few times each day.Doing quests is pretty boring (but in what MMO are they actually not)There is a bulletin board where you can accept up to 5 quests each day, it are quests with dungeons! -yaaaaay o(＾∇＾)o -And then there is a Sky tower :O It's a big dungeon with lots of floors (for lvl 60 players) on each floor you'll find lots of monsters and bosses and the best of all: gold gear,costumes, hats and other awesome stuff :3And there is a Arena where you can do quizzes or fight to the death! You can check what time which gamemode will start.It's totally not a pay to win game all of the stuff where you need to pay real money for, are sold by other players for gold, it are almost always costumes, mounts and stuff like that + there are plenty of outfits that you can get without some payment. AND you can earn loyality points and get the costumes & mounts and stuff like that for free :3 you don't even need to pay to get them. paying with real money in this game will only speed things up.Everything in a nutshell (and some other things): It's not p2w, nothing is ugly everything is shaped gorgeous, Leveling is quite easy but overpowering someone is a challenge, the music on the background sounds great (in my opinion), fighting is pretty awesome there are lots of effects, you have a companion to take care of and get new ones on your journey, eidolons spawn random on the world as a boss and you'll need LOTS of ppl to beat it, there are lots of dungeons and hanging around with other ppl is quite fun!I just say try this game and see for yourself, the beginning can be boring but keep playing and you'll see all the great things (and less great things) for yourself! I hope you have a great time playing this game! (✿◠‿◠)

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 30, 2014
												I remember playing this game long ago, at the time like all MMO's Aura was something fresh for me to jump into and offered a different experience other mmorpgs couldn't give off. Aura Kingdom is a game that's simple to learn and grasp, I was able to get into it and learn a lot of things in a manner of minutes! The variety of classes allows a unique gameplay style for everyone, and the secondary weapon you can get later on just makes things even more challenging and fun. The biggest pros in my opinion are:-Variety of classes (more to come!)-Eidolon systems, you don't need to be a summoner class to get an epic companion to fight with you!-Awesome flashy skills-Epic dungeons to explore with friends and intense, challenging fights-Unique story and background, everything has a story-How well the game pulls you in, once you start, you really can't stop playingIn contrast however, the cons in my choice are:-You'll find yourself repeating fetch and kill quests, the occasional special quest with something else to it-Unable to skip boring cutscenes that last awhile-How unfair dueling systems can get, a level 70 can challenge a level 30 to a fight, seriously?-Servers can be unstable time to time-Leveling, becomes ridiculous in higher levels, quests only bump you up like 2%The thing fantastic about Aura, there's always something to do, regardless if gameplay becomes reptative. How you play Aura is up to you, but the biggest things you need to remember:-This is an MMO, if you understand the basics, you'll know long hours and patience go a long way and are needed to enjoy this game-People have the grinding style of leveling, but in Aura that method won't really work, espicially later on, just do your quests, it wont kill youI personally enjoy Aura, if you love MMORPG's and want to find one to kill time, have an awesome adventure with friends, or just flat out looking for something new, this is the game for you. I promise its worth every minute of gameplay.

content:
Posted: April 21
												I'll keep this short. Aura Kingdom is by far one of the best MMORPGs I've played to date. I think my time playing is proof enough. I'll admit, I would make in-game purchases every now and then because I was pretty involved with the game. Then I go inactive for a period of time because of life. I come back to discover that my acoount, which I've spent quite a bit of time on, has been banned due to a TOS violation. As to why, they won't tell me. Keep in mind I'm an avid MMORPG player and most (if not all) consider me the opposite of toxic. So I know for a fact that's not it. I'm starting to lean towards Aeria banning me because I stopped buying their "optional" items. When I sent a reply email to them asking if this was the case, I never received a response. Kinda speaks for itself. Moral of the story: Aura Kingdom is an exceptional game; Aeria Games, however, needs some work.

content:
Posted: August 14, 2014
												This is a typical MMORPG game, nothing special, but I have taken a liking to it! I've played MMORPG games like Dragon Nest, Maplestory, Vindictus, and a few others. The pros and the cons may alter from person to person depending on their preferences. By the way, people who like anime artwork will definitely like this game! I'm going to point out some pretty specific stuff in this game instead of just going broad or a general view of the game. The Pros:-Very Easy and Casual Gameplay-Cash currency is earnable in game-Progessing in the game is quick-Equipment is easily accessible -Not pay to be the best -Subclass system is great-Friendly society-Great artwork-Skill animations are fancy-A good amount of classes to select from The Cons:-Typical MMORPG -Slow paced battle systemThe cons are definitely something that would change someone's mind about playing this game, but if you ignore those two concepts of the game, you'll get to experience what Aura Kingdom truly has to offer.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												Having been playing this game for two weeks almost non-stop, I feel as if I can finally give a good review once the "OMG, NEW GAME TO PLAY" hype wore off.First things first, the story is no challenge. If you don't take your time, you can blow through about half the story in a day. This is both good and bad, seeing as how it's fun and easy to get into. Pros:EasyNot too system heavy (In my opinion, I run a rather low-end rig)Emphasizes teamwork, but doesn't shove it down your throatFunEasy to understand and grip the storyLots of classes to choose from, a little bit of this, a little bit of that. Melee, ranged, magic, all sorts of goodies.KAWAII AS HELLNice art styleExplorable terrainDiverse (Somewhat) creatures and racesCons:Very little story progression per quest, gets too meticulous, tedious and repetitive.Emphasizes defeating creatures moreso than the actual story. ("Here, take this item, but I need you to collect 12 things that drop 1/4 times from a creature that's evenly matched to you")The mail system is loaded with spammers, sending offers for sites that allow you to buy gold with real money.Too many bot characters, people who aren't even playing themselves in order to get gold. Easy, no real challengeCentral city LAGS EXCESSIVELY, and is required to pass through several times towards endgame.PVP is unbalanced. It's unlocked at level 20, but you should wait until you're level 65 to actually participate in the arenas.I'm both impressed AND disappointed in this game. I mean, yes, I have fun and will continue to play. I've come to rely on the guild system to have more fun than just the story alone. So if you're going to play, join a friendly guild, and spill your tails of anguish, raids, and loot.

content:
Posted: September 11, 2014
												Great game that is for sure anyways I guess I'm gonna make a list, mane.--PROS--▲Great Visuals▲Great controls▲Great Cooldown, which allows for great PvE battle▲Plenty of quests to keep you occupied▲Great for anyone that likes anime or RPG. This game is kind of like GW.▲Good storyline (In my opinion)▲Balanced levelling syustem, which does not require much grinding if you do the right quests at the right times▲Guilds n' stuffs▲Can't really get too OP at start of game, which makes it fun.▲Awesome Cutscenes (very few so allows for more gameplay)--CONS--▲Controls can get glitchy if ypou do multiple things at once, such as going into chat and moving at the same time▲Lots of quests are go fetch! But still there are plenty worthy adventure quests to do that▲Takes SO MUCH TIME on FIRST LOAD, other than that it's fine.▲Never press the full scan button.▲Going on a different server can cause your character to not be on that server. Play on the server that you created your character on (if you made it on hydra, play on hydra)▲Alot of trade spammers. I would recommend turning trade off in general. Keep trade channel for trade only.I guess that's my review of this great game. If the developers read this, good job guys! I recommend this game for anyone who likes RPG and anime pretty much.

content:
Posted: August 27, 2014
												GOAT game. I played for one hour as "LoliPrincess", a very powerful pre-teen wizard. So far, the gameplay mechanics are awesome :Click on quest and the character goes directly to the quest, you don't even need to look for it !And the path finding is really good. You can use your chocobo ersatz to go even faster !Next thing to do is read the dialogue (get a life).Then kill 5 tanukis, because they do noise and the city people get annoyed (It's a bit extreme but hey, who cares)The fighting mechanics are some of the best i've seen : Mash the keys like a potato puree, and destroy thembad mofos. Mash it good. You can also use your cool combo thing that oneshot everybody.So, once you've done with fighting, report to the guy who gave you the quest, get your reward (some boots -you already have those, don't worry about it-) and get another quest.One other thing that i've found pretty good whilst playing, is the co-op gameplay. Brace yourself for some amazing multiplayer interaction : You can invite a friend to your party, and race the quest, to see who's the fastest at farming bunnyhops and collecting some bloke's crates on the ground.Did I mention that the graphisms were kawaii ? Man they are kawaii.In conclusion, you will probably want to play this game. It's the best in category (kawaii korean farming mmo).I'm totally hooked.

number of helpful: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 5, 2014
												This is my first time playing the game even though i heard about it before but I am glad it's on steam! If you are an Anime Freak like me, this game is absolutely for you! I just downloaded it and played 9 straight hours ! that's how addicting the game is! I got my character up 37 in one day so the leveling is really fast (of course if you keep doing the main quests). Aura Kingdom gives the atmosphere that you are inside the world. So first up you have the basic class choosing, customization, and tutorial. I am here to convince few people by telling my pros and cons i had so far from the game! HERE IT GOES! Pros: run smoothly even if you have a low graphics card (depends on your internet connection) lowest setting still looks greatmany classes to choose from and later in the game you can choose another class (lvl 40) it's not really p2w or pvp MMO The Music is soothing All classes are balancedYou get your own partner that will help you throughout the game that you can talk to! ( Like Digimon some sort of) Crowded Servers Very exciting Dungeons Not really a toxic player game Story is pretty good for a MMO Costumes are free by doing the main quests ( You get many costumes) Sharing monster kills for quests ( normally you have to kill your own target but not in this MMO) Automatic Healing potions usage at % health (you can turn it on or off and set it up at what % health you want to use it, IT'S VERY UNIQUE imo) IT'S TOTALLY F2P !!!! Unless you like to support the developers by buying at their Shop Mall Neg: The same quests as go talk to him than him or kill this, pick up this etc ... Pvp is restricted until later the game ( I Think) Crowded server might crash your game ( Not for mine) low internet connection is not recommended ( 25 mbps is recommended by me) Social or chat is mehh, couldn't figure out how to make a new tab to make like a guild chat only, party chat only etc ... ( I couldn't find how) Females are mostly males ( i have nothing wrong with it, but in an Anime MMORPG is creepy) everyone can have the same helpers (it bothers me, they at least could put some customization to our helper) Limited Bag Space that becomes annoying to clean up Overall i would give it 8/10! Since the neg are mostly on the small issues than the gameplay. THIS IS MY ANALYSIS! I play Age of Wushu(Only PVP)  therefore it makes Aura KIngdom so unique for me. Play with your friends or cooperate with a stranger rather killing him in public. It's more of the Piece full games! Sorry for the grammar but i wanted to help people by deciding to start or not! And give them general idea of the game! Well i hope my review helped some of you out there!

number of helpful: 7 of 11 people (64%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 4, 2014
												I played this game in Open Beta.Steam account connected very easily to Aeria account. No issues at all.To my surprise when the game is loaded i see my old server and my previously used char. It was all there. Awesome... No need to make all the questing from the beginning. :DDon't see many differences from Open Beta. Even the good old bugs are there.Hooo... good times.>>> Now lets talk for real.This game is not for the hardcore players like i used to be in WoW times.This is a very easy and very casual game. If you want more than the casual questing, casual dungeon and casual PvP then go look somewhere else. This is not for you.If you are looking for a polished anime style gameplay. This is the game.The anime style graphics are very well done, the skills are gorgeous and you even have a pet/companion to help you.Do not compare this game to Dragon Nest. Totally different graphics styles and gameplay. Never compared an Action MMORPG to a regular MMORPG.If you like both games, install both and play both. They are both F2P.Yes, the game have bugs but they are minor and the big ones don't even interfere with the gameplay.PROS:- Free to Play.- Anime style- Customizable UI- Very easy gameplay- Polished gameplay- Beautifull graphics and animationsNEUTRAL:- Nothing new. Thats normal, anything really new in MMORPG's since WoW or Everquest.- Casual game, for casual players. The game was made like that. Don't like it, play something else.- Music. I don't really pay attention to Music and if i use TeamSpeak I even turn it off.- SoundFX. Polished sound effects.CONS:- No Mana, only cooldown system- Some bugs- Repetitive quests and dungeonsOverall, I like the game and will keep installed for when i want to play a easy, relaxing gorgeous anime style game.>>> Currently installed games for casual playing:- Team Fortress 2- Aura Kingdom

content:
Posted: April 16, 2015
												Aura Kingdom is a Korean MMORPG with anime-style graphics. It's set in Terra, a land between the titular heavenly Aura Kingdom populated by powerful Eidolons (How can I not think Final Fantasy?) and Hell, the place of demons. The player becomes one of the Envoys of Gaia, chosen ones by the Cube of Gaia, who can enlist the help of Eidolons for their own benefit. However, as it becomes apparent very quickly, this power can corrupt and turn an Envoy into a monster, so you and your Eidolon set out on a quest to sever the link between you and the Cube.You get to choose from 12 different "weapons" (classes - 5 melee, 3 ranged and 4 magic), each one possessing different stats and skills. However, all classes can use every piece of equipment except for their weapon. As you level up, you can customize your character via allocating points into stats, Masteries which give you either passive effects or power-up your combat skills, and Envoy's Path system where you can move through a "tree" to unlock passive and active skills, as well as late-game combo skills.As far as story goes, it's nothing really interesting. The dialogues are okay, but this is an MMORPG, so the story is usually weak in those.The graphics are to be honest quite beautiful. The location design is rich and it's basically eye candy. Of course, it all depends on whether or not you like the anime style, so if you someone doesn't like them then he's not going to really enjoy it.The music and sound effects are okay, however outside of the main city of Navea and the starter city of Port Skandia, no other music can be considered memorable.The combat is, at least at its core, interesting. You get a wide variety of skills and abilities to choose from during a fight, with different cooldown periods for each. Your chosen Eidolon also helps you in a fight by using his own skills. However, this is where it gets kinda bad. Since there is no MP system, you can basically just assault a mob with a wave of skills after skills, killing them before they can pose any bigger threat. This makes fighting any monster that isn't a boss a cakewalk. It's way too easy. Even bosses aren't much of a challenge, while they can hit you quite strong, especially if you don't take your time to move away from their powerful but telegraphed attacks, but they are basically damage sponges to be mowed down with your skills. It doesn't help that you also get a fairly powerful combo attack with your Eidolon which makes you invincible at the same time.The quests are - for the most part - boring. It's either "kill X monsters", "get Twenty Bear Asses" or "collect a few items lying on the ground", with added "kill instance boss" from time to time to keep things less stale. Even daily quests are visibly lazily done - you get a huge health boost to survive the incoming challenges, causing it to be completely effortless when it comes to actual challenge. It's just a way for you to earn a bit more exp by doing more busywork.This has got to be the fastest-progressing MMORPG I have ever played. You can very easily reach level 40 in just 15-20 hours, not even attempting to speedrun the game. While it does allow you to move quickly without things getting too boring, it's also kind of effortless.After reaching level 40, you can choose a secondary weapon (sub-class). While you are free to choose any of the other 11 weapons, you get to choose between maybe three if you want to be actually practical and be able to gain combo skills from Envoy's Path which are usually high-cooldown nukes that combine the power of both of your chosen weapons. You will also begin to gain the basic skills from chosen sub-class after level 40, but they will have triple the normal cooldown on them. Makes sense, considering you won't be as proficient with it as with your main weapon.However, here problems start to arise. After level 40 the level-up speed drops down quite drastically, so you'll have to spend quite a bit of time grinding the subsequent levels. It also doesn't help that your visible character progression basically stops after level 55, where your sub-class gains their ultimate skill (unless you're being late with Envoy's Path's combo skills), and after that all the grinding has only the purpose of increasing your stats and giving you additional Envoy's Path points to spend. The current level cap is 80 - that's 25 levels worth of pure stat grinding. Boring.I also have to mention one additional fact: the game as of now has a lot of bots, mostly Grenadiers, with random names, who grind the levels, then sit in towns and send phishing links to everyone who passes by. It's annoying, but also kind of amusing to see five identical-looking Grenadiers with gibberish names killing monsters in one area, tho.There is also an annoying glitch that sometimes disables your ability to do anything besides moving, which forces you to reset the game and go through the whole login process again. It's annoying and usually happens when using items. Also, the whole game quits if you lose your connection. Great.Overall, despite this game's cheerful atmosphere and cutesy graphics, I can't recommend it to anyone except maybe casual gamers who like to pop in and chill out for a few hours once a week or so. Others will quickly get bored out of their minds.

content:
Posted: May 14, 2016
Product received for free
												Aura Kingdom review:PLATFORMWindowsDEVELOPERX-Legend EntertainmentSYNOPSISAura Kingdom is a new MMORPG that features detailed anime art style graphics to depict a sprawling fantasy world for players to journey through. In the game players are going to be accompanied by faithful interactive companions able to evolve and give support in battle.In Aura Kingdom players can choose between eight classes, fight with a dynamic action combat system, and customize their their haracters with elaborate skill trees.MAIN FEATURES    Detailed and Rich fantasy world    Stunning anime styled graphics    Huge selection of interactive companions    Unprecedented mobility    Dynamic and fast-paced action combat    Lots of customisation options regarding abilities and weapons    Completely free-to-playA VIBRANT WORLDAura Kingdom features a vast and vibrant fantasy world illustrated in highly detailed anime styled graphics. Players will trek across beautiful landscapes and charming towns, meeting its inhabitants while exploring mysterious dungeons and climbing massive towers.CLASSES & WEAPONSThe game presents rather than a usual class system, a system based on the weapon players may use, resulting in eight classes to choose from, but along the way they are able to select a secondary weapon normally wielded by one of the remaining classes. Each weapon provides unique skills that are unlocked automatically step by step upon reaching higher levels. With every new level, players are also able to put points into a passive skill tree that differs between classes.Currently available are the following weapons: axe, dual daggers, sword & shield, staff, harp, grimoire, dual pistols and cannon.COMPANIONSIn Aura Kingdom players are accompanied by companions which are far more than simple pets and an integral part of the game experience. These companions grow more formidable over the course of the game and gain powerful combat abilities-including joining with the player to initiate spectacular combo attacks.In addition these companions will remember your actions ingame, frequently conversing with the player about their past exploits and battles.COMBAT & MOBILITYIn the game players are going to have unprecedented mobility both in combat and out, offering unique movement techniques to traverse the terrain. Players may utilise double-jumps to scale heights and glide forward through the air at high speed to cover ground faster than they ever thought possible. Even for low level players, it’s already possible to climb on the back of an extensive array of mounts.This mobility allows for fast-paced and fluid battles. Position and quick thinking will enable them to dodge enemy attacks and stay on their feet. They can call in their companion to join them, granting access to powerful new abilities and spectacular combo attacks.CUSTOMISATIONIn Aura Kingdom the customisation is not limited to hair styles, costumes and accessories, but also allows adapting characters regarding their abilities and weapons. Players can choose which of their many abilities to power up to suit their play style, and change them around quickly and freely. They are encouraged to experiment with different setups often, as the right approach can mean the difference between victory and defeat.Aura Kingdom does not present the common stats, but attack and defence points instead. Attacks points can be used to improve the character’s attack to inflict a larger amount of damage, the chance to land a critical hit, and the attack speed. Defence points can be employed to increase health, health regeneration and the chance to avoid an attack, as well as to reduce the amount of damage received.

content:
Posted: March 7, 2015
												Why in every MMO you become a lab rat to drinking unstable potions. Is this what heroes do nowadays? put their life on the line to try out a potion instead of putting their lives on the line to protect innocent? no wonder dark forces are destroying the land, most the hero population are off killing themselves from unstable potions."I ain't got time for demon lords! I got potions to drink and livers to destroy!"+ I must say I do like the art style of the game is quite lovely though.+ This does have a large variety of classes to choose from including a scythe class, I love scythes, I even get a companion around level 10.+ I enjoy the companion idea that you get to choose at the beginning of the game and her/his interface, she/he always greets you and says that she got lonely when you were offline, that kind of stuff does make me feel kinda warm inside and I do love the idea of putting a more indepth characteristic into your partner.= The storyline seems like it could be kind of good but it's hard to pay attention to it over the simple text dialogue, voice acting and such is always a good idea if you want to draw in a more indepth atmosphere. It could also do without it choosing what emotion your hero is going under, like crying at times and such, it's best to leave that kind of stuff out because it should be up to the players imagination to know what emotion your character should be going through.- Interface covering 70% of the screen annoys me but oh well.- This game includes the overly used quests in every other mmo, quite off putting, I need to see something new, spice it up a little.- I hate the fact that it has auto pathing for the quests, oh how original and unefforting, just click the text and the game plays itself, screw effort. - I also dislike that the gear you put on doesn't show up on you character it's all costume based.overall is this game good?there are both likes and dislikes about this game and some of the good points really do stand out... I just like having a companion XD, but the unoriginality and costume base weighs the game down alot and really prevents me from playing knowing the progress I make won't make me all the unique from any other player. I don't have much motivation in advancing further in the game and with that said I would give this game:4.5/10

content:
Posted: May 7, 2016
												The game is very simple. Even the hidden quests have markers on the minimap with clues on the items you recieve. The only hidden thing is the conversations you can overhear, getting all of them in an area grants a bonus.I played 10 hours before I got stuck on a bug. I assume a relog would fix it but I quit the game instead at level 28. The game is simply too easy. I once dropped below 30 % in 10 hours. I used a total of 2 health potions.There was one forced group battle at level 20, nobody in our group dropped below 70% hp.Besides that it is a fun game with gliding fast over the terrain between quest and monster. Often able to glide up a cliff to report a quest within 20 s of it being done. It progresses fast and teaches you mechanics and systems as you go along if you do all the quests in the area. The equipment gets upgraded as well, with some sets needing to defeat instances multiple times for drops (longest time to complete one was 2 min for me).The biggest upside in the controls for this game is that you can click on the minimap and the character will go there. You can even click on characters to go up to them or enemies. Playing SW mmo you realise quickly how big this improvement is.
