												Well, after playing this game for less than two hours the server connection was interrupted and me being knocked off, I really did not enjoy this game.It might be okay for kids, but not for all ages, and really only for those who enjoy clicking through endless dialogue boxes, monotonously accepting and completing quests on command, having your hand held through most of the beginning of the game. You're already shown where to go for the quest by flowing a sparking trail, then you the ability to click on the quest and you can go there hands free, Not only that ut the entire time the onlly music I heard was "epic" battle music, especially when I was talking to non-threatening npcs in a village. I felt my brain cells withering. Oh, and if you hate pop-ups, be prepared for a whole crap load of them, such as the dialogue boxes. My experience: pop-up dialogue boxes,hitting continue, accepting quest and completing quest.NOTE: This is my personal opinion and thoughts of the game, not an overall view if the game for general audience. As with many reviews and opinions, take this with a grain of salt and do your own research.

content:
Posted: July 15, 2014
												I've been playing this game since the closed beta. When the game finally launched I've been playing this for a few months. Now I'm back I don't really see significant changes, but when I played the game I did really enjoy it. Before this game was even launched I was really attracted to the way Aura Kingdom looked. The looks of it were quite promising. Always when I play a MMO I would play it for a few months but then I would take a break. After stopped playing this I haven't found any good MMO's. This game is quite easy in the beginning. You're able to grind really easy but near level 40 it gets a lot harder and it takes mor time to level up. It's fantastic that you're able to use 2 classes on one character. When you've come that far you can use the skills of your second class together with the primary class that you have. Furtherhand I would like to say that this game is a really good starter for people who haven't been playing MMO's. Since the tutorial is very clear it's easy to understand how everything works.

content:
Posted: September 21, 2014
												This game is beautiful, it's got great anime style graphics and an amazing set of armour and clothing choices.10/10 for graphics. 8/10 for game optimization5/10 for difficultyand 10/10 for gameplay.This game in a whole is worth playing, it's fun in short. It's a /Extremely/ easy game for all to play. I played it for 11 hours and got from level 1 - level 42, I had a create time conversing with the commuinity of the game and fighting my way through the typical sort of mmo questing sysetem. The dungeons are probably the best bit of this game, especially the bits of seen for hell-mode. The dungeons are insane, so much colours and things going on at once you really feel like you're controlling some sort of really OP anime character.Pro's--F2P and a very good F2P model at that.-Beautiful world to explore. -A great anime style; probably the best yet.-Fun gameplay.-A lot of the quests are completely opptional it won't /make/ you pay for anything to get along in the game.-Easy, this could be good or bad depending on your opinion.Con's-This is going to be the biggest thing I'm going to raise, because it's what made me stop playing.-The AP store, the place where you use real money to buy in game things, not important things that give you an advantage over anyone else, just mounts, costumes, random things...AND THE F**KING SUBCLASS CHANGE. That's right, being a "Noob" to this game I had know idea that you're supposed to take a certain subclass taht went well with the first class you had, it would be fine if this change costed in game currency or a small amount of loyalty points. BUT NO. it costs !!!£20!!!For something that small but still something so drastic and needed for the gameplay, for this single thing the developers get!0/10! EA STATUS.-The game is your typical mmo. Kill 9 of these, then hand in the quest. It's normally okay though since it's masked by the beautiful gameplay.-The music was♥♥♥♥♥♥ sorry people but yes. The same soundtrack...Over  & over...Just...ugh.-PvP is completely one sided, it's no wonder barley anyone does it, Gunslingers rule the battlefield.-Not much end game content. The extent of what you do is farm to get the best mounts and costumes.In short, this game is great. Just be careful of the choices you make sometimes...Because the developers are gonna make you pay big.This game get's 7/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 14, 2015
												Hmm, what do I say about this game? I was on the fence on if I wanted to reccomend this game or not. There are several appealing aspects of this game, but there's also some rather significant flaws. I finally decided to reccomend it based on one simple fact: It's free. Everything is better when it's free. Currently I'm level 40 so I'll just upvote it and list off the major pros/cons that I've encountered so far. Pros: Everything in this game looks rather nice. The anime style might shy a few people away but overall I think most people would consider it a positive. All of your attacks are big and flashy, the scenery is very colorful, the music is nice, it just looks good.There's definately enough character variety in terms of combat. There's a whole 12 classes to choose from and each can be customized in several ways to your liking. You will definately find at least one playstyle you can enjoy.When you see the "Free to Play" tag on a game, especially an RPG game, and double especially on an MMO RPG game, be wary of P2W. In this case though, that beloved "Free to Play" tag really means what it says. You absolutely do not need to spend money for this game. You can but you don't have to.This game isn't too easy or too hard. Actually It's more like this game is both easy and hard. Most of the time you can just wander around anihillating the random monsters during quests, but there is absolutely proper challenge to be had here, no matter what your level.Eidolons are quite helpful and interact with you a lot. They talk enough to make them more than random NPCs but not enough that it's annoying. Eidolons are also customizable, there are several to choose from once you get to a high enough level, and there's very powerful equipment you can eventually unlock for them (for free) which is another thing to strive for. They also are actually useful in battle and give your character a lot of extra power.Pretty nice social aspect. Most people are nice enough. It is very easy to make a guild, get into a party, make friends, etc. There's a couple bots here and there but I've only encountered them in Naeva and they just spam you a couple messages to buy gold. (BTW don't do that.) Cons: Almost every quest in the game is a) Kill X amount of some monster, b) gather X amount of some item, or c) go to X location and/or talk to someone. I know that this is what MMO RPGs kind of have to do, but this one went way overboard with it. There's a couple unique quests but they're few and far between.While characters are qutie customizable, I think the combat itself is a bit lacking. For one thing, if you have a melee class you cannot run from any enemy. They can just swat the air a mile away and it will still hit you if you're in combat with them. Also, due to the attacks being so flashy, it is sometimes very hard to see what you're actually doing. Many times the combat just boils down to spamming your attack buttons.Exploration is non-existent in this game. If you go to an area like Helonia and decide to wander around and do random things, I guarantee that everything you do you will eventually have to do in a quest. Every single enemy, every single dungeon, every single NPC (which isn't there for hidden quests or shops or anything), are all part of a quest at some point. On top of that, each area is actually quite small, and you will be amazed at how many invisible walls there are. This is probably one of my biggest complaints with the game. If you want to just casually wander and mess about with random things, you're not going to have a great time because there's nothing to do.Now that I've gotten to level 40 there's definately more that the game has to offer and there will be quite a bit more at level 60. However, looking back I can't help but feel that below level 40 you're just wasting you're time grinding. Unless you're playing with friends I feel that the only really fun stuff is locked untill level 60. Admittedly it doesn't take that long to get there, you could probably get to level 40 in 4 hours if you really rushed it, though I don't know if that slows down closer to 60. Still though, like I said before in my previous bullet, there's just nothing to casually mess about with.I havn't done much PVP but from what I've seen it's pretty stupid. Balancing 12 classes is virtually impossible and anyone who tries is a madman. Some classes fill somewhat specific roles in a party and are pretty bad at soloing and thus bad at PVP. Again, not nearly as bad with friends but besides that its a waste of time.In conclusion, I probably would not reccomend this game if it wasn't free. There is fun to be had but there are massive issues with the game. Don't let that scare you away though, I am still reccomending it. Everything is better when it's free. Go ahead and play, see what you think of it and maybe you can look past the game's issues more than I can.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2015
												Ah AK, the game where there's no shame in looking up guides or at the wikia.Now is this game Pay Two Win? Nah. You can easily now get the same stuff paying users have due to all the guides posted on how to get gold in this game fast. The game gets boring though eventually at level 50+. My advice on how to get leveled up fast is. NEVER. INTERACT. WITH PEOPLE. Seriously it took me over a year to get to level 50 because I rather not do dungeons and quests instead I hung out with friends on there. So yes, be a anti-social lonewolf apparently. Because that's how it worked for me, then again I was pretty frickin' lazy in general lel.Now Guilds in this game, oooooh boy guilds. I'd say don't bother with 'em there are very few guilds that I enjoyed being in. You just gotta pick the right one. Though I'm now no longer part of this guild business. But guildies out there, have a good time k?So would I reccommend this game? Yea, s'got a slow start to it but it gets fun during the middle, will go back to slow start once you reach lvl 50+.tl;dr: Play the game yourself if you want to see if it's good or not.EDIT: I've reached Level 70 a few months ago and I'll tell you now boys♥♥♥♥♥♥doesn't really change other than a new Otherworld and a few more dungeons unlock. Getting money is still a hassle along with finding materials to suit your build needs, my luck with fortification RNG is still as bad as ever so I got that going for me. However I have essentially quit this game, not because of the reasons above. It's because it's just not fun anymore, I log in obviously here and there to see any new content changes (excluding eidolon additions/new costumes) I'm talking more of newer activites to do such as more quests for not only older players but the new folks too. Hardly any of me mates get on this now since Aeria's new game came out (though it looks like this game but just chibified, however looks CAN be decieving.) or they just moved on to other things. For my first ACTUAL MMO RPG it was a fun ride while it lasted, but got stale rather quickly.tl;dr: Game just gets stale after the level 60-70 mark.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 16, 2014
												As an avid player of MMORPGs, this caught my eye immediately (especially when it came to Steam and I didn't have to use the Aeria Games launcher, kekeke) when I saw it.You play as an Envoy of Gaia, and because of this you can summon creatures known as Eidolons to fight alongside you. Dragons, maidens, fairies, unicorns, golems, all sorts. To start with, I picked Grimm, and have recently unlocked Sigrun and Gigas. You can name these anything you want, so the names don't particularly matter. There are plenty of different classes to fit your playing style. I, personally, have used a Bard - a healing class - all the way to level 43 as of writing this. I chose Sorcerer as my secondary class at level 40. The stats system is a little unbalanced and there are glitches here and there, but the game as a whole completely overpowers these with its good graphics and intuitive game mechanicsThe game itself is gripping and the mechanics are amazing. It's clean, tells you everything you need to know and has a deep, fleshed out story and world. The art style is also adorable, so if anime-style games are your thing, AK is for you. What I love most is the questing mechanics. Any item you need to use or make is shown in the quest tracker, and all you have to do is double click the objective and you automatically travel there on an adorable ostrich by the name of Beebis. What I love is that killstealing does not exist. So long as you contribute to the killing of an enemy, everyone gets the same amount of XP, the kill registers and everyone gets their own drops, so no need to worry about someone else stealing your kill for a quest.It looks a little inaccessible once you see all of the different things you can do, such as fortification, equipment salvaging and feeding your Eidolons with experience crystals. However these are introduced in interactive quests, and are presented very well.My one complaint is the abundance of jiggle physics in the female characters... but hey, it's an anime game, and it's rather unnoticeable except for the female Eidolons. If anything, it's hilarious to watch!I would highly recommend to any fantasy RPG lover.

content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												I enjoyed Eden Eternal (another game by Aeria Games). Aura Kingdomes is the inproved version of that game. It is stroy driven and you cna play it solo for the most part. It has a cooldown system, meaning there is no mana involved, which is a huge + for me, because i allways forget to pop the mana pots. The combat is fluid, fast and nice to watch. And all bosses and even some normal mobs have AOE moves that you can dodge by actually walking out of them. You can also fly at any time. You get upgraded mounts as the game progreses. You also get costumes that all look different every 5-10 levels (as quest items). In daily quests you get costumes aswell and they last foerever and aren't 3-day costumes (you can get those too tho). Overall i recommend the game and since i used to play mmo's a lot in the past this one is refreshing to play, because it's simply a blast to play.

content:
Posted: March 14, 2015
												This game is the kind that makes you want to sit down and play through it, with it's amazing anime style graphics and characters, it's infinite side quests, the attractive storyline, and the companionship between you and your Eidelon. The PvP is a great way to make friends in friendly competition, and hone your battle skills against other real people like yourself. Don't think your character looks good enough? During the game you will find and revieve many different Avatars to put on top of your Equipment, and if that isn't enough then you can always go to the Item Mall and purchase something of your own interest. Overall, this is a fantastic game. I've recomended it to all of my friends, and so should you. I'm always looking for people to play with, so if you'd like then shoot me a friend request here on Steam and I'll see what I can do. Hope this review helped ^^

content:
Posted: October 29, 2014
												This game really impressed me, out of all the free to play mmorpg's on Steam, this one I recommend over all others. This game has a multitude of good aspects, for instance the classes. This game has a large amount of classes available immediately, and in addition at level 40 you can choose a second class. The game has absolutely no need to spend real money in, leveling is fairly well paced throughout the game (I've only had to grind for a level twice) and all items you can spend money on are either customisation, mounts (you get one for free before you even reach level 10), or items you can get by playing the game. The game also has a great guild system, which encourages members to aid their guild so it can level up to provide bonuses to all members of the guild. Graphically the game actually looks pretty good, with an anime inspired art design and some decently creative orginal monster designs. Gameplay is your standard hotkey system mmorpg style, while I have railed on this system multiple times in the past, this game did it well in my opinion. Unlike other games using the hotkey system, Aura Kingdom made it enjoyable by 1. Not requiring me to mash a button for my standard attack (I'm looking at you Star Wars the Old Republic) 2. Having enjoyably flashy ability animations and 3. providing a cool combo system with the second class (which with the correct combinations of weapons can lead to powerful special abilities). The only complaint I have with this game is the story, it's not bad and it's not the game's fault that I don't enjoy it. Due to the previously mentioned Star Wars the Old Republic I have a hard time enjoying mmorpg's that don't at least have voice acting, though as said it's my fault. If you enjoy games with an anime art style, mmorpg's, or mmo's in general, you will love this game and I can't recommend it enough. Other wise definitely give it a shot. Finally though, if you aren't a fan of any of the previously mentioned then admittedly this game won't change your mind on the genre.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 21, 2014
												This game is beautiful, it's got great anime style graphics and an amazing set of armour and clothing choices.10/10 for graphics. 8/10 for game optimization5/10 for difficultyand 10/10 for gameplay.This game in a whole is worth playing, it's fun in short. It's a /Extremely/ easy game for all to play. I played it for 11 hours and got from level 1 - level 42, I had a create time conversing with the commuinity of the game and fighting my way through the typical sort of mmo questing sysetem. The dungeons are probably the best bit of this game, especially the bits of seen for hell-mode. The dungeons are insane, so much colours and things going on at once you really feel like you're controlling some sort of really OP anime character.Pro's--F2P and a very good F2P model at that.-Beautiful world to explore. -A great anime style; probably the best yet.-Fun gameplay.-A lot of the quests are completely opptional it won't /make/ you pay for anything to get along in the game.-Easy, this could be good or bad depending on your opinion.Con's-This is going to be the biggest thing I'm going to raise, because it's what made me stop playing.-The AP store, the place where you use real money to buy in game things, not important things that give you an advantage over anyone else, just mounts, costumes, random things...AND THE F**KING SUBCLASS CHANGE. That's right, being a "Noob" to this game I had know idea that you're supposed to take a certain subclass taht went well with the first class you had, it would be fine if this change costed in game currency or a small amount of loyalty points. BUT NO. it costs !!!£20!!!For something that small but still something so drastic and needed for the gameplay, for this single thing the developers get!0/10! EA STATUS.-The game is your typical mmo. Kill 9 of these, then hand in the quest. It's normally okay though since it's masked by the beautiful gameplay.-The music was♥♥♥♥♥♥ sorry people but yes. The same soundtrack...Over  & over...Just...ugh.-PvP is completely one sided, it's no wonder barley anyone does it, Gunslingers rule the battlefield.-Not much end game content. The extent of what you do is farm to get the best mounts and costumes.In short, this game is great. Just be careful of the choices you make sometimes...Because the developers are gonna make you pay big.This game get's 7/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 14, 2015
												Hmm, what do I say about this game? I was on the fence on if I wanted to reccomend this game or not. There are several appealing aspects of this game, but there's also some rather significant flaws. I finally decided to reccomend it based on one simple fact: It's free. Everything is better when it's free. Currently I'm level 40 so I'll just upvote it and list off the major pros/cons that I've encountered so far. Pros: Everything in this game looks rather nice. The anime style might shy a few people away but overall I think most people would consider it a positive. All of your attacks are big and flashy, the scenery is very colorful, the music is nice, it just looks good.There's definately enough character variety in terms of combat. There's a whole 12 classes to choose from and each can be customized in several ways to your liking. You will definately find at least one playstyle you can enjoy.When you see the "Free to Play" tag on a game, especially an RPG game, and double especially on an MMO RPG game, be wary of P2W. In this case though, that beloved "Free to Play" tag really means what it says. You absolutely do not need to spend money for this game. You can but you don't have to.This game isn't too easy or too hard. Actually It's more like this game is both easy and hard. Most of the time you can just wander around anihillating the random monsters during quests, but there is absolutely proper challenge to be had here, no matter what your level.Eidolons are quite helpful and interact with you a lot. They talk enough to make them more than random NPCs but not enough that it's annoying. Eidolons are also customizable, there are several to choose from once you get to a high enough level, and there's very powerful equipment you can eventually unlock for them (for free) which is another thing to strive for. They also are actually useful in battle and give your character a lot of extra power.Pretty nice social aspect. Most people are nice enough. It is very easy to make a guild, get into a party, make friends, etc. There's a couple bots here and there but I've only encountered them in Naeva and they just spam you a couple messages to buy gold. (BTW don't do that.) Cons: Almost every quest in the game is a) Kill X amount of some monster, b) gather X amount of some item, or c) go to X location and/or talk to someone. I know that this is what MMO RPGs kind of have to do, but this one went way overboard with it. There's a couple unique quests but they're few and far between.While characters are qutie customizable, I think the combat itself is a bit lacking. For one thing, if you have a melee class you cannot run from any enemy. They can just swat the air a mile away and it will still hit you if you're in combat with them. Also, due to the attacks being so flashy, it is sometimes very hard to see what you're actually doing. Many times the combat just boils down to spamming your attack buttons.Exploration is non-existent in this game. If you go to an area like Helonia and decide to wander around and do random things, I guarantee that everything you do you will eventually have to do in a quest. Every single enemy, every single dungeon, every single NPC (which isn't there for hidden quests or shops or anything), are all part of a quest at some point. On top of that, each area is actually quite small, and you will be amazed at how many invisible walls there are. This is probably one of my biggest complaints with the game. If you want to just casually wander and mess about with random things, you're not going to have a great time because there's nothing to do.Now that I've gotten to level 40 there's definately more that the game has to offer and there will be quite a bit more at level 60. However, looking back I can't help but feel that below level 40 you're just wasting you're time grinding. Unless you're playing with friends I feel that the only really fun stuff is locked untill level 60. Admittedly it doesn't take that long to get there, you could probably get to level 40 in 4 hours if you really rushed it, though I don't know if that slows down closer to 60. Still though, like I said before in my previous bullet, there's just nothing to casually mess about with.I havn't done much PVP but from what I've seen it's pretty stupid. Balancing 12 classes is virtually impossible and anyone who tries is a madman. Some classes fill somewhat specific roles in a party and are pretty bad at soloing and thus bad at PVP. Again, not nearly as bad with friends but besides that its a waste of time.In conclusion, I probably would not reccomend this game if it wasn't free. There is fun to be had but there are massive issues with the game. Don't let that scare you away though, I am still reccomending it. Everything is better when it's free. Go ahead and play, see what you think of it and maybe you can look past the game's issues more than I can.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2015
												Ah AK, the game where there's no shame in looking up guides or at the wikia.Now is this game Pay Two Win? Nah. You can easily now get the same stuff paying users have due to all the guides posted on how to get gold in this game fast. The game gets boring though eventually at level 50+. My advice on how to get leveled up fast is. NEVER. INTERACT. WITH PEOPLE. Seriously it took me over a year to get to level 50 because I rather not do dungeons and quests instead I hung out with friends on there. So yes, be a anti-social lonewolf apparently. Because that's how it worked for me, then again I was pretty frickin' lazy in general lel.Now Guilds in this game, oooooh boy guilds. I'd say don't bother with 'em there are very few guilds that I enjoyed being in. You just gotta pick the right one. Though I'm now no longer part of this guild business. But guildies out there, have a good time k?So would I reccommend this game? Yea, s'got a slow start to it but it gets fun during the middle, will go back to slow start once you reach lvl 50+.tl;dr: Play the game yourself if you want to see if it's good or not.EDIT: I've reached Level 70 a few months ago and I'll tell you now boys♥♥♥♥♥♥doesn't really change other than a new Otherworld and a few more dungeons unlock. Getting money is still a hassle along with finding materials to suit your build needs, my luck with fortification RNG is still as bad as ever so I got that going for me. However I have essentially quit this game, not because of the reasons above. It's because it's just not fun anymore, I log in obviously here and there to see any new content changes (excluding eidolon additions/new costumes) I'm talking more of newer activites to do such as more quests for not only older players but the new folks too. Hardly any of me mates get on this now since Aeria's new game came out (though it looks like this game but just chibified, however looks CAN be decieving.) or they just moved on to other things. For my first ACTUAL MMO RPG it was a fun ride while it lasted, but got stale rather quickly.tl;dr: Game just gets stale after the level 60-70 mark.

content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												I enjoyed Eden Eternal (another game by Aeria Games). Aura Kingdomes is the inproved version of that game. It is stroy driven and you cna play it solo for the most part. It has a cooldown system, meaning there is no mana involved, which is a huge + for me, because i allways forget to pop the mana pots. The combat is fluid, fast and nice to watch. And all bosses and even some normal mobs have AOE moves that you can dodge by actually walking out of them. You can also fly at any time. You get upgraded mounts as the game progreses. You also get costumes that all look different every 5-10 levels (as quest items). In daily quests you get costumes aswell and they last foerever and aren't 3-day costumes (you can get those too tho). Overall i recommend the game and since i used to play mmo's a lot in the past this one is refreshing to play, because it's simply a blast to play.

Pets or "Eidolons" as they are called in this game, are quite unique, and are a key part of the game's story. 												Having been a avid player of "World of Warcraft", I eventually got tired of having to pay a subscription to play a game, so I quit. Upon quitting, I looked up and down for free mmo's that would keep my attention. Some fell flat, some were pay to win, some were just not able to run on my computer. Then I found this game. At first, I shrugged it off, and kept looking for something different. I'm a big fan of anime style art, so I kept this open as sort of a "last resort" if you will. After searching and searching, I took one last look at this game, my finger resting on the X (close) button. I decided to google some game play and character design. After looking through that, I thought to myself "You know what.. this seems like a game that I'd pass up just because it doesn't look like something my fiance' and I can play together, but I'm going to give it a shot, merely based on the fact that it IS something that I probably wouldn't think to try or download."So, I went ahead and downloaded it and got to the character customization screen. I panicked because loading INTO the CAC screen, I was lagging hard core. I started to lose hope. I looked through the (limited) but cute customizations for your character, eventually found one that I liked and joined the world. Fortunately, the lag was no more, yay!! That would have been the kicker if it lagged during game play.  I played the introduction scenario and was hooked after that. The big test was...would my fiance like it?The answer was yes! He really enjoys it. He was a bit hesitent at first, but after playing he really enjoyed the art style, the vivid, bright colors of the game, and he REALLY enjoyed the fact that the armor didn't look like your typical, boring earth tone peasant armor that most mmo games give you as a "noob". There are a lot of features I could name off that are really cool, and a couple of things I don't really care for but I'll just name a few as to not make this longer than it already is, so here it goes!PROS:  Great art style, enjoyable fighting style, pretty spells (especially the bard with her rainbow magic powers!!), the random "hidden quests" you can find through out the land, recieving really pretty costumes instead of having to decide "do I want to look stupid, or spend money on overpriced costumes?" (That is also an option though, if you're interested in that kind of thing!)  Character designs are adorable as heck, and the ability to have a shared slot in your bank is GREAT!  Also, getting bags from quest is a nice feature. There are a lot of different classes to choose from as well which is great because I tend to get picky on classes. I believe there are 11 classes to choose from thus far, with another one on the way. You're pretty much bound to find a class you enjoy playing! CONS: BOTS! Ugh!! I really hope the bots die down, but they're everywhere! Since the game has an "auto run to quest" feature (which is great when you are on the phone or need to get up and do something :P) bots use that to their fullest potential and run around leveling up so they can make it to the first big city to spam you with mail for cheap gold. It's very unfortunate, but luckily the bots don't hinder the grinding because the enemies spawn back fairly fast.  Aside from the bots, I'd have to say I'd LOVE the feature to turn on and off the "spell description" where you hover over your spells and it pops up a huuugeeee box saying what the spell does. It's possible that this feature does in fact exist, and I just overlooked it during the 10 minutes that I searched for it, but if it does exist then it's called something else and I overlooked it. I am used to being what most people would call "a clicker" so the boxes covering my entire screen were kind of an eye sore. I don't click anymore in this game, but I kind of feel bad for people who do click because then it covers their character's while they fight and really takes away from the awesomeness of the epic monster battles.I'd have to say that I'd give this game at LEAST a 7/10. It's really, really fun and I enjoy the heck out of it, but it could definitely do without those bots.  I'd recommend this to anyone who enjoys mmos, and anime art.  That, and some of the purchasable costumes are soooooooooooo cuuuuuttteeeee!!!! <3 <3 <3 I don't normally do this, but when I get some extra cash on hand I definitely want to buy a pair of glasses for my adorable bard! Keep up the great work with this game, Aura Kingdom devs. I appreciate the fun this game brings to my fiance and I :)

content:
Posted: March 14, 2015
												This game is the kind that makes you want to sit down and play through it, with it's amazing anime style graphics and characters, it's infinite side quests, the attractive storyline, and the companionship between you and your Eidelon. The PvP is a great way to make friends in friendly competition, and hone your battle skills against other real people like yourself. Don't think your character looks good enough? During the game you will find and revieve many different Avatars to put on top of your Equipment, and if that isn't enough then you can always go to the Item Mall and purchase something of your own interest. Overall, this is a fantastic game. I've recomended it to all of my friends, and so should you. I'm always looking for people to play with, so if you'd like then shoot me a friend request here on Steam and I'll see what I can do. Hope this review helped ^^

Posted: July 5, 2014
												Playing a small amount of this game, I quite like it. Gameplay and combat is good and the game is well polished although there are a few major problems. The game auto sets resolution on first open to 800x600, there is too much hud and makes the game a little harder to concentrate and play on with hud crowding every edge of your screen completely, this hud needs to be simplified. Lastly the combat although good and interesting, it needs a tweak so you can lock onto targets if you wish and some other fixes. All in all though, its a good game. 7/10

												I've started the game a few days before it was released on Steam. For any anime mmorpg fans that are looking for a good casual game to play, this would be it! For what it is, it's worth trying out to see if you like it or not. Each class is different, giving varities of characters to play as. The quest system in this game is farily easy since it has a tracking system as well whether you need trouble or just lazy to go to the area. You get a Eidolon which acts as your partner to help kill enemies as well as unlocking a special finisher, fancy animation for every class.All in all it's worthy game to try out. You won't lose much since it's a F2P

content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												Pro cons1- For anyone that does not want spent any real cash on games, this mmorpg is a good for you.   There no unfair when come to PVP with big cash player , everyone could have same gear in the end.   Everyone get to max out their equitment and costume, doesn't care you spent any real cash or didn't spent any.If you ask Why?All the Cash item available, you able farm/get ingame with a system called "Paragon" with using "loyalty points".There many way to get loyalty points, by guild instance, daily quest, daily achievement, monster drop, fishing, etc.Myself get minimun 400 loyalty points per day, Highest can go 1500 above.Depend on how hardcore you are and how fast you grind ..2- you won't bored, there a lot mini game/battle field/arena/5 people dungeon/40 people raid    example:     card duel - challenge AI or other player like Yu gi oh :)		battleground - resource war	                arena - like dota map, tower push and base destroy(6-8hour per day for me still not able to complete everything i want, it's too many things to do ingame lol)Bad cons1- require good pc when party 40people  raid, there a system you could hide non-party member out of your screen but still didn't reduce much lag lol ...2- Exp for each level after lv65 are insane up, after lv74 madness.     Current Max lv80..The STEAM hour played recorded here short because i had played half year before STEAM take this game in.The different Install from STEAM or from AERIA official website is addition software require to install.The reason i use STEAM is to skip this "install Aeria ignite software", it take time loading before you can start AK game client too.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 28, 2015
												Please take note that by the time i wrote this review i consumed 3000+ hours of my life in this gameINTRO:aura kingdom is an anime oriented point and click dress up game w/ dungeon crawling , resource gathering , questing and in depth customization. having eidolons that are either strong companions w/ massive awsomeness like dragons or virtual waifu like scantly clad F cup tanned skin angel w/ pigtails or a wihe haired nine tailed fox wearing a kimono and hakama. and make it an MMORPG.its a fun game with friends and rivals, more funny or sometimes annoying with some drama going on the world chat that added spice to the everyday life. here you take the role of an envoy of gaia , good tutorial , great auto move and quests are easy to do since its already there most of the time one click away. enemies are noted and you can see in their portrait icons to know their attack and drops. PROS: (in my opinion)Leveling and Questing> just by doing the quest you earn free costumes some tradable and wargear that are bound. you earn 4 of the 11 (IIRC ) guild house eidolons to accompany you permanently for all your char in that account. by completing the main story you can earn up to level 62+ just doing the main story alone and max is level 80 Currencies in game> there are a lot of currency in game that you cant trade and Most of them are not even attaiable in the item mall meaning P2W wallet warriors have to grind like you to attain those resorce. the basic is silver and 1k silver =1gold aside from that you have Tokens that you can trade for Skill masteries and items in navea, archeology tokens that can be traded for eidolon stat boost and upgrade material , war coins for Pvp gear , honnor for premium pvp weapons, Aeria points (your typical premium cash shop currency beloved by wallet warriors) , dragon points that you can trade to many usefull items like weapons,armor,mastery and costumes as well as mounts and LOYALTYLOYALTY> an in game currency that allows you to farm by doing daily quests and achivements. unlocking certain achievements and rewards from certain bosses. this is the cream of the crop for non wallet warriors. this allow you to purchase loyalty items from the item mall just the same as the regular item mall items just bound to your account. so you can work your way to expnding your inventory farming resources killing boss and doing daily quest to earn this. hell you can even use this to buy a 1 week limited to 1 transaction of 5k ruby coins for you to use on the premium item shop roullette that changes certain times a week or day depending on events. so you have a chance to earn some of the wallet warriors items as well or trade them for gold and but things you like in the auction house.Eidolons> they are no mere pets. they are summonable companions that help you buff you, heal you or grind enemies to chunks of meat or fine mist. there are all sorts of shapes sizes and personality. from pony unicorns , pokemons , bishonen , armored valkyrie , Mecha to Super Moe-tan loli or Half naked waifu. certain eidolons can be upgraded to change their appearance some losses more of their clothes. some gets more spikes in the armor. a good example you liked your Loli Sylph.... how about dress her in a maid costume w/ shimpan pantsu? you loved your nine tailed kitsune in kimono and hakama? how about you make the top exposing half the PLOT and the skirt to be trimmed to micro mini exposing the HEAVENS. better eye candy? what if you liked the armored knight of the sun but is curious why he covers his face , then upgrade him to remove that coif and get spiked armor. more or less you will find an eidolon that will suit you or your eyes. either for the PURE AWSOMENESS , the PLOT or the Moe factor.you have a chance to get their fragments if you fight and defeat them in certain instances or eidolon temple and guild hall. 10 fragments can be crafted into 1 key to allow you to summon that said eidolon into your account regardless of your characters.(PLEASE note that eidolon keys to aquire eidolon , eidlon fragments that refines to keys are ALL BOUND / NON TRADABLE ) Skill materies , Customization and in Depth Combination to meet your play style>you can change some of the masteries of some skill to tweak their behavior while some may give debuff some will do more damage or buff. you have stats to allocate and not like other games that are PRE-ALLOCATED so you can have a tanky healler you can have a battle tank, you can make a glass cannon tatchi weilding ronin , and the good thing about this is you can reset it EVERY TIME YOU WANT as long as you have the GOLD the basic resource or in game money. you have secret stones to allocate w/c skill to buff and w/c stats to buff. Instance Farming limitation:> this is the best way to earn rare drops , reseource , silvers items to sell and weapon and armor boxes as well as dragon points. so basically its something that has cool downs. relatively 2hrs for party , 3 hrs for hell , 6 hrs for dragons and eidolon temple. 8 hrs for the abyss.  to some who plays overly enthusiastic about it this is a negative since they play like 18+hrs a day in my case this is a way to ensure the proper allocation of resources from the market so it wont crash the prices. (NOTE: bot issues abuse these)Boosted EXP> you get them by just logging in a daily basis , some can be earned from leveling your friends intimacy levels , some are granted from armor like the said aura armor (full set gets 20% more exp.cash shop item) BUT its not limited to cash shops alone.craft your own blessed pieces of armor accesories and trophy and each set and get 5% more exp from each parts. they can be dropped from monster reward chests starting the 2nd map.just get into a party of 5 having 5% more exp w/ each other party member to a max of 20% more. exp can be boosted to 500% (IIRC) but i can earn as much as 280+% more w/ my friends and certain item setsthe AUCTION HOUSE> the more you save the more you have the more you check the auction house the more tendency you spend. this will be your friend to earn your gold. The tool for you to attain most of the basic way to earn your way to "CAPITALISM HOOOOO!" since most cash shop items are sold here given its not bound.Free to play = pay if you just want some shortcut but you have to grind like the others to get what you need>if you read about the loyalty , exp boost and archeology from earlier notes these are the long term things you need to keep in mind. and even wallet warriors may be amazed how you along with your friends level faster than them going solo.you can upgrade your set to max+ by slowly doing archeology from multiple characters daily to earn tokens to exchange for a chance to upgrade your gear and if they fail they will not break by default just add their potential and get the potential to 100% and it instantly upgrades.. The Dress up factor> do you want to be kirito in azunas clothes? dress as a scantly clad panty flashing magical girl,a female walking tank w/o fan service, a samurai,a kimono wearing fairy or a kemono mimi loli w/ backpack? this is the game for you. first there are basic costumes that cannot be dyed. then there are amazing custom costumes that can be dyed w/ 24 (IIRC) colors that suits your needs , wants , envy and desires . you have headgear, face gear, armor, back apparel and the mount. while they provide stats except the mount. custom gear gives additional +1% to all stats that are noticably better and can be dyed. eventually you can dress up like your favorite anime char like kirito,asuna,hatsune miku,mikasa,illiasveil/irisveil,saber -clones or create your own dress up avatar CROSSPLAY is limited due to girly boys since there are no options for battle scarred man sauce in the avatar listCons:BotsLAGtoo much repetitive if you have 4 lvl 60 chars and 3 lvl 73+ chars< ENVY >and my family and friends dont know me anymore

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 28, 2015
												So, let me start off by saying that while the game does have issues, It's still a great game.- The story is nice, the auto route system is great to have (I can't stand manually going to every place in every quest). - The gameplay is pretty good, but can get a bit repetitive at times. Most quest are kill this, find that, same thing.- However, the story kept it fun enough for me to keep playing. Now, let's move on to the issues.- Bots, Bots, and more bots. If you can ignore these, than you should be fine. However, the chat is flooded by spam bots.- Lag. The game suffers from server lag, Probably from all those bots. Changing channels to a channel with less people on it usually helps. - The game suffers from stutter while loading in things. That doesn't really surprise me though, as many games of this kind have that issue. The game's optimization isn't the best either. The system requirements are far off.- I played before the steam version came out, and even played in the closed beta. However, I ended up taking a long break from the game, maybe because of some repetitiveness. - Leveling at first is pretty easy, but once you hit the 40ish point, it gets harder. I currently have a Level 60, and I'm struggling to get even a single level. I would hate to see how hard it is at a higher level.- The games graphics are pretty good, and it most cases, the game looks beautiful, even without high end textures.If you're looking for an Anime style MMO, then try the game out. It's free, so you don't lose much by trying it.I will add more to this review in the future when I progress more.EDIT: So, I'm back into the game, and time to do a small update:Leveling is easier than before. I'm not sure what change they made, but whatever they did, it's much better. Before, over half a main area of quests gave me 25% exp at level 62. Now, one quest can give me about 7-10% exp (with XP cards, 20% XP boost). I'm now at 71, and will update this if I get further, and leveling becomes very hard again.Something I want to add though, even after a year and a half of being inactive, and even made a purchase at one point, I did not get banned. However, I did log in once in a while to keep one of my lower level characters from being deleted.

It's not perfect, but it has better combat and more simple class creation.

It is very casual, just press a button and you can auto run to most quest objectives. It is also pretty buggy so far, I have had trouble running the game and doing things in game because of these bugs.Over all though if you are looking for a really casual PVE oriented, anime style mmo, and dont want to worry about cash shop pay to win, this game might be of interest to you if you're not worried about putting up with some bugs along the way. Aura Kingdom is free, so if you want, go ahead and check it out.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 3, 2014
												As an Anime fan, but not a big MMO fan, i was in search of japanese created games and i stumbled upon this.I can't say much about this game yet becouse i am writing this review after 6 hours of gameplay.Well, first things first. This game is trully an Anime like game. This is the biggest plus in this game so far. NPCs are quite unique, though i sometimes feel a repetitive scene when fighting some mobs (especially humans, like pirates), but still creature mobs are so unique and interesting that i feel a pleasure just roaming and watching them pass me by.Bad thing is that quests are dull. Like, take that, bring that, kill that, collect that. It's pretty much repetitive. But its not a problem for a free game (most of the rpgs have same kind of quests anyway). There are many hidden quests, that start with the player checking some container or an item. And there are alot of bounties, side quests and stuff like that. It's all about numbers, not quality.There are 9 classes to choose from. The character creation is so loyal to anime/manga fans that most probably most of you will enjoy. There are some elements that are quite new to me (becouse i dont play MMO often). Like, none of the skills have mana requirements, only cooldowns. And there is no typical Strenght, Endurance, Energy leveling. You get ATK Points and DEF points. In ATK section you level damage, critical hit chance or attack speed, and in DEF section you level armor rating or evasion.You can have a pet here. Ranging from faries to ponies (Yes, MLP fans, this game is for you too!) That pet levels with you and it can get you presents every 10 minutes for some kind of energy points. To restore points, you need to talk with your pet. The dialogue is pretty solid, sometimes fun. So you need to take care not only about your character, but about your pet as well.Overall, this game is still in open beta stage. There are some bugs, sometimes server lags and that kind of stuff. This game isn't the perfect game ever, some things really bug me (like, why doesnt character look depend on a costume but not the armor?). But still, i had a pleasure playing it. So check that out, for a free game and for a beta stage, it's awesome.Pros: + Loyal to anime fans (even MLP?) + Beautiful world + Pretty much original + Nice soundtrack + Awesome Eidolon (Pet) system.Cons: - Bugs and freezes - Missing sounds for enemy mobs or ambience. - Only 10 hairstyles :( - This game begs you to find friends, becouse some quests can't be passed without a party. - Mini-games with you controling other NPCs feel unfinished and lousy. - Disguises just give you a model to wear, not a costume itself.Final Verdict: 7 hairstyles out of 10

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2015
												I thought I'd put in my imput on this game. First off, when looking for an MMO with Anime Graphics and free-roam style... this is so far the only game that has hit the spot. I fell in love and I now have been playing it non-stop for three days, just short of 40 hours now.TRUE - Players are not overly friendly and do not go out of their way to say Hello or RolePlay (I come from World of Warcraft) so players NOT roleplaying was a little different.FALSE - Players only seek to use you. I've met some very nice people and have joined a guild that is actually reasonably social. Good players are out there, they are just hidden. Hah.TRUE - The Quests are mostly gathering and killing - basic MMO stuff. Still, I love them because if you listen to the story behind them, they actually make sense. In WoW - they say go get some candles. No explanation for why... just go get me some freaking candles. So you do. In this game, your goal is clear and everyone's quests are to help them help you. It makes sense why you go gather mushrooms or kill beetles.TRUE - The AI and BOT models are VERRRRRY overused, but I don't mind it much. As for player models, I haven't seen any close look-alikes and the character creation gives just enough imput.Other Things I Love?I love classifying in two specializations. So i can use guns and swords, etc. It's very cool and something I was sad they started taking away from World of Warcraft (its basically nonexistant).I love the dungeon system. Dungeons are completely solo-able or you can join up and do a party-version. This makes it easy for SOLO players (like myself) to get everything in the game accomplished without searching for people I don't even want to talk too.The game is easy. Not in the sense that it offers no thrill or excitement, but its not overly complicated. Everything is explained in words first and then (for visual people like myself), most everything has a little video to also explain how each element works. Using Gems is explained, creating armor and gear, and even fishing.Fishing is FUN. Its also one of the easiest places to get Gold (WInk WINk).I Love the Companions - they are fun and sooo helpful. I especially Love Merilee!!Costumes are great - no mismatched ugly gear while you're leveling. The best ones must be bought however (SIGH)What I Don't Like?No open world RolePlay - but thats ok. Hey, if you want to Look Me Up. I love RoleplayNot a whole lot of servers.Can only create 9 characters, but there are 12 classes [This isn't overly important since they have duel-classification at level 40, so you can make up for lost classes then.]Gold Farming is Slow. And I do mean SLOOOW. I've farmed gold for weeks in several games but I've never had so much difficulty as in this one.In-Game Real Money:: I've always had a problem with this in games. It bothers me that I can't buy nice things with Gold. They have implemented another Currency to get most of these Real Money items, but its a lot of work (almost too much). Still - despite adding this it is in no way PAY to WIN. You don't have to spend any money to be freaking amazing in this game.I don't if my review helped. But these are some things that I looked at, disliked, loved, and enjoyed.Overall. Get this Game. If you like RPGs with a GOOD Storyline (who doesnt?), Anime Graphics, and MMO, get this game. People say a lot of crap. But this game has been completely worth it for me. :)

content:
Posted: February 29, 2016
												Aura Kingdom is an action-packed anime based MMORPG developed by the X-Legend Company and published by Aeria Games Entertainment. There 13 classes to choose from, and great character customization; not to mention the amazing animation, music, effects and creative story. Find yourself caught in the adventure alongside allies, friends and foes as you travel to different lands uncovering secrets and clues to defeat the darkness. As you level up, you are given the options to do amazingly fun ativities like:-fishing for the big one-finding "the one"-set up shop-learn new skills-uncover hidden artifacts-become the greatest cook in all the land-concer battle towers-form guildsand much much more!!

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 29, 2014
												It's a fun MMORPG with very thick PvE gameplay. So, for reference if you had played another MMORPG, Aura Kingdom might be similar to Luna Online for monster, enemy, and environment. Perfect World for its Quest Based Leveling (yes dungeon & quest are your primary source for level, farming & killing mobs are not necessary). But to top of it, Aura Kingdom compile the best part of MMORPG to date, not too keen for Pay To Win because most dependable item are available through ingame, and you may get items from item mall with Token (available to get) instead of Aeria Points.But every review must have its con, so in my opinion, this game is lack of support from developer and game provider Aeria itself, lack of update, bug fixing, and so on.TL;DRIf you're just a casual player that want some fun without any progressive playing and money-spending, this one suits you best. not necessary to P2W, decent gameplay with friends, and since it's PVE centered, no need of ++++weapon & armor that you should buy with money from other people or grinding too much.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 20, 2014
												Overall fun game to play and is not very difficult to get into. Most the time your character will be auto walking to the next main objective, which is nice if you're out to play casually. I have yet to make it end game as i am lvl 44 and this review will be edited until then. Pros: -Class system that involves class combos with special skills as the result of it-Simple rewards system for doing sidequests which can give you some nice gear-Cash shop seems to be mostly cosmetic -Crafting your own consumables for dungeons!Cons:-Not all classes can be mixed, only certain class combos get special skills out of it which makes it feel like you would have to follow this combo only. Although it is somewhat understandable.-Cash shop points from buying seem to be really low...im kinda surprised at how much a character slot expansion costs.-Starts to get very repititive, after a while it just gets kinda boring auto walking. The quests range from "kill these guys" to "kill these guys to get a certain item" Conclusion: Like any other game it is definitely not perfect but it is fun to try out and i would recommend this game for someone who plays to play a laidback game. Playing with friends would make the experience a bit more enjoyable since most people you will run into will not be very chatty or you might just get recruited to a guild instead. I hope to give a full review once i reach endgame or if i dont then i will leave it here and give it another edit.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2015
												Didn't know this was on steam but gonna review as an Aeriagames player anyway.Simple Summary:+Everyone have a partner: Eidolon, that assist in combat and give you diverse option of choose that small percentage of shared stats.-some can be accessed through immense effort while most latest can be easily obtained by pay2win, thats normal in a free MMO+every part of the world have the usual level range and quests, you can venture freely doing many immersive side quest-most character's combat are based on stomping keys+the skill tree and path for stats are diverse, a player can have 2 class specialization with more skills.-From the above 2 points, this contrast may fall on an ironic side for certain players+you can glide while travelling around the [field]world freely, or with a mount-It gets grindy like any other casual MMO, but for Aura Kingdom, you get to check through websites to find info about when bosses spawn and where, its like going to your part-time work and find lots of other people are there doing the same.+Efforts are tolerable in gear and level (thanks to being able to fly)-proffesions effort are intolerable (they're still rarely considered for most players to utilise)+gr8 music, tho short-endgame contents are short (as at 2014), which is probably why reaching max level from a few levels away is intensely hard.-changing instances is a 'skill' LEL-hardly noticeable craftings-Bots.... a shietload .__.Conclusion: 7.5/10 for those that likes free MMO, 4.5/10 for the others. #nohashtag

content:
Posted: November 19, 2016
												Wow!.. A free to play anime MMORPG on steam. Great! lets check out (only to get disappointed and bored) Yup u read right one of the most boring games i've played till date. I'll explain you why.....1) Repetitive Mission design : Yaa I know it's a MMORPG, it'll be grindy, but this much? I literally felt sleepy while playing the game that too in broad day light. All the missions include talking to a random NPC then clicking on the mission info and the game takes you to the mission area (yup you don't need to steer the mount or the char game does that for you) Then fight some cute little animals, kill them(why to kill them? they look so cute :'X ) then again come back to the NPC for reward.2) Boring background music : You might not belive me but is true, only 2 or 3 sound generic sound tracks. I completely turned of the in game music (main reason for me to feel sleepy).3)Uninspiring combat : The tab targetting system from World of warcraft is here. But most of the times u don't need to worry because you are so overpowered that you won't be feeling any challenge.Some of the minor annoyances i had with the game are its an instanced mmo and ther is no voice acting for anything other than some tutorial videos.but the game is not all Bad. I really liked the art style. graphically it's not a ground breaker. But it looks good.The concept of Eidolons is too cool. It's just not a side charecter, it will also evlove, help, plays a main role in story.and from what i've seen the story looks interisting. The level cap is level 90, and contains 12 classes to choose from.with that much content it's really a huge game but the question is how much you want to play it?Even thouh the game has some cool ideas and art style with little intersting story, does not do enough to overcome all the negative aspects of the game. I am not recommending this game as I didnot enjoy the game as much as hoped for. But it is free to play. So no loss in trying once...

content:
Posted: February 9, 2015
												I personally enjoy Aura Kingdom because of th Log Horizon and SAO feel of the game. I love anime and I've been searching for a really well graphical anime mmo and thankfully I came across Aura Kingdom. I know some people who just find this game down right boring but if you grab even one person to join you in your adventure you will definitely have fun. My friend and I made new characters and everytime we learned a new skill we dueled one another, although I got obliterated by him it was still fun to get far into the game together. A lot of yelling and a lot of skipping quests that we regret skipping lol. If you wanna play a well designed anime mmo then Aura Kingdom is the one for you. I hope this helps and possibly convinces some of you. Pros:1. Dual class system at level 40. 2. Eidolon/Pet creativity3. Amazing cutscenes that you wouldn't want to missCons: 1. Although this may seem like a stupid con for some of you, leveling is to fast for my liking. In about one day my friend and I got to level 30 (no we didn't stay up the whole night). I like to take it decently slow and sometimes stop for amazing sights. Overall: I think this game is great besides the leveling system and don't worry it's not really pay to play unless you just want a cool mount, I think the free mount that you recieve is cool enough. I mean come on, who doesn't wanna run around exploring on a FREAKING OSTRICH?!Edit: I know I don't have many hours on this game but that is because I used to play it outside of steam and quit it since I got a bit seperated from the game and then when I saw it on steam it brought back good memories.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 13, 2016
												I might have just 48,9 hours into this but still i will make a review.The game is F2P and it looks cool i guess? Dont know what other people will say.The thing that got me into the MMORPG category is Sword Art Online ( I will probably trigger people beacuse of this)At the start i didnt understand anything neither the hud or how you play it... But as 1 hour passed by i was already level 20 and i understanded everything.People say you will have to grind the quest trough the story to get to a higher level and better items... Thats true bot honestly i like that.Good things :It maybe will seem like P2W but it actualy isn't.. The only thing you will maybe end up paying for is costume's , rubies, and some other things... but mostly if you want better weapons you will either have to craft/fuse them or buy them from the auction house which is only for gold and silver... the gold prices for items are high but as you farm you get it easily... (I fished a daimond fish so i got 50 gold :P )There is PVP for those who like it... I don't know how it works though since i only like PVE in team battels or being a solo player...Atributes system is good if you mess up you can reset them except for your main stats i think...The Difficulty in solo duengons is quite fair but you might end up dying once in a while when you get to level 40 and higher.A lot of class and build variety but there are a lot of classes that stand out beacuse of their damage...Bad things:Now honestly i didn't find anything bad about the game except few things... People never play party duengons.., This might just be a thing on Phoenix servers since i mostly play on those.Vault space... I understand that it should be small but they should atleast increase the personal storage room soo you can put anything that you might need inthere...Would i reccomend it?Certanly yes.It's a great MMORPG that isnt P2W based (some people might think it is but its their opinion) It's easy to master the controls and the HUD is somewhat good, But for the most part i would reccomend it to any person that wants to get into MMORPG's and dosent have a good computer.

												So I played for roughly 2 hours. This game amazed me with its anime styled graphics and sounds right when I hopped into the game. I had a ton of fun slashin' through a bunch of weird creatures and completing quests which are pretty easy. I can already feel myself getting hooked to the game. The only negative I had was the co-op...I got a friend to hop on and it was hard to find each other as I had to ran half way across the area we were in. When you party up it does not pop up the quests for your party members so I had no way of knowing how to help my friend. Turns out he doesent like MMO's and he uninstalled :(. But I give this game an 8/10 and I look forward to the many hours that will come with Aura Kingdom!

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2016
												Just ignore the hours it says I have. I didn't initally have this game through Steam. I don't usually write reviews, but Aura Kingdom is different for me. I have played it since beta. Not constantly. I would start it, love it, play obsessively for a month, get bored, move on, come back, repeat. Now, I actually hate this game. It is a grind fest, the combat is awkward, and it is generally a really boring game. And yet despite this, I always come back to it. Why? Because it's a beautiful. Because I like getting to glide. I like having a free ostrich mount. The costumes are cute and the costimizations you can make to your character's apperance are endless. It is a grindfest, yes, but because of this, you can't really pay to win. You HAVE to put the work in to get good gear and level up and all that. My favorite thing about it, though, is how unique you can make your character with the skill points and tree. I also really love being able to get a secondary class. I've always hated being stuck to a singular class when combining some can help make you even greater. Basically, to enjoy this game you have to level up. You have to get past like, level 45-50ish to really start getting to the meat of the game. Getting to that point will require some serious patience. It is boring and dulls the mind but if you get past that, it's a pretty okay game.

content:
Posted: September 9, 2015
												I suppose writing a review for this game is in order.*Ahem*Aura Kingdom is a free to play (mmo) game licensed by Aeria Games. During my first week into the game, I was greeted with the traditional anime esc story about how you are the main character and the world revolves around you. Now this being an MMO I grew tired of reading through everyones dialouge and skipped most of the story until I found myself in Navea. Navea is the main hub for players to sell their items, fight players, window shop, etc. Having made my way to lvl 20 and viewing everyone elses cool costumes and items, I found myself looking through the Auction House. I will say this right now... DO NOT spend any money on this game. Every item can be obtained by completing quests or dungeon running, although it will take far longer your wallet will be thanking you in the end.Now that the fancy costumes are out of the way, we can begin talking about the combat system. Combat in Aura Kingdom is very... spammy? Without knowing any better, you will soon be allocating all your combat points into speed which will reduce the cooldown on all of your abilities. Now with infinite ability spamming, the bosses in this game are a lot easier and reduce the amount of time you spend in dungeons. All in all, the combat system is nice but very broken with the cooldown on all of your abilities... especially the bard class. Would I recommend the game? Yes. Aura Kingdom is a free to play game with a lot potential but is wasted on broken builds and abilities. However, the world is very fruity and with new patches being released every month or so it makes up for the mistakes that it clearly made.

content:
Posted: July 11, 2014
												AK is a complete technical mess. In addition to numerous unaddressed launcher and login issues, you will be lucky to even make it to the login screen in this nightmare. The forums are filled with other users pleading for help that never comes. As a fairly popular MMO that has recently been added to steam, it makes you wonder what the team behind Aura Kingdom is doing with their time and money. That being said, the game itself is nothing special. The tacky writing in the tuturial is enough to make any self respecting gamer cringe. Combat is mind numbingly easy and thoughtless, offering little in terms of interesting gameplay. Movement is awkward unless you enjoy point and click styles you would find in any RTS. You play this game for the dressup, and only that.

content:
Posted: April 16, 2015
												What is there to say about Aura Kingdom?Well, there's a whole lot I can say, I can't just say IGN 1/10 too much water to cover this beast.Aura Kingdom is a fine game, filled with the moe kawaii erm desu chan san senpai nani sore goodness you would expect from its charming aesthetics of course, but that's not all kids! Let's start with the gameplay. CLASS IS IN SESSION (lol puns am I right)!You got your Guardians, your Magicians, your Bards, your Ravagers... OH IT'S SIMPLY SPLENDID! Each class chooses a subclass at level 40! I always thought that your 40s were a time of crisis but not in this reality! Party up with a group of friends and you'll have a blast!Questing is super duper party snooper until you reach 50s which are still okay but then there's level 60 and KABLAMO! You're stuck at 60 years young for quite some time unless you got the skills and the will to survive...SOCIAL LINKS SOCIAL LINKS SOCIAL LINKS SOCIAL LINKS"How do I make friends?"Thanks for asking Jenny, before you get down to business to defeat the Huns you'll want a neato pateeto party of cutie patootie warriors! However many people give you the cold shoulder in this world. All three servers will have their share of antisocials, regulars and over the top bards with strange tendencies to touch your thighs and such. Chimera is the big boy, filled to the brim with peeps, but not a peep can be heard from many of them! Siren is my homeland, a middle ground where less people live but still a large enough amount, and then Hydra is a server full of jolly alts and such, a level 1 on Hydra could have 600 lvl 80 characters hidden away. Spooky? Loominarty confirmed lel jk don't get spooked now!A good way to really make chums is by joining a guild. Guilds grant a lovely exp bonus and plenty of fun events to bring your show and tell objects to. e.g. Guardian Angels (Shameless plug) or jimmies Wonderboys (might not be real). Guild members can form parties with ease, teach eachother techniques and all that bizzle AND THE BEST THING IS THAT IF YOU SPAM GUILD CHAT THEY'LL HAVE TO TALK TO YOU! HOORAY!GRAPHICSeyy der gud, if ya like animoo. Actually you don't need to like anime at all I suppose, the style is PRETTY FLY without straining a low end computer with the terrain deets. The monsters are pretty goofy sometimes but hey, what ya gonnas do about it tough guy? That's what I thought. If you like TF2 or Sanctum it's sort of along those lines! UNDERSTAND!? OKAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAY!THE WARNINGListen here chap or chappete, don't touch the store, especially the paragon table if you value your life. The lucky packs, roulettes and all that goobertron can  get you addicted hardcore! Vegeta what does the scouter say about my spending spree? YOU SPENT OVER 9000 pounds on a hat! WHAT 9000? DARN YOU LUCKY PACKS! Overall I r8 8/8 k no memes involved I love this game despite the lack of middle ground between easy levelling and impossible levelling ya dig? Also yes I like cosmetics and such because I'm such a nerd when it comes to armour GEEZ get off my back, you're not my mamma! Mamma!?8/10 cats +Interesting story+Fun Gameplay+Dancing whilst nude-Where are the cats

content:
Posted: January 6, 2015
												In my experience this game is actually pretty good. The characters are cute, the combat system is straight forward, and the quests and auto-routing makes this game, basically play itself. Now I'm not new to mmos, and I have played countless types of various styles and this one really caught my attention. What I like the most is that it's super easy to level up on your own, and you don't really have to rely on others. I've played other MMOs, where I simply couldn't progress on my own cause well, the character I made just wasn't fast/strong enough to gain the exp. Clerics suck, just saying but, I also can't play non-clerics/squishy characters. I also like how, you don't have to work as hard to level up to get those cooler looking skills, or in other words, you get to get those cool skills at the get go. Cause that's a major selling point for me, I'm all about the graphics and how flashy and cool you get to make your character. The edioleons are super cool, wish there was more of a way to pick which ones you get, or at least raise the chances of getting the one you want. If there is, well... I guess I haven't looked into it enough. But I'm also not the type to like grind for hours in the same dungeon to get something super rare however what I noticed from dungeoning it probably won't take too much time to get that shiny armour you want. Anyone willing to do that, super props to you. I never know how you do it. Other cool features are the gliding, the duel class option at level 40, dungeons and auto-loot pick up are super useful and that there is a pretty extensive fishing option. Armour and Weapon fortification is pretty simple too, making anyone able to upgrade their stuff; takes a lot of resources, but it's still fun and you're not likely going to loose your stuff if it fails. All of these I find super awesome cause these are stuff I wish was found in other games. TL;DR for pros: super easy to play on your own, has everything you can want in a game that you probably wouldn't have thought of. I barely scratched the surface of this game, and I bet it's even better when you dig deeper. Now what I don't like, and I don't know if this is just me, but I have played this game with a friend, and even though we were both playing the game, it didn't really feel like we played together. We were both just running about on our own, and talking in between when we were stuck. I'm super social when it comes to mmo games, but the fact that there isn't the shared loot pickup for quests, or that exp isn't shared between us, it really feels like a solo game. The best you can do is just stand around and kill stuff while waiting for your friend. And a lot of the quests are specifically solo anyways. What also bothered me is the mouse controls. You get used to them as you play (not really) but the two camera functions can really hinder you in a bind. Like one camera simply rotates around your character, and the other one actually makes your character turn with it. So like I know during boss fights, I turn my camera a lot to look at different angles, but I don't nessecarily need my character to be turnt around too cause some skills require them to be facing a monster. So with that, sometimes I would need to run away to get out of a red zone, and I find myself using the wrong camera move, and I just have my character running backwards super slowly, and usually on the verge of death now. (I'm not the type to click-to-move) And some mobs jump around a lot so you need that camera moving.And another is the skill keys hot-bar. There are waaaay too many skills to fit on one hot bar and it's inconvient how they only go up to 8. I used to it going up to the "=" key. Plus with the eidoleon skills, mounts, glide features and other stuff I can't remember, you are't left with a lot of space, especially when the second class comes into play. So you're left with like maybe 4 of your favourite skills from each class.TL;DR for the cons:It doesn't feel as social of a game going by my standards. There isn't that sense of playing with friends, but just having them on the side (but thats not too bad). The mouse controls are super annoying and the hot-bars don't have enough space and can get pretty cluttered.Overall:I would totally recommend. There's a lot I complained about, but really they don't affect gameplay that much. If you know what you're doing it's pretty meaningless. 10/10
