content:
Posted: April 20, 2015
												This game is nice, fun, and has a good community. Though when you reach level 29, you are given a level 30 quest for the main story. It's common to recieve quests where the level is one above your own. However, the quest "Enter the Alabastren Temple ruins" is mostly unfair. As you are required to enter a dungeon alone (it specifically tells you to do it by yourself) and the dungeon, with friends at the same level as you when you recieve the quest, is still very difficult as all the enemies have high hp, defense, and do lots of damage. And you are forced to fight 4-5 enemies at a time, which is unbelievable difficult. As a guardian class, I have the most defense, and use all the defensive skills and still die while killing one. And any enemy you damage, when you die, they are fully healed while you have to respawn at the dungeon entrance, or wait 1 minute to revive there with minimal hp. Further more, grinding levels in the game is extremely difficult as you get very small amounts of xp from enemies and side quests also give small amounts of xp. I don't reccomend this game to you, unless you don't mind wasting hours doing this one quest required to advance the story which is unnecessarily annoying and extremely difficult.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 29, 2015
												Aura Kingdom, Colourful, bright and fun graphics. This game feels and looks like an MMO but... you only need players to complete dungeons with you, the rest of the time you farm and farm and farm for more XP to level up. Once reached the required level you can start with dungeon, either play solo mode, party mode which is up to 3 players or Hellmode that requires at least 5 players. Dungeon crawling is really fun to play with a friend or random people but people will not join your party to start the dungeon with you, so that means going back to farm XP again. The game drags on with pointless quests and farming, farming can be very boring because there's no competition, you can farm solo and wont even need a party memeber. I recommend this game for the fun gameplay, cool character creation and the ability to fly.

content:
Posted: May 23, 2016
Product received for free
												Looking for a game close enought ot SAO?Well you've come to the right place, cause Aura Kingdom is only one of those anime themed MMORPGs that is as close to SAO...Grindy, but worth it. Lots of players (Especially on channel 1 of your chosen server) and a very active community. Weapons are very stylish, but the costume is hard to come by without advancing to get at least a decent Forest Ambassador outfit. There is a currency called Loyalty Points (Accumulated by doing certain daily quests, returning monster bounties, or in valuable chests) and if you continuously do these quests, getting a costume without abiding to microtransaction's tempting offers for the best looking costumes, can be pretty satisfying, include the mounts too which are kinda affordable. Eidolons, the pets which is already registered in your account and can be used by multiple characters depending if they are active on the other character, is very convenient as you won't be grinding hard again if you decide to create a 2nd character, but instead the keys 9which are used to summon them) can be saved to do an evolution for your eidolon. And lastly, I would like to commend the very interesting and versatile sub skill system. In lvl 40, you will be given a quest where you can pick your sub, but worry not, as your sub can be replaced for free!Overall, I would recommend this to anyone who likes MMORPGs with anime theme and an active community and fun to play dungeons.

content:
Posted: August 12, 2016
												Looking for endless kill quest where you kill innocent camels, racoons, and other adorable creatures? WELL! You've come to the right place. This is an MMO that pretty much kills time. I go on it once and a while, when im bored, and none of my friends are on. You start off in a dream with the best gear in the game, then wake up and do the most IMPORTANT QUEST OF ALL TIME! Deliver jelly for a woman (... thats not a quest that like more of an errand...). Then you deliver a lunch, and get a job. Yep you literally go and get a job. You dont fall in a cave, find an enchanted blade, and go on a magical adventure. You pass out on the job, and when you wake theres an orb floating around your head. That turns out to be an Eidelon. A creature that really can't be killed and if you pick the healing one, it prevents you from dying. Ever. As the story progresses it gets better. Pirates, Robo gangs, uhhh... I dont remember much after that. OHH and you meet the person from your dream. Either way, this game isn't perfect, not by any means. I'd rate like a 5-6/10. But as a time passer? 10/10. Hours go by really quick.Final Rating: 6/10Game Itself: 5/10Story: 3/10Time Passer: 10/10Asthetics: 7/10Other important things....The weapons look cool, and they added a new class. You get vanity armor, but regular armor doesn't affect the way you look.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												Aura Kingdom, The Sweet Kick A_s and Adorable MMORPG !With over 200hr on playing is a bit late to write the review on thin game but still, I have something to say.This game is really well done in many case. The Graphic is Good, better than many game out there. Design in Anime style is so advantage to attract many players. Music is Nice. Storyline is pretty interesting and Finally, Battle is Outstanding. From skill to skill, you can serve your enemy with the Cool-Connecting Combo up on your style. Stack up DPS or Screw the enemy with 1st and 2nd Combination Ultimate Skill.Class Balance is Great. No MP or SP to worry because the cool down time is the only thing you must consider, to manage your fighting rhythm....The Best Combo System I ever play.Choose the Player Class and build up your own character, gender and face and Side Kick Eidolon. and Play out the DEJAVU opening style mission, Pretty interesting opening intro stage. So you can try out many class in the very first stage and change it if you want to try other play style.But if you climb up to Over 50Lv, things will go more harder in many way. That's mean if you put your effort fight all the way til Lv50, the real battle just begin from this place. (Some player quit, Some player continue)One of The Best F2P. You can use (Real) money to buy stuff if you want but basically, you can get almost of them by your effort....kinda hard but still has a chance.The Only annoying thing is BOT.....Just leave them alone or turn off the [other player invisible] button. (Or steal their kill count is the fast way to end the quest too)One Best thing and the last is [PANTIEs] ! Many type of girl and many kind of Pantie they put on (YES, SO ANIME). Go Sneaking them is one of the Entertaining thing (No Joke)

You can use (Real) money to buy stuff if you want but basically, you can get almost of them by your effort....kinda hard but still has a chance.The Only annoying thing is BOT.....Just leave them alone or turn off the [other player invisible] button. (Or steal their kill count is the fast way to end the quest too)One Best thing and the last is [PANTIEs] ! Many type of girl and many kind of Pantie they put on (YES, SO ANIME). Go Sneaking them is one of the Entertaining thing (No Joke)

content:
Posted: October 8, 2015
												Do NOT spend money on this game. If you wish to get all the "cool looking" mounts, clothing, weapons, summons. Don't even waste your time spending money on this game, First of all the instant you buy their points they lock you out of even being able to purchase items. You have to go through a long painful proccess of sending them information through a ticket, which in set they take forever to reply to. Only for them to finally unlock that ascpect of your game so you can purchase things. Now, moving onto the problem. I was in the mindset of wasting my money getting the cool things I wanted in the game to make my character more personally appealing. I found that to be a utter joke with this company, not only did I waste money, but I found out they are scumbags. You go to buy the item, thinking you are going to get what you purchased and no wrong. Instead you click on the icon you obtained for the item and it becomes a treasure luck box pretty much in a sense. In this case you MAY obtain the item you were hoping for, instead I constantly got health pots. I think this is a utter joke, a rip off and a scam. Do NOT label your items as if you were to directly obtain said item, instead make it labeled a luck box and CLEARLY show that you can not be able to obtain the item. Instead of doing it after you buy the item and waste money.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 2, 2016
												I played a bit of Aura Kingdom during my WoW downtime. Thought I'd give a brief review of my experience.Played I would say for the last two weeks very casually. The game has an auto pathing system that take a lot of the running around(exploring) out of the game. I actually liked the system because it let's you pickup and play easily without having to really invest. It also got me to actually pay attention to the story not that is was mind blowing. The art is the games strongest point. It sort of reminds of the "Tales of" series. The costumes are also suuppperrr on point. Very cute, or very cool mounts, and Edilons(your fighting companion pets). The world isnt too bad and some of creature you fight are cool looking as well.The class system I didn't get to fully explore. I rolled a Bard which is the games only pure healing class. It can still easily solo from what I saw and I had a few duels with other players winning with superior healing. At level 40 they let you choose from any of sub classes, three of which offer additonal spells with the right off hand weapon equipped. The system allows for some super creative ways to play but ultimately some are clearly better than others as MMORPG's go.The community however is dead. Like there are people EVERYWHERE, but we can't talk. My entire time I spoke to no other players. You have to purchase an item from the store just to talk in /world chat and it has only so many uses. You may end up paying for an item just to have your message spammed out of sight. I was invited to a guild, no one was ever on. I never found a group for running dungeons either...The cash shop wasn't too bad. I purchaes 2500 Aeria Points for about 32$ CAN and got a very cool costume for my character, and some large 20 slot bags. They also give you a bunch of items with EXP and Drop rate buffs, and a free mount. Later on I found out that I get even more free stuff which was x3 more 20 slot bags, and two more Edilon pets one of which is worth 50.00$ in the cash shop.I found this game to be actually quite enjoyable. If I wasn't looking forward more so to WoW Legion I might consider giving it more time. I've never been a fan of "Pay to Win" but I am a fan of seeing how far you can take a free to play character. Even so the cash shop has some fair deals and most of the items in there are cosmetic in nature from what I saw. Do you like MMORPG's? Do you like Anime? Then you might like Aura Kingdom

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 13, 2014
												Oh boy, where should i start?This AMMOJRPG is fun and quite enjoyable game out of other AMMO imo so i'll put my positive and negatives and this is my review and my opinion but feel free to critcize me about what i put.just note that EG means end game so keep that in mindPros:- The story is interesting- Several classes and a sub class at lvl 40- Music is good- Graphics is nice for the anime style for this game- Flashy skill animations- Tons of costumes to make your character fancy and kawaii- A huge and highly active community that has veterans and new players- Cool looking Eidolons- Daily events that players can join in- The world is amazing and detailed.- Easy to get into but the controls can be tricky but you will get used to it eventuallyCons:- The game reuses the same models for almost every npc and enemies and they just reskin them same with dungeons- Some of the EG players can be extremely annoying and obnoxious for new players - Farm bots which is very common in mmo's but the bots tend to lag the servers.- PVP can be unfair when it comes down to upgraded gears most of the time- Simple character creation(imo i like more complex character creation system)- Barely enough gold to spend on stuff if you don't pay money(espicially End Game) due to inflation- Some area's can cause frame rate drops and having a lot of players in a single area doing certain skills will also cause frame drops and may lead to the game crashingIn all honesty, the game can be fun for some people or it can be boring. The thing i hate the most is that almost every enemy has some sort of stun and almost every class has a stun or something similar of that type.  Even though i put the music in the pros, it can get annoying to listen to the same music over and over again so it's better if you just put up you own music after listening to the bgms a few times. About what i mentioned earlier about some items can't be obtain easily with the in-game cash you earn through missions and dungeons. I'm talking about costumes, fortification scrolls and refining materials if you're in a rush to get the strongest weapons. You have to do dungeons everytime when you have the entry points to go. The game also has a lot of pop culture references in the game so take note of that :

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 16, 2014
												I've been playing a lot more than it says I have on Steam, but I recently downloaded it again from Steam because I'm weird like that and I like all my games to be in Steam if possible.Anyways, this is a real gem in an ocean of crap F2P games.  Good:--------------------------Awesome story that makes sense and is easy to followBeautiful world, amazing attention to detail and a real joy to just look aroundThe things you can buy from the store can also be earned (usually in several different ways) from in-game things as well or you can easily and *safely* earn free Aeria Points by installing and playing apps on your phone or watching a minute long video.Translation is spot on.  I haven't seen any issues and usually with games like this half the quest text makes 0 sense.As you progress you have several ways of changing and making yourself better.  From talent trees to mastering skills to adding gems, enchants and fortifying armor and weapons.Great sense of humor.A lot of classes to choose from which are not sex locked.Lots of different looks without even mentioning costumes and dyes and all of that, I'm just talking about character creation.Every day you log back in you are greeted with a free present and your Eidolon as well.Eidolons.  These are exceptionally well done "battle pets" (bascially) with stories and personalities all of their own.  They don't just level, you help them to level and to better themselves as you progress as well.  Not only are there several to choose from or earn but they all have their own way of speaking, seeing the world and battling.  Some are healers, others plain warriors and so on.  They can be evolved at certain levels with the right items, given items to up their stats permanently, you have conversations with them on a regular basis and they give you great gifts which can help both of you a lot in the long run.  This is by far, one of the most impressive battle pets systems I have ever seen in any game, and it's free to play!  Auto-route.  I have no idea why, some people see this as a bad thing but I don't understand that at all.  You can open the map up, find a specific NPC and just run to them without having to worry.  I don't see a problem with this and with all of the other types of games I have played, I just see it as it's own game mechanic.  You don't have an "auto kill everything" feature so it isn't game breaking in the least.  If you don't like it, just don't use it.  I see this as only a plus and will not name this as a con for any reason.The way they did quests is not only pretty clever, it's also very fun.  When you approach an NPC and click on them to start a quest a small box will take over your screen.  You can then watch the interaction between your character and the NPC as they engage in quest conversation.  It's really cute, allows you to cut off the rest of the MMO world for a moment to get into what you are doing and also lets you see the amount of emotions displayed in a really fun way.  I really like it.I've played four different classes, all of which had spells and attacks that were very different from one another.  Battle Bow looks nothing like another class, which some of these F2P MMOs do and it is very boring.  The attacks and spells in this game are vibrant, fun, fast-paced and well thought out.  You cannot just mash buttons either, which I really appreciate.  You have a global cooldown on all abilities.  Speaking of abilities, you can do a combo with your Eidolon.  It is unique to each one and does a ton of damage.  Even the healer types have one they can do with you.  Very fun, awesome to watch.Auto-potions.  I love this feature as well and will not say this is a con either, for any reason.  You don't like it don't use it.  I don't care, I think this is awesome.  What this does is allow you to place whatever type of potions you have in your bags in the Auto-potion slot.  You can then click it "On" and choose a percentage of health in which to have it switch to.  I have mine at 30% and it has seriously helped.  This allows you to focus on the action (you'd just be clicking it anyways, don't waste the global cooldown) while staying somewhat safe.  This does not gaurantee that you will stay alive.  This is not a 100% proof plan against death.  You can still die.  Don't kid yourself.  Some of the daily instances are just mean.  But this feature is just really awesome and I've never seen it before in any MMO.  That I remember.Lots and lots to do.  You have cooking done in a unique fashion, bring items you find randomly around the world to special cooks in the towns and they can help you fuse up something amazing.  Sometimes it's green, sometimes it's orange and you will get an achievement and exp for doing so.  Sometimes it's purple and helps specifically with PvP!  There are thousands of hidden quests and achievements in every area of the game.  From finding green question marked items and finishing the tasks lined up with them, to gathering loyalty points that you can also use in the item mall for lots of really cool items without spending a single penny.  Or chase down the 4-6 unique monsters in each area and turn in their pots to the city/village jailer for extra goodies and more achievements/titles.  Everything on the UI can be moved anywhere you want it.  The UI itself is great looking and you can even shrink or enlarge all of the elements.Lots of different ways of doing quests.  I have noticed some people saying it's the same as many other MMOs and there is a lot of grinding.  I don't think this is true at all.  Yes, you kill enemies and you collect items but there is a LOT more than just that going on.  Sometimes you are dodging the eyes of the bad guys trying to get through a dungeon or winning over the baddy in order to help you later on.  Planting bombs, fishing, sneaking through very dangerous areas.  There's more than just the normal amount of "kill this" and "collect that".  Plus, it actually makes 100% sense as to WHY you are doing it.  it isn't just "my farm is in danger kill 5000 beetles".  You are killing those things and collecting those items in order to help finish a much bigger picture which I think is really cool.  The kill quests and collection items aren't over done either.  At most I have been asked to kill 10 things at one time.  Not a big deal to me at all.Auto join a guild, get benefits and never be bothered.  Or bother them and start a conversation.  It's literally up to you.  I love this feature, I wish every game had something like this.  ----------------------Bad:Not a lot of character slots available, only three without paying.Bots.  They aren't a huge deal and literally only sit in one place of each zone that I have noticed, but it's really annoying.  They are always the guys with the big cannon looking things, I can't remember the name of the class.  They all look the exactg same and have ridiculous names.  Just annoying.Sometimes it is a little too easy.  You feel like you are just sweeping through everything.  This could be a good thing to some, I don't see it that way though so am only naming it as a con.  I would like there to be much more challenge.  The daily instances offer something more, but only rarely and for the most part they aren't too hard either.Bag space.  They will give you bags and stuff from time to time and all but really there isn't much at all.  Especially your bank.  It is TINY and I really hate that.  You have a shared bank which is awesome but it is just too small.Cooking things requires far too much money.  I don't spend my money on much else really.  I get items from dungeons and such and don't want to spend it on AH crap or personal sellers.  But fusing together some cooked chicken costs much too much.  You share Eidolons with your account.  This can be good and bad.

content:
Posted: October 15, 2014
												Immersive world with decent storyline and a lot of exciting game play features that are a part of the narrative. Gets repetitive after about level 60 but there's plenty of hours of enjoyment before the traditional 'grinding for xp' starts.Level 60 opens up new dungeons, so things are still exciting at that stage, however the experience gains slow down as quests drop off which results in repetitive gameplay after that in order to advance your character.Many classes to choose from, with second class abilities available after level 40. All around, an interesting game to have a go at.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 17, 2014
												A beautiful game! Instead of putting a whole paragraph on how I love it, I'll just put some points down on what I really liked about it. I will also put some kind of not-so-great things here as well, so you can see if this is the game for you!Pros:1. The scenery itself is very beautiful! Each town and area has their own little thing and you can explore all of the beautiful sights!2. The enemies are very adorable! Now this isn't much of a pro to the game since enemy style doesn't really tell how good a game is, but I thought to put it out there. I feel bad killing a lot of the enemies because of how cute they are.3. There are 3 servers in a game. Each server is seperate so you can make 3 characters per server. In total, you can have 9 characters. I am a person that likes to try a lot of different classes, so this is great for me! If you're like that too, you'll love this! I know from my experience of different MMORPGs that a lot of games don't really allow this kind of thing. The only one I can remember was Fiesta online did this. I know there are a couple more out there that I don't remember. But this one does that kind of thing, so I think it's great!4.  The character design for your character and the NPCs are so adorable! I really like the character customization on this game. While there isn't too much to the customization, it's enough to make nice characters, in my opionion! I wasn't expecting something like this to have PS2 Online super ultra customization, but I was surprised to how much there was in it. So overall, its a great player maker!5. There are so many quests! Many of them are not fighting-based either, so you won't always be running around doing the same thing over and over again. You set up traps, deliver things, make things, etc. Of course, though, there will always be more fighting than, lets say, delivery quests. But, the small difference in routine gives it a little more fun! It even has a stroy questline to it as well!6. You get an ostrich. That's right. You get to ride an ostrich. This also doesn't make a game 100% better, but I think it's pretty cool that your free mount is an ostrich. 7. Another thing I like about this game is it has such a friendly environment! Many times have I made a character and at a low-level, higher ups have me join their guild or party to help me out thinking I'm extremely new. I have not once gotten into an argument with anyone. The community is great in my opinion. I'm not sure if others would agree with me because everyone has their own experiences with other people in MMORPGs, but my experience has been good so far. I'm hoping it is like this for everyone!8. You can get something called "loyalty points" through out the game that you can use to "buy" costumes! Loyalty points are free, but a little difficult to get a lot. But if you're determined and do a lot of easedropping on NPCs, you'll rack up those loyalty points and get that cool costume you wanted! They also have another point system that you actually have to pay money to get, but I think that it's great that the game developers let the people who don't pay money on games have a chance to get something cool!---Cons:1. This game does get kind of repetitive. Even though they have different quests thats not all fighting, they are usually "get __ amount of __" kind of quests. My higher up is aroung level 36 if I remember, and it's getting a little boring aroung there. However I do sometimes continue to log on and play. They do have "fame quests" and "daily quests" that they put up if you don't feel like doing the same old quests. (<---maybe should have put that in pros?)2. It is a point-and-click stlyled fighting game. You do have hot keys for your abilities, but for the most part, it's a point-and-click. If you're not a fan of that style of fighting in an MMORPG, then you'll probably get bored very fast.3. Laggy a bit. This might just be for me and my dumb computer. But if you have just a general computer or laptop, you may experience some lag (not too much of it unless you're in a crowded area, but thats normal for every crowded MMORPG). The cutscenes don't work for me because of it. It may be different for you though! So don't stress over this point too much. 4. Some quests require you have a party of 3. If you are a solo player like me, that may serve a problem in trying to find and work the courage to work with people. There is a party finder so you can form parties for just the dungeon. However, for me, I like doing things alone and forming parties is awkward because then I have to figure out if I should leave the party or if they still want to work together, etc. So if you're a solo player, some of these moments might not be for you. 5. Very easy. This could be a pro as well if you like things easy. Bosses are not that hard, enemies are farley easy. (I've killed an enemy about 3 or 4 levels above me with not a problem). So if you like easy MMORPGs, this is for you. But if you like a challange, this may not be it. ---Overall, in my opinion, I really like this game and I think, despite the cons, I will continue to play this game. It's very beautiful and the scenery and characters are very well made. Even though quests become a routine, they have daily quests and fame quests that break the routine a little bit. If there was a 10 rating, i think it would go about 8.5/10. I would reccomend people to give this a try and see if it is their cup of tea.

Battle Bow looks nothing like another class, which some of these F2P MMOs do and it is very boring.  The attacks and spells in this game are vibrant, fun, fast-paced and well thought out.  You cannot just mash buttons either, which I really appreciate.  You have a global cooldown on all abilities.  Speaking of abilities, you can do a combo with your Eidolon.  It is unique to each one and does a ton of damage.  Even the healer types have one they can do with you.  Very fun, awesome to watch.Auto-potions.  I love this feature as well and will not say this is a con either, for any reason.  You don't like it don't use it.  I don't care, I think this is awesome.  What this does is allow you to place whatever type of potions you have in your bags in the Auto-potion slot.  You can then click it "On" and choose a percentage of health in which to have it switch to.  I have mine at 30% and it has seriously helped.  This allows you to focus on the action (you'd just be clicking it anyways, don't waste the global cooldown) while staying somewhat safe.  This does not gaurantee that you will stay alive.  This is not a 100% proof plan against death.  You can still die.  Don't kid yourself.  Some of the daily instances are just mean.  But this feature is just really awesome and I've never seen it before in any MMO.  That I remember.Lots and lots to do.  You have cooking done in a unique fashion, bring items you find randomly around the world to special cooks in the towns and they can help you fuse up something amazing.  Sometimes it's green, sometimes it's orange and you will get an achievement and exp for doing so.  Sometimes it's purple and helps specifically with PvP!  There are thousands of hidden quests and achievements in every area of the game.  From finding green question marked items and finishing the tasks lined up with them, to gathering loyalty points that you can also use in the item mall for lots of really cool items without spending a single penny.  Or chase down the 4-6 unique monsters in each area and turn in their pots to the city/village jailer for extra goodies and more achievements/titles.  Everything on the UI can be moved anywhere you want it.  The UI itself is great looking and you can even shrink or enlarge all of the elements.Lots of different ways of doing quests.  I have noticed some people saying it's the same as many other MMOs and there is a lot of grinding.  I don't think this is true at all.  Yes, you kill enemies and you collect items but there is a LOT more than just that going on.  Sometimes you are dodging the eyes of the bad guys trying to get through a dungeon or winning over the baddy in order to help you later on.  Planting bombs, fishing, sneaking through very dangerous areas.  There's more than just the normal amount of "kill this" and "collect that".  Plus, it actually makes 100% sense as to WHY you are doing it.  it isn't just "my farm is in danger kill 5000 beetles".  You are killing those things and collecting those items in order to help finish a much bigger picture which I think is really cool.  The kill quests and collection items aren't over done either.  At most I have been asked to kill 10 things at one time.  Not a big deal to me at all.Auto join a guild, get benefits and never be bothered.  Or bother them and start a conversation.  It's literally up to you.  I love this feature, I wish every game had something like this.  ----------------------Bad:Not a lot of character slots available, only three without paying.Bots.  They aren't a huge deal and literally only sit in one place of each zone that I have noticed, but it's really annoying.  They are always the guys with the big cannon looking things, I can't remember the name of the class.  They all look the exactg same and have ridiculous names.  Just annoying.Sometimes it is a little too easy.  You feel like you are just sweeping through everything.  This could be a good thing to some, I don't see it that way though so am only naming it as a con.  I would like there to be much more challenge.  The daily instances offer something more, but only rarely and for the most part they aren't too hard either.Bag space.  They will give you bags and stuff from time to time and all but really there isn't much at all.  Especially your bank.  It is TINY and I really hate that.  You have a shared bank which is awesome but it is just too small.Cooking things requires far too much money.  I don't spend my money on much else really.  I get items from dungeons and such and don't want to spend it on AH crap or personal sellers.  But fusing together some cooked chicken costs much too much.  You share Eidolons with your account.  This can be good and bad.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 17, 2014
												A beautiful game! Instead of putting a whole paragraph on how I love it, I'll just put some points down on what I really liked about it. I will also put some kind of not-so-great things here as well, so you can see if this is the game for you!Pros:1. The scenery itself is very beautiful! Each town and area has their own little thing and you can explore all of the beautiful sights!2. The enemies are very adorable! Now this isn't much of a pro to the game since enemy style doesn't really tell how good a game is, but I thought to put it out there. I feel bad killing a lot of the enemies because of how cute they are.3. There are 3 servers in a game. Each server is seperate so you can make 3 characters per server. In total, you can have 9 characters. I am a person that likes to try a lot of different classes, so this is great for me! If you're like that too, you'll love this! I know from my experience of different MMORPGs that a lot of games don't really allow this kind of thing. The only one I can remember was Fiesta online did this. I know there are a couple more out there that I don't remember. But this one does that kind of thing, so I think it's great!4.  The character design for your character and the NPCs are so adorable! I really like the character customization on this game. While there isn't too much to the customization, it's enough to make nice characters, in my opionion! I wasn't expecting something like this to have PS2 Online super ultra customization, but I was surprised to how much there was in it. So overall, its a great player maker!5. There are so many quests! Many of them are not fighting-based either, so you won't always be running around doing the same thing over and over again. You set up traps, deliver things, make things, etc. Of course, though, there will always be more fighting than, lets say, delivery quests. But, the small difference in routine gives it a little more fun! It even has a stroy questline to it as well!6. You get an ostrich. That's right. You get to ride an ostrich. This also doesn't make a game 100% better, but I think it's pretty cool that your free mount is an ostrich. 7. Another thing I like about this game is it has such a friendly environment! Many times have I made a character and at a low-level, higher ups have me join their guild or party to help me out thinking I'm extremely new. I have not once gotten into an argument with anyone. The community is great in my opinion. I'm not sure if others would agree with me because everyone has their own experiences with other people in MMORPGs, but my experience has been good so far. I'm hoping it is like this for everyone!8. You can get something called "loyalty points" through out the game that you can use to "buy" costumes! Loyalty points are free, but a little difficult to get a lot. But if you're determined and do a lot of easedropping on NPCs, you'll rack up those loyalty points and get that cool costume you wanted! They also have another point system that you actually have to pay money to get, but I think that it's great that the game developers let the people who don't pay money on games have a chance to get something cool!---Cons:1. This game does get kind of repetitive. Even though they have different quests thats not all fighting, they are usually "get __ amount of __" kind of quests. My higher up is aroung level 36 if I remember, and it's getting a little boring aroung there. However I do sometimes continue to log on and play. They do have "fame quests" and "daily quests" that they put up if you don't feel like doing the same old quests. (<---maybe should have put that in pros?)2. It is a point-and-click stlyled fighting game. You do have hot keys for your abilities, but for the most part, it's a point-and-click. If you're not a fan of that style of fighting in an MMORPG, then you'll probably get bored very fast.3. Laggy a bit. This might just be for me and my dumb computer. But if you have just a general computer or laptop, you may experience some lag (not too much of it unless you're in a crowded area, but thats normal for every crowded MMORPG). The cutscenes don't work for me because of it. It may be different for you though! So don't stress over this point too much. 4. Some quests require you have a party of 3. If you are a solo player like me, that may serve a problem in trying to find and work the courage to work with people. There is a party finder so you can form parties for just the dungeon. However, for me, I like doing things alone and forming parties is awkward because then I have to figure out if I should leave the party or if they still want to work together, etc. So if you're a solo player, some of these moments might not be for you. 5. Very easy. This could be a pro as well if you like things easy. Bosses are not that hard, enemies are farley easy. (I've killed an enemy about 3 or 4 levels above me with not a problem). So if you like easy MMORPGs, this is for you. But if you like a challange, this may not be it. ---Overall, in my opinion, I really like this game and I think, despite the cons, I will continue to play this game. It's very beautiful and the scenery and characters are very well made. Even though quests become a routine, they have daily quests and fame quests that break the routine a little bit. If there was a 10 rating, i think it would go about 8.5/10. I would reccomend people to give this a try and see if it is their cup of tea.

content:
Posted: January 6, 2015
												In my experience this game is actually pretty good. The characters are cute, the combat system is straight forward, and the quests and auto-routing makes this game, basically play itself. Now I'm not new to mmos, and I have played countless types of various styles and this one really caught my attention. What I like the most is that it's super easy to level up on your own, and you don't really have to rely on others. I've played other MMOs, where I simply couldn't progress on my own cause well, the character I made just wasn't fast/strong enough to gain the exp. Clerics suck, just saying but, I also can't play non-clerics/squishy characters. I also like how, you don't have to work as hard to level up to get those cooler looking skills, or in other words, you get to get those cool skills at the get go. Cause that's a major selling point for me, I'm all about the graphics and how flashy and cool you get to make your character. The edioleons are super cool, wish there was more of a way to pick which ones you get, or at least raise the chances of getting the one you want. If there is, well... I guess I haven't looked into it enough. But I'm also not the type to like grind for hours in the same dungeon to get something super rare however what I noticed from dungeoning it probably won't take too much time to get that shiny armour you want. Anyone willing to do that, super props to you. I never know how you do it. Other cool features are the gliding, the duel class option at level 40, dungeons and auto-loot pick up are super useful and that there is a pretty extensive fishing option. Armour and Weapon fortification is pretty simple too, making anyone able to upgrade their stuff; takes a lot of resources, but it's still fun and you're not likely going to loose your stuff if it fails. All of these I find super awesome cause these are stuff I wish was found in other games. TL;DR for pros: super easy to play on your own, has everything you can want in a game that you probably wouldn't have thought of. I barely scratched the surface of this game, and I bet it's even better when you dig deeper. Now what I don't like, and I don't know if this is just me, but I have played this game with a friend, and even though we were both playing the game, it didn't really feel like we played together. We were both just running about on our own, and talking in between when we were stuck. I'm super social when it comes to mmo games, but the fact that there isn't the shared loot pickup for quests, or that exp isn't shared between us, it really feels like a solo game. The best you can do is just stand around and kill stuff while waiting for your friend. And a lot of the quests are specifically solo anyways. What also bothered me is the mouse controls. You get used to them as you play (not really) but the two camera functions can really hinder you in a bind. Like one camera simply rotates around your character, and the other one actually makes your character turn with it. So like I know during boss fights, I turn my camera a lot to look at different angles, but I don't nessecarily need my character to be turnt around too cause some skills require them to be facing a monster. So with that, sometimes I would need to run away to get out of a red zone, and I find myself using the wrong camera move, and I just have my character running backwards super slowly, and usually on the verge of death now. (I'm not the type to click-to-move) And some mobs jump around a lot so you need that camera moving.And another is the skill keys hot-bar. There are waaaay too many skills to fit on one hot bar and it's inconvient how they only go up to 8. I used to it going up to the "=" key. Plus with the eidoleon skills, mounts, glide features and other stuff I can't remember, you are't left with a lot of space, especially when the second class comes into play. So you're left with like maybe 4 of your favourite skills from each class.TL;DR for the cons:It doesn't feel as social of a game going by my standards. There isn't that sense of playing with friends, but just having them on the side (but thats not too bad). The mouse controls are super annoying and the hot-bars don't have enough space and can get pretty cluttered.Overall:I would totally recommend. There's a lot I complained about, but really they don't affect gameplay that much. If you know what you're doing it's pretty meaningless. 10/10

content:
Posted: June 3, 2015
												At first, I really liked Aura Kingdom. It's bright, colorful, has very engaging combat, and is, just in general, fun.... but only for the first two levels (Or 'locations.') Later in the game, you start to wonder "What the hell am I doing and what does any of this have to do with the story?" This will happen A LOT.Here's an example from one of the earlier quests where such an instance first appears. You need to make medicen for your character because he/she passed out. Well, you need antilope blood. Okay, fine. But you need to kill six of the giant creatures for their blood. WHAT THE HELL? HOW MUCH BLOOD DOES THIS DOCTOR NEED FOR LITTLE OL' ME?! This is fine in those quests where the particular creature you're killing needs to be driven out of the area, but when you need to collect items from them? It's VERY monotonous. Another reason this sucks is that, when you're collecting items from creatures, there is a 20% chance that you will actually get the item you need. As a rough estimate, if you have to kill 4 fish to get scales, you'll probably have to kill 8 fish to get the four sets of scales. This becomes even worse when, in higher level areas, you have to kill 7 and 14 creatures to gather the specified number of itmes you need to complete a "Main Quest" that doesn't seem to have anything to do with the story. This makes playing the game the way your suppose to a chore. Another problem this game has is its dungeons. These are usually big cave-like areas where you fight large waves of monsters. Most Dungeons require the player to be in a party of three to actually activate it. This would be fine if players in this game were actually considerate. No one wants anything to do with you unless you wear expensive costumes and hats, or have the best mounts and weapons. It's like, if Team Fortress 2 met World of Warcraft in a very ill-considerate and rude way. This is most evident, unfortunatly, for players who speak english. My first language is english and my spanish is a little rusty (But little to no spanish speaking players play this game anyway) meaning I am stuck dealing with the ruder end of the player pool, which is the dominant end. The worst part is these dungeons are REQUIRED to finish the story. Which means you could be stuck for a LONG time on the same main quest, not because you cannot defeat the enemies because they, themselves, are quite easy, but because no one wants to join you. Making friends in this game is hard for the same reason, even if the player is a noob at the same time you are and has the first constume as well. This game is so pay to win it hurts.In all, Aura Kingdom is a game with lovely visuals, fun combat, a promising story, rude and selfish majority players, monotonus quests and pointless quests. Have fun.

content:
Posted: July 2, 2016
												I played a bit of Aura Kingdom during my WoW downtime. Thought I'd give a brief review of my experience.Played I would say for the last two weeks very casually. The game has an auto pathing system that take a lot of the running around(exploring) out of the game. I actually liked the system because it let's you pickup and play easily without having to really invest. It also got me to actually pay attention to the story not that is was mind blowing. The art is the games strongest point. It sort of reminds of the "Tales of" series. The costumes are also suuppperrr on point. Very cute, or very cool mounts, and Edilons(your fighting companion pets). The world isnt too bad and some of creature you fight are cool looking as well.The class system I didn't get to fully explore. I rolled a Bard which is the games only pure healing class. It can still easily solo from what I saw and I had a few duels with other players winning with superior healing. At level 40 they let you choose from any of sub classes, three of which offer additonal spells with the right off hand weapon equipped. The system allows for some super creative ways to play but ultimately some are clearly better than others as MMORPG's go.The community however is dead. Like there are people EVERYWHERE, but we can't talk. My entire time I spoke to no other players. You have to purchase an item from the store just to talk in /world chat and it has only so many uses. You may end up paying for an item just to have your message spammed out of sight. I was invited to a guild, no one was ever on. I never found a group for running dungeons either...The cash shop wasn't too bad. I purchaes 2500 Aeria Points for about 32$ CAN and got a very cool costume for my character, and some large 20 slot bags. They also give you a bunch of items with EXP and Drop rate buffs, and a free mount. Later on I found out that I get even more free stuff which was x3 more 20 slot bags, and two more Edilon pets one of which is worth 50.00$ in the cash shop.I found this game to be actually quite enjoyable. If I wasn't looking forward more so to WoW Legion I might consider giving it more time. I've never been a fan of "Pay to Win" but I am a fan of seeing how far you can take a free to play character. Even so the cash shop has some fair deals and most of the items in there are cosmetic in nature from what I saw. Do you like MMORPG's? Do you like Anime? Then you might like Aura Kingdom

												Played this up to about level 10 (which only took a couple hours at most) and hopped around to different characters trying them out, and the conclusion I've come to is .If you want a carebear game, where you can play the whole time without even touching the keyboard, this game is for you! It even takes you to quest destinations and npcs just by clicking on the quest tracker.  You get "flying" and a ground mount withing the first 3-5 levels.  I never got into crafting, so I can't say anything about that. As far as artwork goes, it's a very stylized anime type artwork, which looks pretty decent, and there weren't any real animation issues I noticed like other F2P games have.  Overall pretty smooth.  If you want a free game you can play with a friend/lover/neighbor's pet then this game is great for you.  I'm anticipating they add automated combat soon so they game will play itself for you while you watch.

Posted: December 31, 2014
												This is a very nice MMORPG, you have lots of skills and the option to get a second class further in the game makes it even more interesting. You also have companions which are called Eidolons that help you in your fightsThe kawaii anime design is great, the fishing system is actually fun, and ther is an interesting and not too hard crafting system. But the quests sometimes can be boring (slay monsters, get drops, talk to someone) and I don`t think the story is deep or anything, doesn`t look like that is the goal of the gameNevertheless I positively recommend this game, if you like the genre it`s really enjoyable and good source of fun, be you casual or hardcorePs: Note that I don`t play PvP so I have no opinion on the game being unbalanced or pay to win

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 14, 2015
												Ok, so after weeks of addiction, its about time I posted my thoughts on Aura Kingdom! :D The Game Ok so Aura Kingdom is an awesome Free 2 Play Fantasy/Anime MMO. Set in the semi-linear world of Azuria, you are an Envoy of Gaia, a human with special abilities and the power to summon powerful & mysterious partners called Eidolons to your aid, as you travel the world, defeating monsters, helping the towns, and defending against the ShadowKnights, a strange and powerful foe! Discover your Eidolons true potential by fighting alongside with them and leveling them up, into more powerful forms (somewhat like Pokemon :P ) and use their skills to aid you in battle with the upper-hand!12 awesome classes to choose from, including Ravager (High DMG), Scythe (Necromancer) & Grenadier (2-Handed Cannon Wielder), and blast, slice & shoot through the games many challenging dungeons and Main Quest line. Become a dual-class at Lvl40 with the ability to adopt a 2nd classes skills (for example a Tachi + Katar), and gain many more kickass skills and abilities!  Pro's - Very balanced classes (PvP can be won by any mix-up of classes)- Amazing soundtrack (very fitting for areas, a little repetitive, but fitting)- Great Group Events (including Battlefields, enhanced Dungeons, and special Party Quests)- Smooth Graphics (easy on the eyes, simple, but aestheticly pleasing)- Lots of backstory / lore (Simply read what people have to say, it will make sense)- Not Pay2Win (Can easily get to Max Lvl with High Quality gear, without spending a cent! (although you can get some cool looking apparel and mounts, etc for some cash if you wanna spend) Con's - Main Quests can be pretty repetitive (lots of Fetch Quests, Kill X Amount of Monsters, etc)- Hit Boxes is slightly Buggy (sometimes cannot target opponent until they hurt you first)- Sudden jump in EXP needed to Lvl after 45 (1-45 quick leveling, 45+ is grindy) OVERALL Overall, I love Aura Kingdom, its an amazing MMO that I would highly recommend trying, especially with friends (plus Bonus EXP in parties so Win-Win! XD) Give it a go, and if you don't enjoy it, no money was lost since F2P! :DOverall Score - 8.5/10

content:
Posted: October 14, 2016
												A fun anime mmorpg, but the cons outweigh the pros sadly. I played up to level 30ish with the Guardian class. Not entirely F2P, but most components can be played without irl money. 6/10Pros: - Cooking and Fishing minigames are a nice addition and feel refreshing imo- Always a fan of anime visuals for both monsters and people/NPCs- Environments are pretty- You can solo quests that require dungeon instances.- Tons of available quests throughout the world. Some include "sneaking" instances which was surprising to me.Cons:- Camera is clunky. Mouse cursor is not locked to game window.- Quests are too easy. You can click and your character will automatically run to quest givers, preventing exploration of levels.- Combat feels too easy. (or at least for Guardian class.) No mana or stamina encourages spamming buttons.- Certain quests require you to have irl cash on hand (cannot go F2P, but fortunately they are mainly side-quests)- Skill tree and mastery make little difference.- Eidolons pop-up too frequently, interrupting gameplay. (I haven't found a way to turn off eidolen notifications)- Cutscenes of just white text on a black background breaks immersion.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												Though I kinda agree with the few reviewers that AERIA indeed has quite slow and awful customer support. I would still recommend you to play this game. Although Aura Kingdom is kinda old and may not have the player base that it used to have. The game is still fun overall, it takes your mind off things should you play it. There are tons of things that you can do. From Archaeology all the way up to designing your House's interior ( which is a new implementation btw). And lets not forget about the fact, that Aura has a very friendly community. PS: I too came out from inactivity, their replies did indeed took quite a while, and even worse is that, if you try to reply them on email after they answered your ticket, your reply won't reach them. So, I recommend that you continue answering their questions through their website. And another thing, if you too, came out from the tempory ban due to inactivity and was required to answer a few questions. Some of your answers doesn't have to be that specific. I mean, no one actually remembers everything anyway. The few most important things that they actually need from you is the original email, a character name, and a server. And if you ever purchased AP, then a transaction #. And yes, I too did find it quite bothering that I would have to go through all of it. But if you really want to play it again, just be a little patient, it's not like you're gonna die from waiting anyway.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 11
												So far so good i currently have 71 hours, so not that much. There is quite a variety of events so you are basically never bored, the costumes, mounts wings etc, are very well desgined. Although i would like it if we get to dye our weapons and wings in the future. The community itself: for people that just started the game without knowing anyone else playing this game it will be hard to do dungeons, because most of the high level players dont join your party due to your level. But that does not mean that you dont have helpfull players, and that is also why joining a guild as soon as possible is highly recommended. BUt overall i would recommend this game if you are a fan of anime, or if you like MMORPS where you can look fancy.Pros; Lots of different costumes, mounts and etc. Variety of fun events. Although you can spend money for better looking costumes, it also gives the F2P a fair chance of getting items that p2p can get too. It also gives you the option to choose a subclass which is amazing, it gives your additional kit lots of extras.Cons: You will do alot of auto-pathing, The community is not always that friendly/helpfull for new players. (atleast that is my experience). Drop rates could be a bit higher in my opinion. BUt overall i really recommend this game 8.7/10

content:
Posted: July 25, 2015
												A cashgrab, plain and simple.  The only way to get gear is to spend real money, the only way to upgrade your gear is to spend real money.  Endgame content contains no drops other than cosmetic changes to your character.  Leveling requires your level 20/30/40/etc character to clear multiple zones all10-12+ levels below your character in order for you to "progress" in a story that has no place being in an MMORPG.  If you really want to play this garbage have someone else power level your character, do the Sky Tower raid once, then go back to WoW for $15/mo or go download TERA off Steam for free.  Both are far superior to this piece of trash.  I only wish I could go back and tell myself before installing this how much trash it was, so that I could get my playtime back and spend in on something more worthwhile... like watching paint dry or the grass grow.0/10Recommendation: DO NOT BUY and BURN IT WITH FIRE

content:
Posted: December 11, 2015
												I love this game, I think it's so fun. I'll admit, after you play 30+ hours the game can get a little repetitive (Go here, kill this amount of these), but that doesn't stop me from coming back and playing it more. I love the customization, and I think the anime style is very cute. I personally prefer PvE, so I don't know much about PvP in this game. But, I can tell you the PvE is very fun and will have you hooked. The quest line is good. There's always something for you to do, from any level. I have kept mostly to the main quest line, but I've done a side quest here and there (though personally I have found that you dont really need to do them, as your level should stay consistent with the difficulty). Overall I really like this game, and would give it a 9/10 (minus one star because of the repetition).

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 18, 2016
												Not gonna write too much, but I will say what I like and dislike about AK.PROS:-Graphics. One of the most beautiful MMOs I've ever played.-Gameplay. It's great that you don't need MP/Mana for attacks since they have cooldowns instead.-Classes. The classes are very diversed, in my opinion.-Eidolons. I love the eidolon system because it's definitely something new that has been brought to the table of MMOs.CONS:-Quests. Most of them are usually fetch or killing quests. But occasionally there are quests that let you take a new perspective on a situation.-A few translation errors. Very rare, but it does make it a little confusing to some players.-Grinding. Yes, it's gonna happen. No matter which MMO you're playing, it's gonna happen.-Like all games, glitches. It's not a rare sight to see a bug or glitch happening, despite how good a game is.That's all that I have to say. I might be nitpicking a little but that's just me. Overall, try AK out. It's definitely one of my favourite MMOs.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 18, 2016
												This was one of my first MMORPGs, aside from Mabinogi, which was unique and different from other MMOs. And, of course, my newest computer had a sucky graphics card which couldn't - and still can't - run Mabinogi properly. So, I decided to search around and I found this game.It's fun as hell.I've gotten to lvl 21 in the timespan of five hours. Very fun times.The quests are the usual 'Search for X and give it to Y' or 'Kill X amount of Y', but I honestly don't mind that. To me, those kinds of things don't bug me much. The storyline is the major portion of the game for me. And, from what I've seen so far, this storyline isn't half bad. The Eidolons are pretty kickass too.The classes are unique and cool in their different ways - you have no idea how much I struggled to find the proper one that I really wanted to use. They all have different strengths and weaknesses and they provide the players with different playing styles a chance to succeed as well.TL;DR - A pretty good MMORPG that I would recommend to my friends. Nothing too out of the ordinary, but still unique in it's own way.

content:
Posted: December 13, 2015
												This is a very simple, yet very complex game. I find it difficult to stop playing and want to keep playing to "just finish one more quest!" The only issue i have is that it was not 100% clear how to fight. I found out through trial and error that it was the right-click on the mouse to attack as well as do other things. Despite that it is a very addicting game and i'm having so much fun playing it!Edit 30/12/2015: Since writing this review i have now gotten to level 58 and i'm currently working toward unlocking the sky tower at level 60. I stand by my comment that it's a game that you want to just keep playing to just "finish one more quest". As for the issue i mentioned about the controls i have since realised that all controls can be found here: http://aurakingdom.aeriagames.com/game/controls along with tips and all sorts of other bits of help for the game which makes it easier to both complete quests and to know what you are doing. The graphics are really good, the costumes are cute, the game is comples with several different main locations (almost like floors in a dungeon really) as well as several dungeons to play in as well. There are quests you can do on your own and quests you can do with others. I quite like the sound of the guardian knight feature as well - though i have yet to actually try it. In my opinion i would sy this game was definitely worth a play, you never know you might learn to love it!

Posted: February 15, 2016
												Hello, in this review, you will find every little detail you need to know about this game.So basically, you create your own warrior, and you complete quests throughout the game. I personally love leveling up, but i wish i can make some friends :(Okay, so what you need to know :This game is, of course, an MMORPG. You create your player with a selection of 12 classes. After you selected your character features, you have to choose your eidolon. Eidolons are basically partners that stay with you on your journey ( Pokemon-ish lol ). You begin the game in a dimensional belt or something. You fight your way to the boss. Somehow you end up in a small town next to the ocean. You have to complete some tasks for the people. After this, you move on to the next area, then the next and so on. The max level is 80 I believe, and once you reach over 70, your level turns into ??. I've been playing for a long time, and honestly, I love this game so much. If you would like to meet me in-game go ahead, but ofc you would have to be my friend, or if you already are, well you get the point. Okay well I hope this helped. And yes, I recommend this game DONT ASK ME QUESTIONS STEAM MY GOSH.......Sorry steam was asking me if i recommend this game. Well bye bye!It's kind of hard to list pros and cons since this game never ends. But everything for this game on a scale from 1-10, I say this game rates a 7. I'm very addicted to it.. Lol

content:
Posted: September 30, 2015
												Ok lets be honest, a game like this is only as good as the community. Sadly the reviews on here talk alot about bots and the sad fact that people just keep to their guilds and such. It's all valid (Though i've had no problems with bots, i guess it's a end game majority problem), but where's the problem in that? Every game has bots, spammers and people playing multiple accounts. And people keeping to their guilds...? That's perfect, that's what makes for great guilds, the people being more social and having a better understanding of eachother.The game is cute, it's anime based and the pet system is awesome (Eidolon system). In all the game is great; a true gamer would understand that grind is life. Overall it's a good game that's been disliked by a small, viewed as majority for some reason, community of players that no longer play the game. They don't know if things have changed, they don't know if things are worse...Judge something with your own eyes, not based on the gossip of random strangers. Have a nice time playing and a nice life. Peace.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2015
												An Anime style MMO that I really wish I knew about sooner. I was surprised that when I gave this game a try (made a Scythe,) that it managed to pull me in very fast, with nothing but enjoyment. I haven't had an Anime style MMO do this to me in so long since Phantasy Star Online 2 when it was in Open Beta. I played Mabinogi for a solid two years, but I just lost any enjoyment I had with that game, because of how Pay to Win it was, along with how ignorant and elitist the Community is for all of Nexon's published Games.However, even though this game did pull me in, and I have enjoyed the almost 80 hours I have put into it, it definitely does have some flaws (All MMOs have flaws.)Pros:-Classes: I took a look at what each of the classes do before I decided to start my journey, and while they all performed pretty well in what I have seen from Youtube, I decided to go with the Scythe, because I love Ranged DPS (This will also be a Con,) and I love that the Pets you summon give you benefits depending on which 3 of the 6 demons are summoned.  It's definitely crazy how high your Crit and Speed gets along the way, especially around level 55.-Outfits: A lot of the outfits in this game are definitely what you would expect from an Anime-style MMO (Especially for Female characters, which I chose for my Scythe). I listed this as a Pro, because while you only get a certain amount of Costumes from doing the Main Storyline in each are, there are actually a lot of Outfits in this game that you can also get from other sources. There aren't that many Costumes on the Shop either, which is also a plus, because it isn't Pay to Dress up.-Fishing: Yes, Fishing. The bane of every one's existence in pretty much every MMO. The one skill that will leave you bored for hours. Believe it or not, but in Aura Kingdom, Fishing is actually VERY useful, and profitable. As you fish, you can come across Fish in your inventory that when opened, can give EXP, Items for your Eidilons to feed them, Fusion materials for Orange quality Fishing Gear, Weapon Chests, and for some very odd reason, Costumes. Yes. You can get Costumes from Fishing. Most of them are not worth selling, but if you get the Custom variants (Orange,) you're going to easily pocket 50+ Gold just by selling it on the Auction House. Fishing is very profitable because you can sell the Costumes you get (low chance to get them though,) and you can open the Weapon Chests to get Weapons that you can sell to Vendors for about 100 - 200 silver (especially when you get the Level 60 Weapon Chests in the 60 areas. It's actually one of your two main sources for making income at Level 60+, unless you run the end game dungeons and get lucky on drops.-Community: You don't know how incredibly hard it is for some one of my status to list the Community as a Pro for an MMO. I have been a part of the MMO Community since Everquest, and while every single one of them suffer from the typical cesspool players and elitists, Aura Kingdom so far has been very tame, and friendly. Other than the Dimensional Halls, I have not done any Party Dungeons at all while I was leveling, but every Dimensional Hall party I was in was just friendly in general.-Soundtrack: While the Soundtrack itself does get repetitive quick in-game, and some times reused in different areas (especially for the Daily Fame / Emergency Quests,) it definitely has some that you will probably like. Candeo Core's Soundtrack is so far my favorite.-Cash Shop: Other than Runescape's Cash Shop, and Phantasy Star Online 2's, this is one of the Cash Shops that contain VERY LITTLE Pay-to-win aspects to it. You can get Weapon / Armor Fortifications and Eidolons from the Cash Shop, but you will easily get Fortifications while questing, doing dungeons, or from doing the Dailies each and every day. The Eidolons on the other hand, is pretty much like Mabinogi's Gachapons. You have a chance to receive a certain Eidolon's Key in order to obtain them, or Fragments to combine a bunch later on into a Key. This isn't really Pay-to-Win because you can obtain Eidolons from doing the Eidolon Temple, Guild Hall, or Abyss / Otherworld dungeons when they reset.Cons:-Story: MMOs usually fall into one of two categories when it comes to Story. It either succeeds very well with it, and engages you, or you just want to hate it. Unfortunately, the Story in Aura Kingdom falls under this category. Other than the Tutorial area and Port Skandia, every Main Storyline in the rest of the areas is literally the same thing. This Town needs you to retrieve what was stolen. This town has a competition and needs you to help to get what you need. Alliances need to be formed. Yada yada. Pretty much when you are doing the quests in Aura Kingdom, you're better off just speeding through the Dialogue so you can get from one area to the next.-Generic Quests: You know those Kill / Collect quests you LOVE so much from other MMOs, especially World of Warcraft? That's literally around 95% of the questing you will do. If the Anime Style of this Game, the Soundtrack, or the classes don't keep you in the game, this most certainly won't.-Classes: "But wait, Entro. You already put Classes in the Pros. Why is it in the Cons?" The main reason why is it also listed as a Con, is because of the Dungeon aspect. I will be blunt when I say this: At level 60+, if you are ANY Melee Class that is not a Guardian, don't expect to find any Parties, unless you're running with a Guild. Bosses in the end-game dungeons are VERY unforgiving to those in Melee Range, and you will die incredibly fast unless you are a Guardian, which is the Tank Class of Aura Kingdom. -Telegraphed Attacks: Pretty much all you will notice from Dungeon Elites / Bosses in this game is that they have Telegraphed Attacks, and a lot of them at that. I like being able to go into a dungeon blind and expecting some thing difficult, and figuring out how to dodge after I learn a bosses' given moveset. What I don't like is when it colors the Ground to basically show you "Don't stand here or you will get hit." This kind of feature is what pushes me away from MMOs with it included, because it takes out most of the fun and learning of dungeons right out of the game. Granted, enemies and bosses can still melee, cast spells or ranged at you normally, along with debuffing, but for the most part, you'll mostly see Telegraphed Attacks.-Eidolons: While leveling, you will get a total of three Eidolons that will accompany you. You can have only one out at a time, which is fair considering how strong they are (mainly their Special which is on a 1 minute cooldown.) The problem though, is that unless you are extremely lucky and RNG plays in your favor, you won't get more than the three default Eidolons for a long time. When you do every thing I listed in the Pros, either killing the boss or fighting the Eidolon and succeeding gives you a chance (very low) that the Eidolon will acknowledge your skills and join your party. While that is a nice feature, your only focus is pretty much just to level up the stats and levels of one of your Eidolons, specifically Sigrun (the second Eidolon,) since she is tanky, and can keep most of the aggro on her, until you start hitting and critting like crazy.-Leveling and difficulty: If you tough out the quests and the dungeons, Leveling actually goes by very fast. It begins to slow down at 45, again at 55, and then 60 - 70 turns into every Korean MMOs' long grind. For me personally, it took me 40 hours of on and off play to level up to 60, which when you look at it, isn't actually a bad grind, but if you don't like how the quests are, it will draw you away quickly. I never died once while leveling either, which is a bummer because I was hoping for more difficulty.Final Verdict: 8/10. For me, I would still recommend it to my friends that like these kind of Anime-style MMOs.

content:
Posted: July 7, 2016
												Took me 15 minutes to get the options adjusted. especially that the sound started out muted, so had to exit game and restart, as the options are only accessable from the launcher?Once in game, there was only one race available (despite the cutscene shortly after intro quest showing other nonhuman races. Though there were many classes, there was no showcasing of their roles beyond a 3-star rating of things like attack, defense, single target, area damage, healing, & support. The intro is one that's been done before in a lot of games i've played were you get a few battles with your class at an absurd power level. SAdly in this game, it's just beefed up numbers, you don't get to play with advanced skills or anything, just the 2 starting abilities for the class i picked.Oh yeah, it's also packed with horridly obnoxious tutorial overlays that don't go away until you actually DO the thing they tell you to... and then they show up again to remind you to do that thing that way even after you've gotten rid of them once. and they flash too. This intro only BARELY covers game mechanics too.I'd rather play a game that throws you into it with no turorial, or a tutorial that's a full on hand-hold through ALL the game mechanics.The UI is horrendously clunky, and i didn't get the feelgin that character would stand out. Walking aroudn the starting town, i was presented with both quests and 'eavesdropping' spots. Where normalyl quests and their turnin places are yellow or gold or such, in this the actual quest indicators are silver, and the 'stand here and see NPCs talking" parts are gold.i know every MMO out there is all about the 'endgame content' though, and that means they all suffer from the start of the stories and game getting little to no attention.

The worst part about this game is the timing of events, like the tower that only opens at certain times, if you cant be online you will never be able to do them.
