number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 22, 2015
												An Anime style MMO that I really wish I knew about sooner. I was surprised that when I gave this game a try (made a Scythe,) that it managed to pull me in very fast, with nothing but enjoyment. I haven't had an Anime style MMO do this to me in so long since Phantasy Star Online 2 when it was in Open Beta. I played Mabinogi for a solid two years, but I just lost any enjoyment I had with that game, because of how Pay to Win it was, along with how ignorant and elitist the Community is for all of Nexon's published Games.However, even though this game did pull me in, and I have enjoyed the almost 80 hours I have put into it, it definitely does have some flaws (All MMOs have flaws.)Pros:-Classes: I took a look at what each of the classes do before I decided to start my journey, and while they all performed pretty well in what I have seen from Youtube, I decided to go with the Scythe, because I love Ranged DPS (This will also be a Con,) and I love that the Pets you summon give you benefits depending on which 3 of the 6 demons are summoned.  It's definitely crazy how high your Crit and Speed gets along the way, especially around level 55.-Outfits: A lot of the outfits in this game are definitely what you would expect from an Anime-style MMO (Especially for Female characters, which I chose for my Scythe). I listed this as a Pro, because while you only get a certain amount of Costumes from doing the Main Storyline in each are, there are actually a lot of Outfits in this game that you can also get from other sources. There aren't that many Costumes on the Shop either, which is also a plus, because it isn't Pay to Dress up.-Fishing: Yes, Fishing. The bane of every one's existence in pretty much every MMO. The one skill that will leave you bored for hours. Believe it or not, but in Aura Kingdom, Fishing is actually VERY useful, and profitable. As you fish, you can come across Fish in your inventory that when opened, can give EXP, Items for your Eidilons to feed them, Fusion materials for Orange quality Fishing Gear, Weapon Chests, and for some very odd reason, Costumes. Yes. You can get Costumes from Fishing. Most of them are not worth selling, but if you get the Custom variants (Orange,) you're going to easily pocket 50+ Gold just by selling it on the Auction House. Fishing is very profitable because you can sell the Costumes you get (low chance to get them though,) and you can open the Weapon Chests to get Weapons that you can sell to Vendors for about 100 - 200 silver (especially when you get the Level 60 Weapon Chests in the 60 areas. It's actually one of your two main sources for making income at Level 60+, unless you run the end game dungeons and get lucky on drops.-Community: You don't know how incredibly hard it is for some one of my status to list the Community as a Pro for an MMO. I have been a part of the MMO Community since Everquest, and while every single one of them suffer from the typical cesspool players and elitists, Aura Kingdom so far has been very tame, and friendly. Other than the Dimensional Halls, I have not done any Party Dungeons at all while I was leveling, but every Dimensional Hall party I was in was just friendly in general.-Soundtrack: While the Soundtrack itself does get repetitive quick in-game, and some times reused in different areas (especially for the Daily Fame / Emergency Quests,) it definitely has some that you will probably like. Candeo Core's Soundtrack is so far my favorite.-Cash Shop: Other than Runescape's Cash Shop, and Phantasy Star Online 2's, this is one of the Cash Shops that contain VERY LITTLE Pay-to-win aspects to it. You can get Weapon / Armor Fortifications and Eidolons from the Cash Shop, but you will easily get Fortifications while questing, doing dungeons, or from doing the Dailies each and every day. The Eidolons on the other hand, is pretty much like Mabinogi's Gachapons. You have a chance to receive a certain Eidolon's Key in order to obtain them, or Fragments to combine a bunch later on into a Key. This isn't really Pay-to-Win because you can obtain Eidolons from doing the Eidolon Temple, Guild Hall, or Abyss / Otherworld dungeons when they reset.Cons:-Story: MMOs usually fall into one of two categories when it comes to Story. It either succeeds very well with it, and engages you, or you just want to hate it. Unfortunately, the Story in Aura Kingdom falls under this category. Other than the Tutorial area and Port Skandia, every Main Storyline in the rest of the areas is literally the same thing. This Town needs you to retrieve what was stolen. This town has a competition and needs you to help to get what you need. Alliances need to be formed. Yada yada. Pretty much when you are doing the quests in Aura Kingdom, you're better off just speeding through the Dialogue so you can get from one area to the next.-Generic Quests: You know those Kill / Collect quests you LOVE so much from other MMOs, especially World of Warcraft? That's literally around 95% of the questing you will do. If the Anime Style of this Game, the Soundtrack, or the classes don't keep you in the game, this most certainly won't.-Classes: "But wait, Entro. You already put Classes in the Pros. Why is it in the Cons?" The main reason why is it also listed as a Con, is because of the Dungeon aspect. I will be blunt when I say this: At level 60+, if you are ANY Melee Class that is not a Guardian, don't expect to find any Parties, unless you're running with a Guild. Bosses in the end-game dungeons are VERY unforgiving to those in Melee Range, and you will die incredibly fast unless you are a Guardian, which is the Tank Class of Aura Kingdom. -Telegraphed Attacks: Pretty much all you will notice from Dungeon Elites / Bosses in this game is that they have Telegraphed Attacks, and a lot of them at that. I like being able to go into a dungeon blind and expecting some thing difficult, and figuring out how to dodge after I learn a bosses' given moveset. What I don't like is when it colors the Ground to basically show you "Don't stand here or you will get hit." This kind of feature is what pushes me away from MMOs with it included, because it takes out most of the fun and learning of dungeons right out of the game. Granted, enemies and bosses can still melee, cast spells or ranged at you normally, along with debuffing, but for the most part, you'll mostly see Telegraphed Attacks.-Eidolons: While leveling, you will get a total of three Eidolons that will accompany you. You can have only one out at a time, which is fair considering how strong they are (mainly their Special which is on a 1 minute cooldown.) The problem though, is that unless you are extremely lucky and RNG plays in your favor, you won't get more than the three default Eidolons for a long time. When you do every thing I listed in the Pros, either killing the boss or fighting the Eidolon and succeeding gives you a chance (very low) that the Eidolon will acknowledge your skills and join your party. While that is a nice feature, your only focus is pretty much just to level up the stats and levels of one of your Eidolons, specifically Sigrun (the second Eidolon,) since she is tanky, and can keep most of the aggro on her, until you start hitting and critting like crazy.-Leveling and difficulty: If you tough out the quests and the dungeons, Leveling actually goes by very fast. It begins to slow down at 45, again at 55, and then 60 - 70 turns into every Korean MMOs' long grind. For me personally, it took me 40 hours of on and off play to level up to 60, which when you look at it, isn't actually a bad grind, but if you don't like how the quests are, it will draw you away quickly. I never died once while leveling either, which is a bummer because I was hoping for more difficulty.Final Verdict: 8/10. For me, I would still recommend it to my friends that like these kind of Anime-style MMOs.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												I will rate this game on nthe basis of 3 different categories1.Gameplay2.Graphics3.Enjoyment1.Gameplay-9/10, This game is a semi real time action/mmorpg game and for a semi real time game, the combat system is really fluid, it's also fairly simple and does not suffer from any bugs, it also helps that all the moves are enjoyable to look at.2.Graphics-9/10-Great graphics, especially the anime art style, the models are all smooth and do not look weird, backgrounds are beautiful too, though needs better optimization.3.Enjoyment-8.5/10, it is pretty simple to play and really enjoyable, quests dont feel like chores and fighting the mobs are always fun, but the games needs to promote more team play, it just seems boring playing alone and PVP needs to be improved.Overall 9/10If you are a fan of anime you will love this game.

content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
												Like most MMORPG this game has the boring fetch this, kill this do this BUT what makes this unique is the fun you actually get why doing it yes you read correctly you can get some fun out of those boring quests. This game has beautifal music, delicious graphics that will just make you want to play even more. You don't even need a "good" computer for this I play this on both my computer (Gaming) and my Laptop (Can't ran minecraft with more than 20fps on lowest settings) yet it runs this game on medium setting's. I'm actually serious on all of that to.The game has loads of players on all the time through 3 servers and I think it was 7 realms (Realms are like those mini servers) I honestly think this is and will be the top Anime game till we get VR everywhere (Similar to Sword Art Online) Once that happens this game might actually be bet but knowing mmorpg companies they will probably just make an VR version of this and pooth best VR Anime MMORPG is made. Anyway to get back on track this game has several unique systems that were never implemented into other games. I won't say because well that goes the surprise. I will also actually like to add just for the female players that this game is female friendly (I'm guessing here but I believe about 25% of players are actually girls unlike in other mmo's where the are only like 5%) The class system is amazing that you can pick from 8-12 classes (Again I can't remember for some reasons) and can get a second the moment you hit lvl 40. With tons of cool Mounts, Eidolons (Similar to pets just 100x Badass) and awesome to cute costumes this game will never make you bored. (well unless you play for 15+ hours straight on leveling than I guess it would (did that the other day)Thanks for reading and sorry for any spelling mistakes or grammar miss-use

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 20, 2015
												Ok, so I can agree. This game has a good fantasy feeling to it, unlike other MMORPGs that just make you bored in 5 minutes of gameplay. The game classes contain some awesome gear and interesting spells, especially when you're the new class.Here are my GOOD sides and my BAD sides:GOOD:1. Class selection is wide ranged, unlike other MMORPGs.2. Recieving free gifts each day and a free eidelon (an in-game pet for starters).3. Friendly players who communicate kindly (most other MMORPGs aren't like this due to ragers and racism).4. The new class is awesomely epic (sorry if awesomely isn't an existing word)5. Good gameplay to make a good hour of footage/streaming on.6. I've always wanted to see a good fantasy RPG that is like Perfect Worlds but got a better aspect to the gameplay.7. The review rating is very positive which means new players every minute.8. Noobies get a good teaching tutorial unlike others where they babble on forever.9. Last but not least, fantastic graphics and music.BAD:1. Unable to switch what gender the class is (most RPGs allow you to do this, make this an update please).2. Some people tend to break all the dungeons which usually crash the game servers. This means that people can't join       fast enough and sometimes can't join at all if they have a bad computer.3. Some advanced players will try to 'help' you in to levelling, instead, all they do is leave you in a high level place and you die. This can be annoying because these players are able to persuade with such good passion that loads of players usually get tricked into it and this CAAAN be pretty rageful towards those type of players...4. You know what I'm going to say, don't you? The graphics. Sometimes the graphics ARE a bit too powerful for some computers. I usually get gigantic lag spikes but at least I don't freeze like I've been saying with some players. 5. Some attacking animations are broken. Bad computers usually make the game crash. I've only had one crash for when I was in a guild dungeon raid and I was attempting to use my sorcerer skill which kind of crashed out my game because the attacking animation was broken. This is usually caused when the creator hasn't been bothered or forget to add an actual animation to that specific skill.6. Finally, FIX THE SERVERS!!! I'm sick of people messaging my on Steam about how the Aura Kingdom servers are not working and it's all cause of me just because I used this special software to boost up my Aura Kingdom. I message them back saying "It's not my fault the servers ain't working. The software doesn't even affect the servers on Aura Kingdom so stop blaming it on me because it will most likely be a person scamming or exploiting the servers out". Like, I know Aura Kingdom can't help all these problems due to the game is gettin really popular and sooo many people are trying to join at once-especially at night. Now, I'm never going to stop playing Aura Kingdom due to these problems (I'm going to have to write this quickly because I have a guild dungeon in like 7 minutes and I don't want to miss it because if I do, I'll be kicked out the guild). -  RKIDNB (YouTuber)

												There is abolutely too much grinding. I understand that this is an MMORPG, but there is too much grinding and fetch quests. I just spammed that button after trying to have fun.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 10, 2015
												Less than two minutes into the game, I am given the option of having a dragon companion. Fifteen minutes in, I've acquired a shy ostrich as my noble steed. I've also learned to fly through the air, beaten two world bosses, and gotten a variety of Unique equipment for when I'm a higher level.Aura Kingdoms has a cute, and surprisingly deep, story. You're an 'Envoy of Gaia', blessed with a mysterious power to summon and harness pokemon- sorry, Eidolons. The host of characters all have thriving, quirky personalities. It's cliche (exactly what you would expect from an anime-themed game), but it works.Controls are finicky, and no where near as fluid as they could be: these sort of refinements however take time. There is no pay-to-win aspect that usually comes from F2P MMOs - cash-shop items all have an equivalent which can be purchased with 'loyalty' points - points you get from earning achievements, grouping with friends or greeting players. The cash shop exclusive items are cosmetic only (for example, a unicorn versus its loyalty-point equivalent: a horse-drawn carriage).It's a game I'd recommend to any guy wanting to get his girlfriend into games, or the otakus among you. Give it fifteen minutes. You'll be pleasantly surprised. It's casual. It's cute. It has dragons.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 31, 2015
												I'm a bit iffy on this one, to be honest.  Overall, it's a nice enough little game - the graphics are pretty (particularly once you figure out how to get them scaled back from 640x480 pixels) and the story, while linear as all get-out, is pretty easy to follow.  The community, such as I could see of it (bearing in mind I'm an Australian in time zone GMT+8, so I'm effectively about 8 hours out of synch with most of the English-speaking world) seemed friendly enough.  It's an MMO you can just as easily play solo - while there are some parts where you need to be part of a group, they're not compulsory.  All that said, it has one big problem - botting.  If you go into the game, you will see a lot of characters who look remarkably similar - all male, all wearing the first face, first hairstyle, and first hair colour (in other words, short purple hair) and all Grenadiers.  They'll all have the same guardian spirit (usually Sigrun, after about level 25) and they'll turn up at certain spots en masse.  Their names will be random strings of characters, because they're bots.  If you happen to be trying to level in a spot which has been botted, you're going to find yourself struggling to find the mob you're supposed to be killing, or the item you're supposed to be looking for, or the character you're supposed to be escorting, because the bots are there knee deep, and all you can do is wait for them to move on, and hope everything re-spawns before the next bot wave comes through.The game also suffers from what appears to be a common problem to many MMO  games - a single spawn point, a single storyline, and as a result the whole thing gets incredibly boring when you're running through the whole thing again in order to try out a different character class (really, though, the only MMOs I've run across which don't have this problem are World of Warcraft, and to a lesser extent, Dark Age of Camelot and City of Heroes).  This is only exacerbated by the highly linear storyline, which doesn't have many side quests available.Plus, of course, there's the standard anime problem of what the female characters are almost wearing.  One day a game design company is going to realise approximately 50% of the world's population isn't overwhelmingly interested in looking at characters with improbably bouncy breasts (either because breasts just don't do it for them, or because they have a set of breasts themselves, or both) and they're going to realise there's an un-tapped market for eye-candy just waiting to be exploited.  The designers of this game have got part of the way there - the male character models are very pretty, very bishie, and very cute to look at.  But quite frankly, when the female version of an outfit regularly comes to a packet of dental floss, three sequins and a cork (you figure out where each goes) while the male version of the same outfit covers the character from chin to toes, it gets a bit annoying.  Speak to the designers at Square Enix, for crying out loud - they at least accept there are more people playing games out there than just heterosexual men, and they provide some eye candy for the gay men and heterosexual women as well!Really, it isn't a bad game.  But then again, it doesn't really stand out in my mind as particularly good either.  If Steam had an option for "eeeehhhh..." I'd probably choose that.  But as it stands, it's getting approximately 4.99/10, and voted down.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2015
												I'm a bit iffy on this one, to be honest.  Overall, it's a nice enough little game - the graphics are pretty (particularly once you figure out how to get them scaled back from 640x480 pixels) and the story, while linear as all get-out, is pretty easy to follow.  The community, such as I could see of it (bearing in mind I'm an Australian in time zone GMT+8, so I'm effectively about 8 hours out of synch with most of the English-speaking world) seemed friendly enough.  It's an MMO you can just as easily play solo - while there are some parts where you need to be part of a group, they're not compulsory.  All that said, it has one big problem - botting.  If you go into the game, you will see a lot of characters who look remarkably similar - all male, all wearing the first face, first hairstyle, and first hair colour (in other words, short purple hair) and all Grenadiers.  They'll all have the same guardian spirit (usually Sigrun, after about level 25) and they'll turn up at certain spots en masse.  Their names will be random strings of characters, because they're bots.  If you happen to be trying to level in a spot which has been botted, you're going to find yourself struggling to find the mob you're supposed to be killing, or the item you're supposed to be looking for, or the character you're supposed to be escorting, because the bots are there knee deep, and all you can do is wait for them to move on, and hope everything re-spawns before the next bot wave comes through.The game also suffers from what appears to be a common problem to many MMO  games - a single spawn point, a single storyline, and as a result the whole thing gets incredibly boring when you're running through the whole thing again in order to try out a different character class (really, though, the only MMOs I've run across which don't have this problem are World of Warcraft, and to a lesser extent, Dark Age of Camelot and City of Heroes).  This is only exacerbated by the highly linear storyline, which doesn't have many side quests available.Plus, of course, there's the standard anime problem of what the female characters are almost wearing.  One day a game design company is going to realise approximately 50% of the world's population isn't overwhelmingly interested in looking at characters with improbably bouncy breasts (either because breasts just don't do it for them, or because they have a set of breasts themselves, or both) and they're going to realise there's an un-tapped market for eye-candy just waiting to be exploited.  The designers of this game have got part of the way there - the male character models are very pretty, very bishie, and very cute to look at.  But quite frankly, when the female version of an outfit regularly comes to a packet of dental floss, three sequins and a cork (you figure out where each goes) while the male version of the same outfit covers the character from chin to toes, it gets a bit annoying.  Speak to the designers at Square Enix, for crying out loud - they at least accept there are more people playing games out there than just heterosexual men, and they provide some eye candy for the gay men and heterosexual women as well!Really, it isn't a bad game.  But then again, it doesn't really stand out in my mind as particularly good either.  If Steam had an option for "eeeehhhh..." I'd probably choose that.  But as it stands, it's getting approximately 4.99/10, and voted down.

content:
Posted: October 24, 2015
												Fun game to start off with, but gets repetitive kinda quickly. Really only kept playing it when I had nothing better to do. Graphics are nice and characters are cute, the attack animations are really nice too.Not p2w but if you want good pets/armour/weapons/outfits, you're gonna have to give real money.Game's a bit clunky...? Easy to skip through story text (not that's it's all that interesting) and just auto-run to quests. The main quests aren't that challenging so it's bit boring... (LOTS of collect X kill Y). Pretty prone to login and teleport glitches. There's a lot of bots as well but they're pretty harmless, mostly theyre just used for farming and will only bother to send you an obvious spam message if you hang around in busy parts of the main city. Main problem is that a lot of game mechanics/systems aren't explained properly, especially when they add something new in and you're not playing a new character. Lately they keep adding in a lot of side stuff (like jobs (?), card game, instances) which... are really boring but you can ignore...? Looting is actually quite bad too, I've played over 100 hours and I'm level 60+ but have very little gold, dungeons and monsters don't give much, with most of your decent earnings come from just turning in quests.It's alright if you want something mindless to play for a couple of hours.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 14, 2015
												I've been playing Aura Kingdom since it started. If you don't believe me, I have a beta Crunchyroll exclusive costume, which I still use up to this day even if it doesn't give extra stats.Aura Kingdom is a great game, since there are some unique classes (and some unreleased ones) and you get to choose a sub-class once you get to level 40. This means you get to have two classes in one character! Cool, isn't it? You can choose to have a sub-class fitting your main class, or you can experiment!Leveling up is really easy. You level up faster than Sonic can ever go fast, but that's until you get to level 60, where you will feel like Sonic who lost his limbs from an accident. If you can be young forever, then you can be forever level 60 in this game, that is if you're too lazy to grind. Beat your meat instead then.Aura Kingdom has been my life ever since it started. I have 1000 (non-Steam) hours of this game which you can see on my XFire account (which is cannot be access now because XFire decided to remove its social part. Oh, my game hours. I should've downloaded Aura Kingdom via Steam...)I gained a lot of friends in this game, and also made a family here (lol, just kidding). This game also made me realize that I have an uncle from overseas which I never know because I don't even care about my relatives, and he's even the lover of my "in-game mother" (so sad they broke up). Good way to start the game is to join a guild. Joining guilds grants bonus exp (depends on what level the guild is). You can easily form a party with your guild mates, have fun and/or colect EECs to summon an Eidolon to get keys! Oh, did I mention Eidolons? They're like pets. Some looks like pets, and some looks like humans. Human pets, I guess. They accompany you on your quests, as if you have a friend. Imagine a 4-member party, each party member calls upon their Eidolon, then now it feels like an 8-member party! Except you cannot make friends with their Eidolon. They have a cute Eidolon? Then too bad, you have to stick with your own.Most people in this game will kill for cosmetics and Eidolons. Do you know how much a cosmetics in this game costs? IT COST YOUR WHOLE LIFE! AND I ACCIDENTALLY BOUGHT AN UGLY COSMETIC ONCE! NOW I HAVE A HUGE DEBT THAT I CANNOT REPAY UNTIL MY DEATH. But seriously, this game is a lot of fun. Try it! And if you didn't enjoy the game, then I'll agree being your slave for a lifetime. Just don't lie and say it's a horrible game when in fact, you're a naughty dirty liar who now spends his/her entire life to Aura Kingdom.Just a tip: Gold is very important and you have to save up and never use them to stupid things, unless you're rich, like my friends. My friends are rich, all of them. And I'm poor. I was rich. Now I'm poor. Very poor. Don't be stupid like me. Unless you want to be stupid like me, then let's make a stupid club.This review is brought to you by someone who almost typed his entire real life and game life story in this review.TL;DR: Don't let your dreams be dreams. Do it. Just do it!

content:
Posted: November 12, 2015
												I have 2 games to compare this toWorld of Warcraft and Dragon Nest(neither of them on steam but I've played themWorld of Warcraft similaritiesThe combat is very world of warcraft and so is the world which is alright for an open world gamethe open world is also like world of warcraft, but also restricted to by level like with dragon nestThe questing is also kinda world of warcraft-ish (to an extent) go here, kill this, fetch this, give this etc.You can swim and jump around places to get around the map (and the map is pretty bigDragon Nest SimilaritiesThe Combat is flashy looking and can be used rapidly (still not that exciting but whatever)The art style and music are similarThe graphics are similar and both aren't difficult to runNow for the pros -Music is goodArt syle is goodIt's only 5.4gbeasy for beginnerstown is vibrant and alive with all the NPC's walking around and talkingthe combat is fast and flashyand the cons -combat is fast and flashy, and that's about it, it's still lock on and feel the force of no knockbackMusic is too short and loopsgrinding is long and boring (and this was at low levels)gameplay feels bland and repetitive, go here, kill this, go there kill thisstory kinda sucks, you start with awesome armor, powerful dude named dark something overpowers you, then you start overI don't recommend this game if you like good fightingI do if you like open worlds because this one looks really nice(BTW I haven't played much WoW, got kinda bored quick, I just played enough to learn how the game is, play around with mechanics, got some of the story down, explored a fair bit and did some quests, dragon nest on the other hand I may have over 300 hours by now not sure since I've been playing for a few years now, (since the level 40 cap)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 3, 2015
												After a few days of playing the game, here is what I could tell you, folks.1) Never ever EVER spend cash in this game, or your account will be banned for "billing inactivity" (well, that's what I heard from a lot of people).2)This game is basicly a copy of World of Warcraft (yeah, other classes, other story, anime graphics but still! Same point-and-click battles, and all you could find in WoW). The bad thing - Copy. A thing like this already exists. Good thing - it's FREE. You CAN donate into the game, but remember the difference between the words CAN and MUST. In WoW, you MUST pay EVERY MONTH! to play. Otherwise, you'll only have the starter pack (that's why I never played WoW over level 20). 3)Speaking of graphics, minding the fact that I love the oldstyle drawn anime and FREAKING HATE 3D ANIME, this is actually pretty wonderfull! And sill better then WoW. Can't compare with ESO (that even has a diferent gameplay), though.4)Gameplay. If you've ever played World of Warcraft, you won't have to read the tutorials, as the mechanics are pretty much all the same. Use WASD, or point on the ground to move, click someone to interact, click on your weapon icon to attack. Basic (and sometimes boring). Oh, why did I say that, now level [insert 99-digit number here] kids from WoW will hate me xD.5)My personal feelings about the game - WHAT THE HELL ARE CUSTUMES FOR AND HOW THE HELL DO THEY WORK??!?!! Sorry, had to burst out at some point... So, costumes. By default, you should have an adventurer's costume and some armour. Now look at this nonsence - I have armor on (yeah, found it out when got new armr, and wanted to see how it looks), so, I have armour on, I take off the costume and *pam the character is naked. W.T.F.? Maybe I don't understand how to take off the costume and leave the armour, and hope someone will help me out.At this point, I guess it's all I have to say.

content:
Posted: February 18, 2015
												Honest Review:  Alright started  playing this game and never had questions on how to do something ,meaning the tutorials are great and easy for people to understand.    Things that annoyed me:1)To access higher level maps you have to do the main story line meaning you can do dungeons all the way to the max lvl 75 but if you havn't  done the quest line you will be stuck in a 1-30 lvl zone until  you do so. Why is this bad? Making a new character will be a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥since you got to do the same questline over and over again, you are forced into doing the quest line.2)This game is very strict on censorship , there is no turn off swear filter button any typo that you do will be bleep by these annoying a** s**t.3)Auction houses - you know how you can put a price per unit on something your selling ? Well yea not in this f**king game you have to put a price on the whole thing meaning they have to buy your thing in bulk or you won't get any sales and get this you can only put the item in the auction for 1 day ,oh and it is also taxed.4)PvP blows - it is a type of event in the game meaning you have to get on a certain time of the day in order to join and i don't even reccomend joining if you aern't max level.You don't recieve bonus stats or game changing stats for that matter if your lvl 20 going up against a lvl 75 you will miss everything, your stuns won't even register and you will be a target by all players since you WILL get one shotted.Negative♥♥♥♥♥♥aside- The game allows you to respec your stats and masteries (not your class) for ingame currency ( The one you earn) you can also chose a sub-class at lvl 40 for example i make a gaurdian and at lvl 40 i get a quest in order to be a part bard to get its healing abilities.I reccomend this game though not bad when PvE gameplay is involved .

content:
Posted: April 15
												Likely the best free to play mmorpg experience available at the moment   A great breath and depth to the game ensures the player is never bored. Hours upon hours of content comes through the form of missions and side quests that offer a variety from just the basic fetch quest or escort style staple of the genre.   The visuals is breathtaking and immersive. Exploration is fun as every region offers secret dungeons/areas/bosses. The soundtrack befits and complements the atmosphere of each unique zone.   PVP balancing may be an issue, but can be completely ignored until end game. The cash shop is mostly reliant on cosmetic items, which may provide a small but negligeable stat boost. You can earn cash shop cosmetic items anyways from loyalty points! Very little pay to win here!

content:
Posted: July 21, 2014
												6 ducks out of 5 I thoroughly enjoyed, and am enjoying this game with its eye pleasing anime style graphics, and a nice sense of progression it takes the cake for me. Pros - Nice Anime style graphics - A nice progression system with tons of customazation - Pretty likable characters (specificaly merrilee for me) - Combat feels fun with the flashy skills, and cute characters - The edilions make you feel less lonely in the game (even though its an mmo) with there little side conversations, and tipsCons - Party system needs some revamping so that being in a party actually means somthing :P - Quest system can get a bit stale after a while - Edilions can be rediculously hard to get - Bosses go down to easy in teams  Overall I consider this a great game and refreshing break from all the serious mmos out there.

content:
Posted: April 10, 2016
												I liked this game more then I should.  Its not really that good, the character creation and customization is very limited, the gameplay is literally just the same quests rehashed over and over, and the combat gets pretty boring very quickly.  So why do I recommend this game?  Because I still liked playing it.  While its still a Free-to-Play MMORPG, it never makes you feel like you HAVE to pay for things to be good at it.  If it wasn't for Final Fantasy XIV filling my MMO spot, I might still be playing this from time to time.I recommend this to those looking for an alright F2P MMORPG.  For anyone else, I'd say not to bother, its not good enough to spend hours on.  The lore is uninteresting, the characters are forgettable, and, again, the quests are all rehashes of each other.  Kill 16 of these enemies, kill these enemies to obtain X item, and use X item on 5 enemies.

I start it up for the first time, it glitches my laptop out and crashes my whole computer2. I turned my laptop back on and I started it up again3. I start to enjoy the game-until the "name your character" comes along.4. I spend about 18 minutes trying to get a name to work. I got one... That was glitched out :)5. I select the Cheery Slyph and it says "This name is used!" Or something like that.6. I start to noobly search for a namebox for my companion... But I was a noob. Read 4. again for more details7. My name (GoldenHeart) says its not used, but it was actually so I just spammed a huge load of letters into my name :D8. I start the adventure (finally) and I stare at all the pose glitches there are... the girl with pink hair having her fingers in her head :)9. I start doing the quests... But all tabs and stuff (toolbox, map etc) was blocking my view :D10. I am on the quest to defeat 3 monsters, I only remember one name kinda... it was a greezly or something?...11. I find the first monster, the chat box blocks my move attacks and I can't attack while I was getting beat up :)12. I finally catch up to the chat box that was blocking my attack moves and I was able to kill the first monster :)13. On my second monster, the troll chat box comes back :D...14. I rage quit :)This was the best tutorial experience ever!!! 11/10 :)joking. Sorry. But. Yes. (The experience was true doe).

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												Personally, I am loving this game. Reasons for the positives are:Very nice scenery, whether at high setting or low, this game still shines out on top.The characters are very kawaiii! Just make you want to hug'em. <3The point's tree for character upgrade is very simple and straight-forward and is very uniquw in terms of different classes needing different points in their skills.Very nice weapons (personal favourite)A very nice community as well, everyone is working together and there isn't very much arguing.Negatives for this game. ):Every game has it's negatives, but this fortunately has very little:Eventhough leveling is straightforward, it does take AGGGGEEESS to level up.Quests are very generic, such as "Kill this many ...."The story isn't that in-depth, as in, you don't get to know you're character as much and it gets very boring.Overall rating: 9/10Concluding from all this, I will still enjoy this game and eventhough there are a couple of negatives about this game, they are made up by the enjoyment of the game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												Fun anime-based MMO; not overly complicated, and easy to learn.Pros:Flashy moves!Scantily-clad anime-chicks!The ability to skip useless quest-dialogue!You can fly!Cons:Horrendous server stability.Overly goofy Asian-MMO crafting/upgrading system.You can fly (but there are MILLIONS of mid-air invisible walls blocking obvious flight paths)!All in all, a great free-to-play game, that seems to just utilize it's item mall for character decoration, which is A-OK.  Now, with it's server instability, and it's awkward crafting/upgrading, it suits being a free-to-play game, as paying for the game would denote much better server maintenance.Quick Edit:  To discuss the crafting system a bit more, it seems a lot of the F2P Asian-based MMO's nowadays seem to not want to tread on eachother's crafting systems, each new MMO coming up with a more awkward and less sensical way to craft and upgrade gear than the last.  Not a terribly bad thing, but worthy of note.

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												Pros:-Lots of classes to choose from, 13 total.-Lots of versatility when creating your build, such as stat points, masteries, and talent tree.-Flashy combat animations.-Cinematics make the story easy to follow.Cons:-BORING tap-targeting gameplay.-Limited character customization.-Outdated graphics even on max settings.-Messy UI.-Auto-pathing removes immersion and exploration.Overall, I can't really recommend this game mainly because the gameplay is incredibly boring, and it makes me want to fall asleep after the first five minutes of playing the game. Also, the auto-patching feature of the game really removes the immersion of the game because it feels like the game is just playing itself most of the time. However, I do like the choices you can make with your build because it allows for any play style. Personally, I prefer MMO's that immerse into the world and allow for more exploration.

content:
Posted: July 30, 2015
												Good:- Interesting character development system. - Plenty of engaging activities to do.- Crafting system with reasonable economic integrity.- Friendly community (for the most part).- Robust gear systemBad:- Not explicitly pay to win, but pay for advantage.- Auction House effected by cash shop items.- Legions of gold spammers and bots.- Quite a few UI and gameplay bugs that need to be ironed out.- THE GAMBLING ELEMENTS ARE TOO STRONG IN THE CASH SHOP- Why can I fly over a chasm but not hop a 2-ft fenceBottom Line:- Craving a neat, stop-gap MMO? Looking for a casual MMO experience with a few hardcore elements? Not much time and not willing to commit to a AAA title? AK is right for you.- If you're willing to overlook the elements that make for a bad F2P experience (cash-shop crack junkies, unstable AH, goldbots) you'll have a blast.- Customer Service - on a scale from One to Comcast, Aeria Games are like an 8.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 15
												Likely the best free to play mmorpg experience available at the moment   A great breath and depth to the game ensures the player is never bored. Hours upon hours of content comes through the form of missions and side quests that offer a variety from just the basic fetch quest or escort style staple of the genre.   The visuals is breathtaking and immersive. Exploration is fun as every region offers secret dungeons/areas/bosses. The soundtrack befits and complements the atmosphere of each unique zone.   PVP balancing may be an issue, but can be completely ignored until end game. The cash shop is mostly reliant on cosmetic items, which may provide a small but negligeable stat boost. You can earn cash shop cosmetic items anyways from loyalty points! Very little pay to win here!

number of helpful: 11 of 24 people (46%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 11
												This is a anime MMORPG.You are a anime teen that gets a eidalon to help you save the world, but be carefull for if you fall into darkness then your mind will slip and you will become a mindless monster.The characters looks too much alike since there is not a rich character design pool.There is a 3 character limit for a server, but it can be expected. There is a delete character limit per day.You can only be a human male or female and there are no beards or wrinkles. You only have 1 starting area.There is a auto-walk-to-quest thing in this game so you should not be able to get lost. Daily quests, mini quests, dungeons with solo exist and forced party dungeons that you will need others to complete.You can pick between 4 eidalons in the start of the game. Eidalons are mosters that will help you in fights and they have alot of speech bubbles that will ask you about new friends and stuff going on. You can feed your eidalon with experiance and things that can give your eidalon better stats. Eidalons can be bought and be found in the quests. The eidalons can be sent out on quests that lasts 10 min and that will give you a item, but it will cost them some energy. You can give the eidalons more enegy back by asking them questions and getting to know them.The people does not seem to be online or sosial so if you are not entering the game with friends then it is going to be a kind of lonly experience. The party and group finding isen't userfriendly for people that has not joined the game with friends. NPCs look alike, so you will see the same npc skin with different names.Your character can have 3 different classes when you get to a high level. The extra classes can give you some extra skills that can help you.This is my honest opinions of the classes untill level 15:Bard is a support hero that is boring as all hell. With a Green and Red music meter.Dualist is a single target dps class that is fancy to use and kind of fun.Ranger is a ranged dps class. As this class a player actually talked to me and someone added her to the guild for no reason.Ravager is a melee dps/tank class that has a Rage-Meter and that is fun in a fighting-for-you-life kind of way. I didn't noticed that I was level 14 at first cause it felt so much more fun then almost all of the other previous classes.Reaper is a ranged dps/summoner class that can summon 3 demons out of 5 at a time to help kill the enemys. Not that much fun and the rotation is too slow so that you are autoattacking alot of the time.Shonobi is a ranged dps class that can summon a shadow person that seems to be a neko or something. You can summon 2 different once by attacking, but only 1 of them comes out and leaves after a short while. You do look fancy using this class and you kill creatures effectivly but it was not my ally.Ronin is a melee dps class that has a soul-meter. You can charge up it to use storm mode to use storm abilitys but you need to fight to recharge the soul-meter. The attack from it was kind of cool and it fits to take down enemy groupes infront of you.Gunslinger is a ranged dps class with some traps. You have 4 spesial shots that seems to be randomized. It takes about 7 seconds to reload the spesial bullets. This is a class that is hard to fight single targets with cause some of the skills have alot of aggro.Brawler is a melee dps class. This is a fast, intens and fun fighter. It has a small heal and is intense to use.Grenadier is a ranged dps aoe class. This is a slow, aoe, damage dealer that can summon a machinegun to help, even has a frost grenade.Wizard is a ranged dps class. This is a complicated one to use since it has a spell sync that you need to get some damage out of the spells with a spamable one, a healing one and a upgrader to 1 of your 4 elements.Guardian is a melee tank class. You have a shield that can take the hits and later a skill that can reflect and protect you. Shield bash for the stun.Holy Sword is a melee dmg/aoe/semi-tank class. You have a claymore and the light to kill enemys in an aoe. You have a Divine-Energy-Meter that automaticly fill that will make your skills do more damage for 1 attack, then recharge. Has skills that close gaps.Sorcerer is a ranged dps support class. You have a book and deal damage with spells, even some support skills. You have a Dark-Magic-Meter that is filled by some of your spells and it can have up to 3 spells. The spells can be casted with a higher effect and it seems random what you got.This character lasted until level 32 before I could not stand it anymore.The grenader is a ranged dps that was kind of op. I just mean it cause I defeated people 11 levels over me by using the stun shot and the frost grenade + have the turret up right before the dual starts.This is not the best or worst MMORPG out there. It is kind of mediocer in my opinion. So if you like having alot of classes to pick from and being only humans with eidalons that can help you fight and you have friends playing with you then this might be a game for you.Have fun, enjoy and cuddle your eidalon :)

number of helpful: 3 of 8 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 9, 2015
												Aura Kingdom is a wolf in sheeps clothing,  don't let anybody fool you into believing AK isn't a pay to win MMo, because it really is.   Fans will say you can earn everything payers have in-game,  which is a lie -  I'd like to see non-paying players get highly fortified gear and the best costumes/mounts, after all - this is why most people play and this is where the wolf appears - AK is a free to play game, yes you can 'earn' some stuff if you play it enough, but don't expect rare eidolons, don't expect orange costumes, shiny weapons or epic mounts without either paying some serious cash, we're talking hundreds of dollars for the teired spenders PER MONTH, and lets not talk about the gambling boxes which have an extremely low chance for nice items,  so new players joining AK will have an even tougher time with the heavily bloated economy, it was bad back at launch and now its just stupid with some items costing 20,000g+ and gold isn't that easy to acquire unless you....buy the teired spenders and sell them for gold....and this is what Aura Kingdom is mostly about here, don't let anyone tell you otherwise because they are either lying, or naive. The problem is that with the P2W elements, or pay to 'show off' with the best looking gear/mounts - if you put all that aside, the actual game itself isn't bad, the anime styled graphics and characters look good, the combat flow is slick and there are some interesting storylines and locations,  the game has improved since Aeria was sold to ProSieben but the old dirty tricks and sheer excessive spender promotions is an abomination on MMo gaming.   Unfortunately, the real culprit is the developer X-Legend who are well known for creating these predatory anime styled MMos which lure many players in with ultra cute graphics and then fleece the customers for every penny they own. The other problem Aura Kingdom has had since launch, and that is bots and gold farmers,  Its near impossible to go 5 minutes without recieving automated gold spam.  And certain areas are filled with bots, this has been going on since launch - and unfortunately is a major problem. Overall.  Aura Kingdom is a fun game, nobody can really deny that.   But you  have to ask yourself, what do *you* want to get out of the experience,  playing with friends, raiding and creating cute or cool characters and don't care that'll you never get the best gear, the coolest looking pets or mounts then Aura Kingdom will keep you interested -  however, if your the type who is competitive, then be prepared to either be very disappointed, or open your wallet wide open.

number of helpful: 3 of 8 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 15, 2015
												First impression review:Graphics are extremely cute, very well done animations, game runs smoothly on the highest settings.Aesthetics Um...Actually, almost exactly the same as Ragnarok Online 2, before RO2 became a steaming pile of poop and left us all to wonder why. Learning Curve None, you can pick it up and play and it might be the easiest game of all time to learn how to get started. Note, not the easiest MMORPG of all time to pick up and play, but the easiest GAME of all time to pick up and play. Plus it's free, which is a big plus! Soundtrack Totally throwaway soundtrack, which is to be expected from any MMORPG, or most games in general, really. Epic ambient music because you're a mega hero, or something like that. Overall:  Again, this is just written on my first impression. I've been looking for a new MMO to play around with, and I may have found it with this title. It works, it's Free to Play (Without any nastiness that I've seen thus far), it's well optimized, extremely nice to look at, and there seems to be a gigantic influx of SPAM. Ah, MMO's, how I've missed you. Honestly, this feels like it's going to be a great game to jump into for awhile - Like RO2 was, before they completely screwed it up by being jerks and making it near-impossible to play. Quests are very similar to everything else, so I have a strong feeling that they're trying to appeal to the RP crowd of people who have watched every anime on earth and want something to do while they listen to the soundtrack of Evangelion. I'm not talking badly about people who are into anime, because heck, I'm into it...to an extent. Seriously, this looks pretty cool and plays rather well, I just wish there was some sort of learning curve to it, which is often a complaint with MMO's. I don't mind having to learn a little bit to play a game, and the lack of needing to learn anything makes me seriously question its depth and longevity. The visuals are AWESOME. Maxed out, working great. Definitely an A+ for that. On the F2P MMO scale, 8/10, easily.

content:
Posted: March 7
												Haven't played too much of it, but here's a small recap of what I think:Graphics; the graphics are alright, but I think that World of Warcraft in Vanilla was more appealing to the eye than this was.Gameplay; gameplay was decent, I grinded to level 10 but simply got bored because the mechanics seem a bit too easy and a bit clunky.Story; storyline was not really explained that well and wasn't really made well since as soon as you create your character and log in you are put set in some random location where you easily defeat 3 monsters then some 'Shadow Knight' defeats you very easily. I don't think the story should have been rushed like that.Sound; sound wasn't too bad but some parts of the sound were really loud and some were really quiet, I think the dialogue wasn't up to my expectations either as I expected the dialogue to be voiced over by an actor but to my surprise was not delighted.Character creation; the character creation was really well, there is many classes to choose from with well detailed descriptions with the classes you could choose from, the types of hair and eyes etc, wasn't too much of a variety but I think there could be more.Overall, the game isn't bad but I didn't really want to spend more time grinding on this game as I wasn't really interested in playing the game.If you like anime MMORPGs I would recommend just waiting for Lost Ark or playing a kind of similar styled game called Revelation Online which just finished its closed beta status.I would rate this game a 6.5/10 but if you have played games like Mabinogi, Fiesta Online, Eden Eternal, Aika Online, Archeblade or Dragon Nest and liked those types of games then go ahead and give this game a try!

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 14, 2016
												So, i was asked to do a review for this game.   Quite Honestly its to weebo related, This is for those want to be japanese, chinese asian types. But with that said the game isnt that bad the story is fine an sound.A bit of work could be done to it.  This isnt close to a pay to win so that wins points in my opinion but there is more then free to play thats neededWhen you cant really edit your chars thats a start and when you are an open world you dont simple click an go to the mobs that defeats the point to explain.  Now do not take my opinions the wrong way i know many people will say BUT A MMO IS HARD!, and those people are right but thier meant to be.  Now the main reason i have an issue with the game is gender restrictions, and very little on market place, I can see why it seems to be dieing there is not enough items nore items in which would want to be baught most the items in the shop are for cosplay or weebo's as stated before.  If people want to be foxes they should play Tera,  If the game devs are aware of this an purposly dont add an animal race so people buy the ears an such then thats smart but also very poor behavior. Now there is many things i liked in this game mainly the Reaper Class, and its spell set which matched up perfectly  How ever the summons were weak an couldnt kill a level 1 even if thier crummy lives depended on it.  You end up doing the main damage an even that wasnt balanced at points you hit 20 an another same battle you peak to 800.  Now i know my Wep isnt suppose to do 1.4k but it doesnt get close to that. Pro's :completely free, Classes, / Side CompanionsQuest Helper / Map.cosplay,Cheap items in mall,Easy LevelingCon's : To much for weebos, Hardly Anything Aside from clothing an crummy Exp Potions / Box / Scrolls,None helpfull (aside from Stones Smithing)  Tutorials, And just Devs who wont add a race because the Accessory's in the shop make them money.Thanks for Reading this is my opinion and i know others wont agree, But its For weebo's

content:
Posted: January 21
												I was trying to log into my account after not accessing the game for a year (due to school and me having to uninstall the game) but couldn't cause apparently I used the wrong username and/or password. And when I went to check my "Forgot my pass" on Aeria, I found out that my account was blocked. And I'm honestly very taken aback and very disappointed. I have no idea why my account was disabled, but it makes me extremely unhappy cause I've dedicated plenty of time into the game, and to have my progress lost just angers me tremendously.Currently, I'm about to restart the game and hopefully access my account again. If I can't I may resort to the new account I just created for myself. If there is an extra large update that caused my progress to be lost, it is reasonable. But if my account was blocked and removed for NO REASON? That's just it. HOWEVER, if I catch something that's interesting, I may stick around again. But we'll see. If I go through the same ordeal - I'm not gonna get struck by the same thing twice. -_-

My hunter! Sadly, I had grown tired of him already, so I erased him and made a new character, this time a gunslinger (big difference, huh).I got the gunslinger to around level 12, it was fun and all. Two days later, I try to log in to my account and find out that my gunslinger is gone. In his place, there's this damn hunter with his crappy bow, ready for some adventure.Guess I won't be playing this anymore.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2014
												An absolute joke of a game, and trust me im taking into account the model of it. This game is hardly a game, and it's not an experience either. MMORPG's are meant to be games where you build the character you want and live out their life (role-playing). It doesn't meet up to that. You can't build the character you want because you cant change the "costume" they wear. There are no more costumes for your class you choose than you can count with one hand, and they're spaced out along all the levels between noob 1 and veteran 1000. Maybe 5 hairstyles- I mean, seriously. I'm still not used to the way MMO's also love to make the genders drastically separated by making the females look like babies with massive♥♥♥♥♥♥and hips exposed for people to see- and the males look like lumberjacks 5 feet taller than the babygirls. Luckily, this is anime based so ALL the males just look like normal, average, typical, girls. (Which personally would be fine, im not trans but I sympathize with that♥♥♥♥♥♥ But there's no point in the male gender existing if 100% of them look either girly or just look like vikings.)But I didn't even tell you the big thing about this monstrosity. It's almost as bad of a grind as Destiny. There is no game, there is no experience. They tried to pack it full of storyline and cutscenes in small linear pathways of a map instead of creating a game or an experience and to put it simply, there are just a few steps to mastering this game:STEP 1. ACCEPT QUEST 1STEP 2: CLICK WHATEVER NOTIFICATION POPS UP SO THE GAME CAN AUTOPILOT YOUR CHARACTER WHEREVER THE QUEST IS TELLING YOU TO GO FOR WHATEVER YOU'RE SUPPOSED TO DO- WAIT FOR THIS TO FINISH.STEP 3: UPON ARRIVAL OF WHEREVER THE ♥♥♥♥ LAND, I THINK A POKEMON STYLE DIALOGUE MENU POPS UP FOR WHOEVER THE GAME MADE YOU APPROACH. CLICK "SKIP" TO THE END.STEP 4: CLICK FINISH ON THE SAME MENU. YOU JUST BEAT A MISSIONSTEP 5: CLICK ACCEPT ON THE SAME MENU. NEW NOTIFICATION MENU POPS UP WITH A WAYPOINT FOR THE GAME TO AUTOPILOT YOUR CHARACTER. REPEAT THE PROCESS.The first 10 levels will be nothing but this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. It doesn't take long but it's not very rewarding because there's no point in playing an MMORPG when you can't role play and it's the opposite of massive.I swear to ♥♥♥♥ing christ, I know absolutely nothing about this game because I click-grinded my way to level 12. After I ran out of missions entirely and started to wonder when I get to change the look of my character, I started to learn that there are 3 different maps and i've already been to 2 of them and they have names, and that there's people in a city and they have names. Apparently I had talked to almost every NPC and nobody's name rang a bell, nobody's appearance looked familiar, and I still know ♥♥♥♥ing jack about the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ story. I paid ♥♥♥♥ of any attention to this Notification Simulator.And you know what kept me click-grinding through to level 12 and nothing to show for it?The whole time I thought I was still in the tutorial mode. Because there was nonstop popups from all the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ quests and I still had no ability to customize my appearance.I was clicking through as fast as possible to get to the 'game' where I can play the role I wanted.

												A lot of guys in the reviews say that the devs are horrible for their support. I was tempted to not play this jewel. However, one guy, and I forget his username, wrote a review of the true reason for some of the devs responses. First of all, they will shut down your account if you are inactive for too long. However, you can get it back by msging the team. The reason for doing this is to prevent your account from being hacked thus protecting your real money purchases or anything you own. They did this with me and I contacted them and not even a day later they responded and gave my account back. The list goes on. For the gameplay, it is fun although it can get a little repetitive. Over all it is a great game with great potential and I recommend you grab some friends and play this! My one complaint is that they don't have a marriage system...that would be pretty cool.

content:
Posted: August 1, 2015
												I once was a good man, who believed in justice and would forgive people for their mistakes...NOT WITH THIS♥♥♥♥♥♥GAME!I was a young adult, 19 I was. Having had a good weekend so far it would all change on the last day of the weekend. Saturday, waking up feeling good because there isn't much to worry about in life because you've woken up knowing that you don't have to do♥♥♥♥♥♥till Sunday. Aura Kingdom had been completed for me, I was patience...initial download one hour...very good...then came the launcher...with it...came the most slowest update I've had since learning how the Pluto wasn't a planet anymore during age 13. 6 whole hours I stared, 6 whole hours i waited...but it was k...I was patience. I got into the game and oh boy was it worth the wait. My world was open when I saw the nice models of characters, the diverse customization, the ranges of class and its clear explanation on how each class works...then came the hard part...I had to choose between a unicorn or a dragon...it broke my heart to only have to choose one...so I choose the pink slyph cause I do wa i wan. I started playing the game...loved the combat...loved how a fat man only has to click the quest and it moves you there...loved how every hour the server would freeze and be ok again...for 4 hours I used the auto route...for 4 hours I trekked throught the world of the game called Aura Kingdom...I was a happy man...so I took a break...played a couple of MOBA games...finished them...but then everything changed. It was now the last day of the weekend, I go back to the game...only to find that my happiness was a lie...the launcher...would not launch the game...my 4 hours had been a lie. I wanted answers so I went to the main website...it was down...for an hour already...I couldn't get back on and make those 4 hours I spent on it even longer...why you do this game.Moral of the story:♥♥♥♥♥♥game

Lastly, you're going to need money, lots of it to buy eidolons that will buff up your character, and there's some issues with the devs, like banned from billing, banned because of inactivity, and banned for no reason. Seeing the game right now, i can't recommend it to everyone. You could try to play the game, but you will get bored of it, fast.

content:
Posted: August 15, 2014
												Aura Kingdom is a free-to-play Anime MMORPG featuring strong PVE elements, a uniquely detailed world, and an engaging, well-crafted story. Aura Kingdom empowers players as Envoys of Gaia, gifted individuals that take the role of one of nine classes. High-level players can also choose a secondary weapon, allowing for hundreds of possible weapon and skill combinations. You will also scour the world far and wide to collect the rarest and strongest Eidolons, loyal companions that fight alongside you in combat. Gather up some friends and take on the best of what Aura Kingdom has to offer!

content:
Posted: November 17, 2014
												At very first I must say I enjoyed the game a lot.. for a while. I don't like anime at all but I was very bored and I decided to try a game outside of my comfort zone. The graphics is ok, music is bit of repetetive and story was ok. Although the missing voice acting makes this product feel like low budjet game.The game is extremely grindy. You can get levels quite fast at the beginning by doing quests but after level 45 things will change. The main quest ends about level 55 and after that you have to grind your level through dailies and dungeons. And that's really painful indeed.  Actually the one thing I liked was that you can run some of the dungeons on solo mode. So you actually had something to do while you waited your guildies to gather their group for 5 men dungeon run. I liked also the skill system and especially the thing that you can spend the attribute points like you really want. However there isn't too much options for effective character builds and that's the reason it feels very simple.Crafting is also typical Korean style click&pray function. You farm the materials, find/buy the blueprint and click the "craft" -button. I was quite surprised when I saw the dumbed down crafting system because even the fishing is one kind of mini game. There aren't any kind of level or skill system for crafting or fishing. Fishing "skill" is based on your fishing gear and crafting level is equal with your adventure level. Nothing special... or actually there is. The crafting is huge money sink because the challenge is replaced with carfting costs.Well, that was the game play in nut shell. Now I'm going to tell some things that I didn't like at all. The backpack size is very limited at the beginning. This encourages player to buy some more backpacks with APs. The AP is a game currency that you can only get with real money. Sure you can buy those backpacks with loyalty points later but you really have to play a lot to get enough points for 20 slots backpacks. Some people are sellng those through the AH but because of gold farmers the prices are very high.Aaaannd.. those gold farmers. Seriously! That's the biggest issue in game at the moment. There is hundreds.. or even thousands of bots those are questing, doing dailies and killing stuff. For example I was in Navea (capital city) and counted over 120 bots running in same loop in 30 minutes. Can you imagine? The similar looking red haired gunners had a long endless train from quest givers to another. It was insane! I played GW2 since the beta and I thought there was very large number of bots. But no.. the amount of bots is nothing to compare the number of bots in AK. There is more bots in game than actually real players and Arial Games just can't get rid of them. People are buying gold and gold farmers are making more bots. There is already some lag issues because of botting and reporting doesn't help at all. That's is the reason I quit this game and I just can't recommended this game to anyone. Oh, except if you need a good platform for bot or two. This game is definitely suitable for that.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 16, 2016
Product received for free
												Aura Kingdom? Pah. More like Awful Kingdom. Great pun, I know. This game, this very game, now going to be the first game that I give up on. I'm sure there will be more, that's a given, but this thing needs some major work until I consider it something worth my time. The first thing you'll notice when you open up the game is that horrible, horrible music. I'm not blowing things out of proportion when I say that it will make your ears bleed. Just mute it right off the bat and reserve your blood supply, I'm sure you'll put it to better use in the future.   The story was mediocore at best. I found myself clicking through the dialogue with boredom, opting to continue to level my character and explore more features than delve into the story, which is usually an important feature to me. The characters held no value, and I didn't grow attached to any of them. Most of them didn't hang around long, and disappeared soon after you talked to them. No replay value at all, either. The graphics were meh, and seemed as if no one had put any thought into it. Yeah, sure, just throw some anime girls around! I'm sure everyone will just love it even though they barely have any relevance to the game. Even the loading screens had me ticked off. Everything was just so...so...cutesy! Add that to the obvious neglect, and you've got something that I wouldn't go near even if my life depended on it. Really, you're lucky I even played two hours of this♥♥♥♥♥♥ Animations were a mess, I've got to tell you. They weren't specialized for each class, and oftentimes the weapons would phase into your character as you moved. This was especially apparent when trying the oh-so-nifty animation previews in the process of character creation, and everything just seems so sloppy and undone. I mean, if you're going to even add classes, at least make them unique! I didn't even recount the various other areas that needed some serious work, and this is already a problem that would turn many people off on the game. Going off of the previous paragraph, the classes were pretty underdeveloped as well. As said before, the animations for the character were everywhere. The classes had no distinguishing features besides cool weapons that barely had any relevance to fighting style. Really, you just spam the various powers and the monster goes down. To put an emphasis on weapons and such, you have to have some depth to it. This game felt empty, plastic. Imitation, you could say. You would think they would be catering to the little kids out there, as it most certainly feels childish compared to other games of this sort. I didn't like any of the things that were most unfortunately added to the game, and would rather just go to sleep then stay up all night playing this game, as you know all of us gamers love to do.This is a game that hides beneath the smooth cover. Don't even try playing this if you're in it for a good story or a unique combat or ranking system. Better to leave it alone, I say.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
												The terrain doesn't work / you can walk over anything or clip into walls or buildings, except for places blocked by an invisible wall, they are everywhere. As for the graphics, it' old WoW style but in anime world, not 2015 next gen stuff, It'd be ok if it would be a game from 2008. The sound effects are poor, or nonexistent. The game often refuses to play sound while I talk over Skype. The whole thing is full of bugs. The actual gameplay is point and click with WASD movement, like any other classic mmo. You can progress quickly between the levels by completing the same sets of quests on different maps. It is really boring. You do get a "pet" at the start that you can talk to to some extent which is nice. This could be the sole reason to play this but getting the cool ones is impossible unless you have turbo luck(which you don't), a lot of cash(you could spend that on a better game) or you're planning on playing for like half a year(y u cereal?!).  For the first few hours the models were actually cute, all 20 of them. Later they get recolors or resizes to keep the game fresh and new.The Very Positive user reviews is a joke. Feel free to play this just for the cute anime style and silly fanboys. Just dont expect to get a satisfying gameplay experience.One more thing is that it's an Aeria Games title. That basically means that the content is years  behind the original (Frontier Online), the cash shop is expensive and the game urges you to spend cash for everything. For the small amount of PvP it has (no open pvp just arena and duel), you'll be flattened without a heavily buffed character, which you acquire the same way as eidolons(the pets). I reached level 60 in two days. I wasn't satisfied by the end of it. Decided to just drop this thing after reading guides on how to get them eidolons or even gold, because quests sure won't give you much(yes the market IS broken).So just don't play this if you want to play an MMO. Do it for the cute girls. I wouldn't recommend spending a cent of a jar of air for this and I'm pitiful for playing 5+ hours with it. Yeah...

Quick SummaryA localized MMORPG whose core gameplay consists of clicking a quest and watching your character do everything.Purchase Verdict:  Free, but not worth tryingPoints of Interest-Mechanics are extremely basic and most likely built for casual gamers. I personally don't find it fun to click a quest title, and watch my character follow an invisible line, beat up enemies, and collect items all on its own. However, you CAN do this on your own, manually.-Art style is decent-Community seems fairly large-Cluttered UI and a confusing system overall

content:
Posted: January 31
												Level 1:  100 missions of kill 14 Whatevers, Collect 20 Bear asses.Level 60: 100 missions of kill 14 Whatevers, Collect 20 Bear asses.EDIT:  Perhaps I wasn't being harsh enough with my review. ...Hold on :  Not my idea of fun. If you like wasting time with friends with an utterly unimpactful MMO footprint where nothing you do ingame matters. It's literally 450 fetch quests per region. (~15 NPCs//region * 30 quests each(15 ``kill 14 Whatevers``, 15 ``Collect Human Feces``)). - - - - - - 100% of enemies in this game are bullet-sponges. Let that slow-pacedness sink in for a moment  - - - - - -And you can't go to a new region until you've utterly rinsed your current one of the above fetch quests. Maybe if the fetch quests were skippable they wouldn't be so _readily apparent_ .  Maybe half(or more) of them should get replaced with things that are more interesting... Unless this game engine is too primitive for anything but fetch quests. :P-- -- -- -- --After a week and a half of _this_ . I decided I'd [[[refuse to do any endgame content]]]  as I assume it's just going to be as boring as the ~65,536 fetch quests I grinded. (First impressions are not something you screw with ^_^   )There is one good point though:This game is the rare exception where the [[[dialogue boxes are THEMED]]] instead of using the generic uncustomized ``unreal MMO`` layout.  The dialogue boxes put the characters front-and-center with large, easy to read text. ----Most MMOs decide to leave this GUI _COMPLETELY UNCUSTOMIZED AND UNTHEMED_ often with small, hard to read 6-pt font out in the corner. So hurray for Aura Kingdom ! !Utterly forgettable THOUSAND-PART storyline. Might as well not have one at all. .... Or try splitting it into ```one-day-of-gameplay``` episodes with chapters or even ending credits so that the story is easy to comprehend.this MMO also uses click-to-go quests, for shame. Even moving to quest-givers is automated

content:
Posted: July 8, 2014
												I had high hopes for this game, but upon release I found that they were swiftly crushed.- The games movement mechanics are awkward, most of the times I left clicked to move, my character wouldn't stop if I clicked somewhere else or targeted a monster.- The skills are pretty but the leveling of skills is confusing, their level just seems to grow with no noticeable change in stats.- Like many others have stated, this game is pay-to-win, you can listen to npc conversations to get points for use in special shops, but you recieve so few points compared to prices of average shop items that you have to use real cash to purchase the ingame points. (Ex. one conversation gave 3 points / some shop items are in the 10k and 100k's)- Your character levels up and you get ATK points, which can increase damage, critical, or speed. The value changes every time you level, and the increase for the selected value is always minimal, about a 0.30% boost to attack speed, or a 0.15% boost to critical chance, or a 1 point damage boost. For now, horribly unbalanced.- Normal items like potions aren't too terribly expensive early on, but they do require a bit of grinding to get the coins.- I'll be honest, I had a lot more fun jumping on roof tops and sitting on the ocean floor taking screenshots than doing the quests or grinding. Your character doesn't say anything, you get narrative text that says what "you" did. (EX. "You apologize and ask for any way to make it up to her.") More or less, the conversations are just silly, one guy says his toast was going naked without the Jam you brought him. (You're a true hero.)This game needs a lot of improvement in my opinion, and I may come back to it after a few patches, but for now I'm done with Aura Kingdom. The only real high point for me was the adorable starting monsters, and that's not really enough for me.

content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
												I got this game becaus origonaly i thought "sure, why not its free" but now after have actualy played the game I can see this was a huge mistake. the first problem with the game is that It does not launch at the optimal settings for your computer like modern games normaly do, I had to go through the tutorial and character creation not being able to see anything because the game decided to launch in 800x600 resolution, causing the HUD to take up 99% of the screen also obstructing the tutorial and the initial dialouge which i missed because it was text only. The second thing wrong with the game is that you have almost no physical control over your character during missions, your character auto attacks and auto runs to the objective meaning if you are lazier than the nrmal video gamer you can sit thear eating popcorn whilel all you do is hit a button and watch your character play the game for you. The next thing that was wrong with this game was that I had picked a RANGED character, and the auto attack system made my character litteraly go up to the boss and stand 2 cm from it and start shooting while the boss sat there and slapped me in the face repeatedly. I attempted to manualy controll my character but my charcter wouldnt attack unless I pressed the "do everything for me" button and if I tried to maualy controll my character during combat he stopped attacking. Do not get this game it is a complete and utter waste of time.

content:
Posted: November 17, 2014
												"Fun, polished, and addictive experience - MMORPG"Fun, maybe if they did the other two. Ten minutes into the game I find myself frustrated with an intrustive UI that I cannot customize. The game does let you attempt to customize, but no matter what you do, all elements of the UI will remain on your screen. From the oversized chat box, to the microtransaction and reward-addiction pop ups.Polished not very well if it was. I had been given a first time log in gift. But I'm unable to use it for several levels. Why? Now its sitting in my inventory taking up space and I have to deal with log in pop ups every time I log in? No thanks. Character models were clipping their "polished" animations and costumes. On top of that you cannot move while attacking, you cannot move faster than a snails pace, and I had no interaction with the Eidelon pet that I was eager to meet. Instead I was thrust into a WoW clone quest event chain.In summary, I uninstalled this shoddy MMORPG wannabe before I wasted more of my time.
