number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												My review:Anyone who DOES NOT LIKE ANIMEE or is coming to this from World Of Warcraft, then DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME!...Your still here? Good, then let's discuss this great game.The Good Points:(Please note, if i need to explain something indepth, i will do at the bottom of the review... You will tell if i am explaining something in depth because it will be bracketed with [.]) It's animee (I lOVE animee)Fast leveling [in the begining]Eidlons [Battle companions] [Quick access to mount][Auto Route]SKill and stat heavy [could also be a bad point]Auto level system [if you wish]The Bad points:[Auto Route]Fast leveling [in the begining]Eidlons [Battle companions][Quick access to mount]Skill and stat heavy [could also be a good point]Auto level system [if you wish]Now the explinations...Why have i listed ever good point as a bad point? Because this game nis like *marmite* (literally) [Fast leveling explained]: Ok, someone coming from WoW or another famous MMO will play this game for 10-15 minutes and already be level 12 and feel over-powered... That all changes from level 20+... you will start to realise that it becomes a heavy grind after 25 (taking up to 45 minutes just to gain a single level... unless you have an exp booster, or exp heay gear) Where some might love the fast levels, other people wont... where some will love the long levels, other people wont.Eidlons [Battle companions]: ok, once you get to about level 4-5 you will have a blue orb follow you, this eventually turns into your battle companion (the one you chose to team up with at character creation)... This is good because depending on your class choice your Eidlon will complement it (THATS WHAT THEY ARE FOR so choose wisely... example: If your class doesn't have any stars (or very minimal stars) in health then choose the pink flying eidlon, as she will heal you over time... The bad points with eidlons is you HAVE TO LEVEL THEM UP (it wont do it for you).... some people think they are over-powered when they get to high levels (you fight a mob... you only get a single hit in before your eidlon does a *Smack-down* on it...), you have to interact with your eidlon (ask it things) for *Link Points*, (liks are good), if you link with your eidlon you have a % of recieveing eidlon food or upgradeable *stones* (please play the game for more info ;)[Quick access tgo mount]: THIS IS NOT WoW!!!!Ok... this is a double edged sword... you get your mount (every one in the game does) at about level 3-4... its an osterich!!! (lolz) the bad thing about this is the fact that its universal (everyone in the game gets it at the same level... you dont even have to work for it!(you get it from a quest)) Its also slow as hell!!! (maybe 5% faster than walking IMHO)... Good points? Its FREE and... it's a MOUNT :D[Auto Route]:Why is ths bad?/Why is this good?Ok its good for these reasons... You have a quest? You're lost in the wilderness/you have to go to the other side of the world to do it? WHY THE HELL ARE YOU COMPLAINING? just left click the quest you want on you quest list and ZING... Auto piolet!!!.. this means you can chat... roll a ciggy... look on google, download more games etc while you get to where you need to be.Why is this bad?Ok... i will list the reasons I think its bad:Its bad because it will speed you through tonnes of mobs that could give you exp... you can't explore on your own with it enabled, there is no option to turn it off (however, independant movement will cancel this feature... all you have to do is click the quest again and.... ZING!!!)[Skill and stat Heavy]:Not everyone's *Cup of tea*ok, let's say your a duelist... you need crit and speed/evasion above anything else?... That's ok, because every piece of armor that drops is 95% class apparent (most of the quests will only give you armour/weapons for your class) Go figure...When using the stat/power system you have to make sure that you spend 99% of it on crit/speed/evasion (in THAT ORDER) or you will fail as a duelist (that's my personal oppinion)Auto Leveling Sytem [If you wish]:This will not be for everyone!at least its a choice... when you are leveling up your stats you have a choice for it to do all the hard work for you (it will auto allocate stat points if you ask it to) or whether or not you want to be a confused *Nab* and fail with your class (you will only use this feature for about 5 levels, and then you will get the idea)My reveiew is almost done:Me personally, i got this game when i couldn't afford to pay for WoW once, and it got me hooked.I feel that almost everyone is on an even footing in this game (ofc there is going to be someone bigger/faster/stronger/betetr than you, its an MMO! But it doesn't penalize you for being a noob as much as WoW or any similar game would.I know my reveiw is very mixed, but thats the point... i am not telling you to * Buy/not buy* this game based on a one-sided/biased *This game is rubbish don't get it/ This game is amazing, get it now!!!* you deserve to know the truth when thinking about playing a game :DAll i will say in endorsing this game :D :D.... It's free to play!!! (but its also P2W... NOT HEAVILY btw!!!! But it is P2W... although you can do it as F2P but it is a grind... and that... IS THE POINT!)laters(End Note:)Why is this game not in my active library? its because i forgot my password and had to make a new account :Doverall i would give this game an easy 8.5/10

number of helpful: 5 of 15 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 12, 2014
												Yes, yes and a thousand times YES. This game might not look like much at first glance but it is extremely fun.  The xp curve makes it enjoyable to quest and level up. No extensive points of mindless grinding to get to that next level. 55+ begins the challenge though and is the test of how well you pace yourself though. The community is amazing. Just about everyone you meet in the game is super nice and super helpful.  the character customization I will say could use a little sprucin up, give us more variety with hair and face, maybe even body styles. But their coming along with their costumes. People say this game is 'pay to win' which honestly is not the case. Yes, I've spent money on the game because I want to. You don't have to. The game offers you not only chances in game to earn cash shop items butthey make it insanely easy to earn what they call loyalty points which can be used to buy cash shop items from their loyalty shop. All in all, wonderful game.  Nice core gameplay, good community, and lots to do to keep you entertained.

number of helpful: 2 of 9 people (22%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 2, 2014
												It's pretty much any generic MMO. Nothing new or crative. The story is meh, and any immersion there was would be gone just by making a character. Non-spoiler aleart, you don't get rid of your Eldion, since you picked it at character creation.Delve into a world where you're the hero (typical) and doing story after story quest chain. Better off being a single-player with co-op function game instead of a MMO.UI is clutterful, crafting hastingly shoves in your face while uncertain of how to get certain materials. Only thing that's different is fishing, which pretty much is the only thing that adds any difficulty in the game at all.It's good for a time killer once or twice but beyond that it's nothing to put several hours in...Also, bot infested. If you see male, red head, blue wearing, grenadiers with a blond Eldion, it's a bot.-----Check out more games I see that deserve more attention from my curator group:BluePaw's Underrated Games ListJoin and/or follow if you wish.

												Can't get this game to even work.  Just installed in and keep getting server failed to connect (2).  My internet is fine I just downloaded the whole game.  My firewall I allowed this game through.  I patched it and even ran full software checks twice.  Checked for server maintenance...nope.  Yeah this game must be broke.  Game does in fact boot up and gives me full load bar but when it gets to the main screen it just shows me an error.  It's F2P so I will just uninstall it from my computer and promptly forget it exists.*Edit* 6/7/2015  Tried again many months (10) later to play this game.  The game loads up fine but gives me the same message that it did all those months ago.  Splash screen starts up fine.  A box pops up which is most likely a browser window and gives *success* green bar and then disappears.  The game itself loads and I see the intro game town and music.  At this point I would expect some sort of login but all I get is a box that says failed to  connect to server (2) and a button when clicked kills the game.  Even though it normally is a security risk, I disabled anything that might conflict with outgoing traffic including firewalls in the hopes that it is some blocked port setting or some such.  No luck.  I have swept my PC for any malware of any kind.  No issues.  My connectivity is solid and I can load up not only websites in any browser but also can play other MMO games with the exact same PC, no issues.  Just can't seem to get this game going.

content:
Posted: November 18, 2014
												Autopilot : The Game.If you like an MMORPG where you can be a cute animu grill AND manage to not use your keyboard for a few hours, then this is the game for you! Seriously, though, when you get a quest, you can click the quest objective and the game literally takes you there; it holds your hand several steps beyond quest markers. Not just that, but it auto-mounts you too, so you don't even need to do that! Plus you have a companion that will wind up doing all the attacking for you!Honestly, if the game didn't need you to click the next quest objective once in a while, you could probably leave it running overnight and wake up as max level.That being said, the gameplay's alright. The story's awful and it plays like a generic MMORPG, but considering it's free...not bad.Still, though, I would suggest not wasting your time with this.

content:
Posted: July 4, 2014
												TL;DR: I uninstalled this game after an hour of playing.. or looking around for sources of sounds. Very buggy game that made me restart/launch many times. Nothing interesting or new in this game - click and kill. Weird beeping noises when you press buttons - makes you jump and think it's from real life. Once I thought it was coming from my PC because the sound is localized in one side of my headphones so it didn't sound like it was coming from the game... I honestly panicked and thought my PC was going to blow up. The second time, I thought it was my dog crying... it wasn't until 30 minutes later, I realised it was the game. When I first loaded the game, it had a white box with no "exit" button on the top corner. I had to exit the launcher 4 times before it finally loaded with my account. When I finally did get into it, half my interface was broken, could not see my xp bar, my bags, and when I did press the shortcuts for them, it made an "error" sound - which I happened to get a lot of during the entire hour I was in the game. The NPC chat boxes would pop up for a bit but once I moved my mouse, it would disappeared. I restarted the game and everything was fix cept the error noises and random beeping. I got to the first town, quests that required 'delievery' was quite confusing and had me stumped often. My map was still not showing up no matter how many times I pressed 'M'. Relaunched the game. Map finally decided to show up after 2 restarts.Combat, very subpar, just clicking and shooting, nothing interesting other than watching your projectiles fly and hit a monster and their HP bars goes down. The screenshots in the store looks very beautiful and has crisp artwork but the game didn't really have that aspect. I looked for it and I could not find anything as nice as the screenshots. I actually wanted to take screenshots myself of my own character and be proud that something so pretty was in my steam gallery. The characters, however, were very cute... I give them that. At this point, I thought that this game was probably made 10 years ago. I took a break and tried to give it another go since I was quite excited about the game and it took a chunk out of my data allowance to download, 10 minutes, I logged off and uninstalled.

number of helpful: 3 of 15 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 4, 2014
												This is a very first impression, I managed to play the game for 30 minutes before I had seen enough.The game doesn't run smoothly on my 4 gb ram, 2nd gen i5 processor, and 2gb NVIDIA video card laptop, even with the video settings turned down. This is the result from poor game design as other higher-end MMORPG's like guild wars 2 run fine. The game feels unresponsive and clunky, the minimap icons jump around when you move, and the camera panning isn't alinged with the cursor speed, resulting in having to move your mouse back into position after you move the camera if your mouse sensitivity is any higher than default.The game itself looks nice enough if you can get over the standard kawaii boob-showing female characters that always tend to come with these kind of games. There is a wide variety of classes to pick from, ranging from your standard healers, buffers, tanks and dps that are designed for late-game PvE to several classes that focus on either melee or ranged AoE attacks that are likely designed for taking on larger groups of monsters to maximize leveling speeds.The microtransaction system seems to be very ariagames-like. You will get a daily reward consisting of xp boosts and the like that you can use fom lvl 20 and up, and if you require more than that, or other luxury items like extra fast mounts or armor upgrades (call this pay to win if you like), you will have to pay real money for this.

Do you like to be immersed in rich fantasy worlds? Do you like dynamic, well-written characters? Do you like to play video games? Then this isn't the game for you! Yes, this can hardly be called a game at all. Its the most useless fetch-quest production I've ever had the displeasure of wasting time on. I reccommend this game to people who hate themselves, hate games, and weeb out over stupid♥♥♥♥♥♥ 10/10 best of its class.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
												I've played a bit more than Steam says I have because I played before it came to steam.Anyway, I've spent countless hours playing P2P MMORPGs over the last few years. I've played everything from Star Wars Galaxies, Everquest, Star Wars: The Old Republic, to the Elder Scrolls Online. One of the biggest parts of playing a game such as an RPG is the story and immersion, as well as fluidity. Aura KIngdom does a great job at both of these.The game tells some interesting stories if you care to pay attention to them (there is a "Skip" option for dialogues). If you don't, you can still pick up some of what's going on around you. While most quests are "Kill X of Y and return to me," there is still meaning to what you're doing. The second thing I mentioned was fluidity. Aura Kingdom is very simple and polished. It didn't take long to pick up on the game and it's concepts. Within a few days, I was able to explain the game to newer players like I was a vet. Overall, it's a very good game; and it's free to play! There are countless hours you can get out of it, and it's worth your time. I've used it as a great escape from large, P2P MMOs and still play it today!

												I really enjoyed it. I had some issues playing this on windows 8, but I still had fun. They are releasing plenty of good items and summons and give everyone a chance to get them. Most things in the item shop are pretty cheap, but some things are a bit overpriced. All in all, it's a pretty good game and I plan to play again.Edit: Supposedly, I got blocked after taking an extended break from the game. I played the game for quite a while so needed a break. I took time to play many other games I needed/wanted to beat, as well as concentraiting on things like my writing. Then, I go back to Aria Games website to login in, and couldn't. Thought I forgot my password after all this time. So, I go to try to reset password. That's when it says that my account is blocked. I've spent plenty of money on this game and find it rediculous that they'd find taking a break from the game as a reasonable excuse to block me.If they fix this issue of theirs, I will change back to a yes for recommendation. But until then, It will be staying a negative for me.Edit 2: Gave the thumbs up back. They replied quickly and reactivated my account.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
												As someone who has been playing MMORPG's for a while, let me just say that this game is different from most other MMORPG's I've played, including F2P ones, but it won't be for everyone. While I personally enjoyed it, it's a very niche game, although arguably one that could appeal to a wider audience than most other "anime MMO's."Pros:1. BEAUTIFUL graphics. Cel-shaded, looks just like an anime.2. Not difficult at all. Can get very grindy at endgame, but casual players will have an easy time getting into it.3. Loyalty points manage to avoid the dreaded 'pay to win' label, though IRL is obviously a faster way to get item mall stuff.4. Very friendly playerbase. 5. Never seen any particularly bad bugs, though I'm sure they're out there.6. Eidolons are awesome. They range from being adorable to downright scary-looking, and are the best take on pets I've seen since SWTOR's companion characters. They each have their own personalities, and some of the conversations are hilarious.7. Kill-stealing and ninja-looting is virtually impossible, since anyone who hits a monster gets credit for the kill.Cons:1. If anything, it could be TOO easy. Hardcore players could scoff at the global cooldown being the only real way to prevent spamming skills, since there's no mana bar.2. "Fortune packs" earned the nickname "scam packs" for a reason. The rate of getting a good item/costume from them are abysmally low. 3. Endgame is VERY grindy. Levels 1-40 is a breeze that you can literally do in one day, but it gets painfully grindy once you hit 55.4. Bots are everywhere, and I mean EVERYWHERE. But at least they can't actively interfere with quests/monster-killing (see pro 7). Only the gold-spammers really get on my nerves.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
												I give it 4 out of 5 if I had a choice. One of the better one's I've played, alone or with others.Pros:   Cute and Pretty - Even the "naked" Girl Costume has pretty pink panties.   Rewarding for No Effort (Instant Gratification)   Solo Story - While this game is NOT a Single-player game/RPG it's story is setup to read like one   Solo Play - While this game has certain events that are not preformable without a Team, these are limited to dailies and such for the most part.   Buffs on Multiple Levels - In this game you can buff yourself just by using your attacks, which is nice for me because I tend to forget to use my buffs in the first place otherwise. You can have a buff for example that heals and boosts attacks along with adds a stack of "buffing" channels (UI Has upto 2 unique meters for a buff per character/class from what i've seen)Cons:   To be fair it's alittle *too easy* for a long time, and by the time things start getting challenging they start getting impossible ( bad habit of MMOs Right? ) An Example of this is: Until level 40ish the game is pretty quest driven and fast, but after 40 things open up to "challenge" the players skill, imo these were designed for a different game than the main storyline, because as soon as you get to the first sub-boss in one of these "hell" mode dungeons (which btw I was 20 levels too high for so it should've been a cinch) as a single char you can just barely heal enough to keep you alive without doing anything else - Definitely Calls for a party, much like other MMOs.  Also it can be alittle hard to work with a "Team of friends" early on, because alot of the Mainline Quest Instances are only solo-able, and CANNOT let a party in - if you try to go in as a group you each get split into your own instance - Which is pretty annoying and kinda confusing considering the map icons for your party members show up but their characters don't.  Also the channel system may be a little different than your used to, instead of having totally seperate "Channels" the Maps are linked as a party minimap icon whether your in the same channel or not. The good news is the game displays which channel they are on if you mouse-over a party members health bar - so tracking people down outside of instances shouldn't be too much of a problem. Also Where are the @$#@ Dyes?! - I see all these menu's and tutorials referring to dying costumes but they don't seem to be anywhere, not even in the item mall.Overall:   Cute & Easy & Mood = WIN.  Challenge & Players & Bugs = LOSE  4 out of 5

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												A very PVE based game. Athough this game is huge with many daily activities to do this game can be vary casual. Often times I find myself using anyskill that was not on cooldown, and with the autowalk that has been provided I tend to always alt+tab out of the game and occupy myself with unrelated actavities. This game can be somewhay pay to win, because with its bonuse stats on costumes. The better costumes can only be bought with AP, their real mony currency. However, they had added loyalty points so you can buy boxes to get a CHANCE of obtaning the item you want. Yes, like other aeria games they uphold their gambaling policy. Although this game can be fun at times the game gets boring very fast, and with the Aeria Game cash shop modal as it is, the game is depressing to play knowing that you will have a CHANCE to get what you want after months of grinding.Overall this game was a filler game for me nothing more, but I did find the joy of trying to get a new Eidolon after 100+ hours........Not really.

												ive had hard times staying interested in games liek this, Arche age, firefall, Wildstar, a few others but jsut the whole genre of MMORPG, this is the first that i actually find easy enough for me a casual MMO'er and yet interesting enough to keep me and my ravaging ADD tuned into it, leveling doesnt feel grindy to me, unlike Archeage where its a TOTAL Grindfest. this makes things easy by having the choice to click your objective and the char auto runs to it, ooooo my god that is my saving grace, it feels liek im going sooo fast through the game and yet i look at how many towns ive been to and its only been 2 but it doesnt feel like ive been running in circles. i often get lost in the other MMOs with lack of clear direction and sheer super size of the hold the W key running across lands, yes its fun running into creaturesa and all that but sometimes you jsut wanna play through the story and get through it without feeling liek there is nothing comming at the end of all the grind, the grinding here leaves it where you dont need to do all the filler stuff, or rather you dont feel liek youve done it when you have hahah besides... its anime !!!

content:
Posted: February 17, 2015
												It's got a fun storyline and has decent graphics. It's not mind blowing on any level. It's your typical tab spam keys mmorpg. I'm not a big fan of anime style games but this one is not as annoyingly cartoony as some of the others like Fiesta. I've played for about 3 days at the time of this review and am already at lvl 45 without much effort.It's a perfect game if you really just want to play something that doesan't require too much effort.*EDIT*Played for about a week now and leveled a Necromancer/Scythe to lvl 60 with no need for cash shop items. I did purchase some cash shop items for the 1st time buyers special which gives you a pretty sweet Fire Tiger mount and some xp scrolls among other things. The things you buy in the cash shop can be sort of confusing, it seems like your going to get some sweet stuff but then you realize that your chance of actually getting the premium items is VERY small. You mostly get regular items that drop in game on their own all the time. So in my opinion the cash shop items are just not worth it. You can also get these items in Navea at player stals for regular gold. Most of them are overpriced but better than spending real money. The player community is very silent and the game is riddled with bots, most likely gold farmers. Gold farmers also spam your mailbox on a daily basis with no way to block them. While it's annoying it's not game breaking. For an MMORPG there is little player to player interaction. Guilds are silent. Did I mention the bots?I'm still having a lot of fun playing and I think that I will level another class after I have finished lvling this character. The games pacing is very fast so you don't really get too familiar with the games many areas. Although after lvl 60, exp drops to a crawl even with the many 20% exp scrolls you'll get in game.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2016
												This MMO isn't too bad, actually! I'm really enjoying it so far.Some of the music is repetitive--but I don't really keep the music on when I'm playing MMOs, to be honest. The beginner quests also feel repetitive and rather annoying. I just want to go out and explore, man, learn and play on my own accord.I personally dislike the combat system--most MMOs have a RMB/LMB option for basic attacks--this one just uses hotkeys (1, 2, 3...). You have plenty of classes to choose from, though!The enemies are adorable, and while the character customization isn't wonderful, it's still alright, I guess. It's got some cute options. I'm not entirely sure what to think about the armor / "costume" (I think it's called costume?) options, to be honest. But eyyy, whatever, I guess.Overall IMO it's p chill, a nice little MMO to tack on the side.

content:
Posted: June 4, 2015
I strongly recommend this game; good graphics, fun, good classes and quests, etc.I started playing this game before I downloaded it on Steam. Back then, it was confusing and the gameplay was VERY different, and I quit after a few hours of playing. The game offered little to no tutorial back then, but now it's pretty easy to figure things out by just clicking keys and a tutorial is given.The gameplay is solid with a good amount of quests and content. The classes are amazing. The graphics are great for anime style RPGs (And trust me... I have played a lot of them; Ex: Onigiri, Elsword, etc). The gameplay maps are extremely well put together, and I can only imagine the hours poured into make such intricate maps. The game follows basic RPG systems but the skill map was something I've not really seen (which I love as it allows you too customize your character 100% to your liking).The game is overall VERY good, but there are a few draw backs; mainly the battling system. The battling system is super easy to use, but I feel like all you really have to do is spam your special abilities to win. And, you can use them just about every 3 seconds. I hope this helps. :)

content:
Posted: June 8, 2015
												                                                 WARNING: this is a bit of a long read but is very detailed.So I have just over 100 hours into this game and I believe that it is time to make a review.I'll split this into a few categories, controls, quests, playerbase, graphics/gameplay, overall, end game and a verdict1) Controls: the movement is a bit weaird starting off, instead of your standerd WASD keys to move and the QE keys to strafe its QWE to move and AD to stafe I found it it a bit weird at first but got used to it quite fast, im not sure if you can change the key bindings but it wasnt too much of a bother, your attacks are quite basic as most mmo's, use the 1-8 keys to use diffrerent skills and there is an auto attack but its weak and doest do much, there are 2 more sets of hotbar keys by combinding the 1-8 keys with ALT or CTRL but i perfer right-clicking them, also you can fly (or glide I shoud say)2) Quests: quests are as basic as they get, usually quite dry and straight forward, theres even the option to click your quests and your character will automaticly go towards it for you witch kinda takes away from the intensity (but thats just me), there are a few quests that let you take control of another character in the main story, witch is kinda cool, but its not too much and  you probley wont remember it too much as it is very basic, run towards here or like kill 2 guys or whatever, now there is a surplus of side quests, most are basic and casual.3) Playerbase: very quiet and as most said theres a bot problem, as far as size goes, its ok I guess, you will run into people daily (at least I did), but i'll let you be the judge4) Graphics and gameplay: I did add the 2 to the same category because I feel the 2 go hand-in-hand and heres why, the graphics are pretty good, a cutsy anime style and thats ok, It gets the job done but if the graphics are good and the gameplay sucks its a waste of effort, to me its gameplay over graphics, fortunately the gameplay is good, fast and rewarding, theres is a total of 12 playable classes and at level 40 you get to choose a secondary weapon giving the game high replayablity. 5) Overall: and finally we reach a overall, I did give this game a hard time but I fell you guys reading this need to know the whole truth, now is this game bad? no! its quite good actually and as angry joe said mmo's are about gamplay over everything else, now the devlopers are very quiet and there hasnt been an update since lord knows when I also wanna touch up on armor and weapons, armor isnt visable you need a costume to change the way you look, theres also other things like fishing that is like a minigame in of itself but it gets boring and you will probely resort to leaving him there for a few hours and let him do it himself, now is this PTW? no! and thank god too!6) Endgame: theres quite a bit but mainly saidequests and a few doungons but at level 65 you get to do the sky temple, witch as rare loot but is quite hard and can only do it at key times of the day.7) Verdict: and now we reach the end of my review, now i'm gonna give it a thumbs up because I feel this game is worth a try at least and its free, so what are you losing, I recomend this game to people who want to try an mmo, to me this is a great starting point for newcomers to the world of mmo's.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												Aura Kingdom, a world, a beautiful world. It is true that the graphics and animations of few things could be better, but the world is still a complete world. There is a great variety of monsters and creatures with many different locations, that are completely different from one another. The weapon systems is incredible, a true MMORPG ANIME weapon system with 8 or more class types that can later get a secondary class that gives access to incredible dual class ultimate combos. Each class is granted a really big amount of different looking weapons that can be enhanced to the point that they can even glow and radiate energy. The costumes, mounts, accessories are so awesome, with variety and cool looking animations such as lightnings and black lightnings. Finally this game introduces an interesting concept: the Eidolons, fighting spirits that go to battle at your sides and never leaving you alone in you discovery of the Aura World. There are many of them, really awesome looking and really strong. Getting them is hard, making a big challenge for you that will keep you busy in the game. Oh, did i forgot to mention that your character is given a whole list of crazy good looking skills fitting your class types. A whole world, a lot of fun, a lot of players to talk to, a lot of guilds to join and fight with or against, a lot of bosses and monsters that won't go easy on you, a lot of colors, weapons, items, armors, a lot of "a lot". Play it and discover the true meaning of Anime MMORPG. ♠Have fun, play that game, make friends to rely on and to help♠Grades:Graphisms - 16/20Gameplay - 18.5/20Variety - 19.25/20Content - 18.5/20Life lasting - 18.5/20 Player animation - 18/20NPCs to Player and NPCs to story animations -15/20Story text display  - 13/20Story - 17/20Daily/Weekly Events amounts - 19/20Daily/Weekly Events Interest - 19/20Overall: 18/20

												I have played Aura Kingdom for a few weeks and it was a very entertaining MMORPG with fun combat.But first thing I need to get out of the way is do not use Aeriagames item shop the company is a scam if you buy something you will not receive it and then if you try to contact them they will make you wait days for a response and then make excuses and you will still receive nothing. I honestly never seen such a big company run such a petty scam.Now back to the Aura Kingdom review the game is great up until you hit level 60 then the game changes alot and it becomes a tedious daily grind of dailies to level up and make gold to buy gear. Also the dailies use the same 2-3 dungeon maps so it becomes insanely boring fast. The combat is still good but the grind is just too much and the reuse maps and Aeriagames being a scam company I cannot recommend this game to anyone.

content:
Posted: June 16, 2015
												I was looking for a good Anime-Based Art Style MMORPG that was also free and I honestly thought one didn't exsist that was free. Then I found this game, Aura Kingdom. I was skeptical at first having barely reached the minimal running requirements(Yes, my computer is pretty bad) and thought that the game only looks amazing with maximum graphics. But, anyway, I downloaded it and expected the worst. Knowing my computer, I turned everything to the bare minimum. I was shocked the game still looked amazing. How the game is played and various classes/character customization made the game fun and enjoyable. If you think you computer can simply run it, give this game a try you wont regret it. (I am not responsable for any let downs)

Posted: June 4, 2015
												It is a very good game, well made, and very much entertaining.though it has a major flaw of when you use to many actions at once, or stop during some actions, it bugs up and you cant jump,attack,do any actions at all, except from calling your pet and let it fight monsters that attack you, and you cant exit game because the escape button wont open the menu.So I gotta tap the game down and exit it by rightclicking the game icon.if Aura Kingdom gets fixed on that one issue, I would not expect me to quit this game any time soon.as it is I am considering it.. However, Good game otherwise, Thumbs up! (Y)

												I LOVE anime style. This is so cute and I love the outfits. The only thing that stinks is that when you try to give your character a name you have to go through a lot of possibilities because you can only have a name used once. The computer screen can get a little cramped with things like chat window (which I don't use and can't get rid of) and like a small map and  your attack options.
